86501.name: EABAlite
rpghonor: 2006 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up
86501.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 15 page "test drive" version of the EABA, enough to build adventurers, run combats, use powers and get a feel for the full system before you decide to buy. Don't let the plain cover fool you, that just makes it easier to print.

And if you already have EABA, it's a great handout to give to new players so they have something to familiarize themselves with the system.

86502.name: Bastides & Bulettes
86502.description:
User Summary:

A one-page RPG dedicated to Gary Gygax. This is a stripped down game, excluding even attribute values, in which only a character's level and equipment drives their ability to succeed.

Along with the rules needed to play the game, the author manages to squeeze in four classes, an equipment list, stats for monsters, magic items, spell lists, a mini-adventure (with map), and the complete text of the OGL (version 1.0a). And all on one side of A4, and legible.

86503.name: Discovered Lore
86503.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discovered Lore contains six new playable races for your Warrior, Rogue & Mage campaign. Smash your foes as a hulking Mountain Giant or explore the depths of the oceans as a member of the ancient merfolk. In addition to that this book provides you with new magic items and a set of sample characters that can be used as starting player characters or as NPCs.

86504.name: From the Imperial Forges 2
86504.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the Imperial Forges 2 contains 19 unique magical items for your WR&M game created by Colin Chapman.

86505.name: From the Imperial Library
86505.description:
From publisher blurb:

From The Imperial Library contains several variant magic systems, new and revised spells and talents. It’s the perfect supplement for players and GMs who want to turn WR&M’s magic to eleven!

86506.name: The Art of Combat
86506.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Art of Combat contains alternate armor rules, new talents and rules for dodging and parrying attacks which help you to make combats in WR&M even more exciting without adding too much complexity.

86507.name: Saint John's College of Abjuration
86507.description:
From "How to Use This Book:"

There are new spells, feats, subclasses of abjurer and special rules for playing abjurers of different races. All the new rules are interlaced within the text of the supplement. The Handbook itself is presented as pages of the book, as it would be presented to the students of the Academy. Game material is presented around the edges of these pages or in little boxes dotted around the handbook, such as this one.

Nothing within the Academy Handbook series is set in stone and many of our alternative rules are designed to give Games Masers new ideas rather than to allow players to build more powerful wizards. The setting has been designed as open and flexible so that it can be adapted to fit many campaign worlds. The game material is aimed mainly at players, so that they can build a more interesting Abjurer, or simply add more interesting abilities to their wizard or sorcerer.

86508.name: DarkLore Campaign Primer
86508.description:
From "How to Use This Book:"

This book introduces you to the world of Krynas and the DarkLore campaign setting. It provides you with all the basics to begin adventuring. Within you will find details of the player character races, basic classes and a beginning selection of career classes. There are new systems for skills, combat and to represent your character’s growing political influence. The world of DarkLore is introduced, and you are provided with brief introduction to the lands, peoples and powers of the world. Combined, this information should give you the bare minimum to begin adventuring in our world. Further supplements will cover the different areas of the continent of Krayn in greater detail, providing new classes and other game material alongside details of the major players and important locations of region. We will also unveil the story arc of the campaign, as the Cloak of Acheron descends upon the world. You will have the chance to play out the roles of the chosen heroes of your own fantasy novel, customising and shifting the story arc and moulding it to meet the needs of your own game.

86509.name: Forgotten Heroes: Paladin
86509.description:
From Introduction:

Using the ideas and rules presented in this sourcebook, players will be able to explore new options and capabilities for their characters, thus greatly enhancing their role-playing experience. In Paths of the Righteous sub-classes are introduced, allowing players to define and emphasise the focus of their paladin and enabling them to explore the often hidden depths of their character. The prestige classes presented in this chapter provide ways to specialise your paladin as they carve out their destiny. Both consider the nature of the paladin
within any fantasy world and discuss the variety to paladin philosophy, considering its importance in determining your character's place in the universe.

86510.name: Forgotten Heroes: Sorcerer
86510.description:
From Introduction:

Forgotten Heroes: Sorcerer follows Paladin as the second class sourcebook from Malladin’s Gate Press in the Forgotten Heroes line. Forgotten Heroes is dedicated to developing the less fashionable classes that are often ignored by other publishers. As sorcerers are a new class to the D20 system, they are often overlooked as being merely an alternative spellcasting mechanic to the more traditional ‘Vancian’ mechanic of the wizard class. As such, many supplements have been written for wizards, and indeed much of the material supplied, such as spells and other magic-related rules, can be used just as easily by the sorcerer class. However, we believe that this approach does the sorcerer a great disservice. The sorcerer class has a unique flavour of its own, that has been long overlooked. The sorcerer stands apart from the wizard in their approach not only to magic, but to life itself. The sorcerer is one of the true heroes of the fantasy genre. They are gifted and thrust into a
life of adventure by virtue of their destiny. Wizards, on the other hand, will most likely have chosen a life of adventure in order to further their learning and understanding of magic.

86511.name: Martial Avengers
86511.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Modern Heroes: Martial Avengers, the sourcebook for Strong and Fast Heroes in the D20 Modern roleplaying game. Within these pages you will find a wealth of new material designed to enhance your roleplaying experience. Underlying these new systems and options is a consideration of both the classes themselves and the dramatic themes they represent. New systems do not make characters any more powerful, but serve to expand and enhance the roleplaying experience by making new options available to players and GMs alike, to enable them to realise their concepts for heroes or villains.

86512.name: Inspecteur Lénigme
86512.description:
Two teams compete to solve enigmas writen upon cards. The less clues you use, the more points you score. A magnifying glass serves to reveal the anwers as well as a scoring pad.

Contents:
- A book of rules
- A big magnifying glass
- 75 cards printed on both sides (for a total of 150 enigmas to solve)

86513.name: Unearthed Adventurers Volume I
86513.description:
From Introduction:

This book is the first volume in a series from Malladin’s Gate Press introducing a number of new core classes for use in your D20 game. They are completely new classes that have as much flexibility in their design as fighters and rogues. In fact you will probably find that they are more flexible than many of the basic classes presented in Core Rulebook I. Each character class comes with complete descriptions of the new systems that bring them to life and the new feats and spells frequently used by these characters.

This book introduces three new core character classes: the cultist, the divine knight and the swordsman.

86514.name: Artifacts of Legend
86514.description:
From publisher blurb:

Artifacts of Legend contains 14 artifacts, that advance with those that wield them. Artifacts have from 10 to 30 levels of progression, following characters from their first levels into epic levels. This 64 page d20 supplement details new rules for artifacts, skills, feats, prestige classes and the stigma that govern the personalities of all artifacts.

Inside this book you will find:

14 artifacts with full color illustrations
Over a dozen new feats
2 prestige classes; the Steward of Legend and the Artifact Thrall
Rules breaking away from the old ego rules, called Stigma
New assisted skills

86515.name: Warhammer 40,000: Rites of War
86515.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Rites of War is a turn based strategy game based on the celebrated Panzer General 2 engine by SSI. It is set in the fictional Warhammer 40,000 universe. It was produced by Games Workshop in 1999, and centers around the invasion of a Tyranid Hive fleet and the Imperial efforts to defeat it.

Source: Wikipedia, "Warhammer 40,000: Rites of War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86516.name: Chaos League
86516.description:
Chaos League is a fantasy-based sports management game developed by Cyanide and published by Digital Jesters in 2004. The game is a fantasy spin-off of American Football, similar to Games Workshop's Blood Bowl, including fantasy races, magic and the ability to kill members of the opposing team. The game has also spawned an expansion entitled Chaos League: Sudden Death in 2005. The game also features elements of black humour like obscure character designs and comical commentary. The game uses the controversial StarForce copy prevention mechanism.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chaos League", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86517.name: Sword of Aragon
86517.description:
From the Amiga box back:

As the heir of the late Duke of Allada, it is your duty to fulfill your father's lifelong dream: Extend Allada's dominion and unite the entire Aragonian Empire under your banner.

This fantasy game gives you more than flashing swords and arcane sorcery. It is also a strategy game that requires plotting and planning if you are to win.
Raise and equip an army of bowmen, cavalry, infantry, mages and priests. Hire mercenaries if you must. Just remember that, even in a magical world, you still have to deal with the harsh realities of limited budgets and resources.
Lead your army against the demonic rulers of the Eastern Realms - while defending Allada against the plundering raids of Goblin hordes.
Move across the strategic map and zoom into the tactical map when it comes to battle against human and inhuman monsters. Your warriors, knights and rangers fight with swords, bows and lances while the priests and mages wield magic spells. You, however, must make the right decisions if your forces are to be victorious.

The task that lies ahead is daunting. But the rewards are great. Assemble your army wisely and campaigns with vigor. Imagine how glorious it will be to sit on the Emperor's Throne and call all of Aragon yours!

86518.name: Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume III, Wilderness to Nashville
86518.description:
User Summary:

Decisive Battles of the American Civil War (Vol III) recreates six important battles, including Wilderness, Spottsylvania, Cold Harbor, Atlanta, Franklin, and Nashville.

86519.name: Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume II, Gaines Mill to Chattanooga
videogamehonor: 1988 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-Twentieth Century Computer Wargame Nominee
86519.description:
User Summary:

Decisive Battles of the American Civil War (Vol II) recreates five important battles, including Gaines Mill, Stones River, Gettysburg, Chickamauga and Chattanooga.

86520.name: Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume I, Bull Run to Chancellorsville
86520.description:
From the game manual:

Decisive Battles of the American Civil War (Vol I) recreates
six important battles from the first years of the War
between the States.

There are 6 scenarios included with the Decisive Battles of
the American Civil War Vol I game. The First Bull Run
scenario (#1) is the tutorial and is highly recommended for
beginners. In order of increasing complexity, the other
scenarios are Shiloh (#2), Fredericksburg (#5), Second Bull
Run (#3), Antietam (#4) and Chancellorsville (#6).

86521.name: Outnumbered!
86521.description:
Outnumbered is a question and answer game that requires quick thinking and a little bit of luck!

What year did the Berlin Wall come down? Number of Van Gogh’s ears? Not only do you have to be the first person to answer the question correctly but you must have the dice to match! Players take turns reading and answering questions. Each player rolls their own set of dice using the numbers rolled to answer the questions. Correctly answered questions earn points; some are harder and award more points than others. Be the player with the most points to win!

With 750 questions and 60 dice

(from Manufacturer's site)

86522.name: Number Ninjas
86522.description:
Ninjas prepare to be challenged! The Golden Dragon has been discovered and you must be the first to reach its location. To reach the ancient artifact, each ninja will have to travel through four areas: a bamboo forest, an ancient Japanese village, the cave of elders and a koi pond. To move throughout these locations, ninja players roll one of two sets of dice and solve the number challenge rolled.

The skill level of each player determines which set of dice that ninja will use the basic set of dice includes addition and subtraction; the advanced set of dice includes addition, subtraction and multiplication. In each of the four locations, ninjas will solve a word challenge, once all four challenges have been successfully completed, the ninja player makes his way to the Golden Dragon and the win!

But don’t be fooled, the life of a ninja is never as easy as it looks, while moving throughout the lands other ninjas will try to trap you and block your way to the Golden Dragon, you must defend yourself while using your smarts and turn the traps on them!

The box includes: 3 Ninja Recruit dice, 3 ninja master dice, game board, 4 ninja pawns, 12 quest items, 3 traps, the Golden Dragon, 80 ninja challenge cards, and EASY to follow rules!

86523.name: Pirates and Traders
86523.description:
Source: The Game Website.

The year is 1650. You and your crew have just arrived in the Carribean sea. It is time to set sail for glory or a watery grave. Pirates and Traders is a single-player strategy/role-playing game for Android. Sail around the Carribean sea to buy and sell goods or plunder and pillage. Will you be a peaceful trader or a dreadful pirate? It is up to you.

86524.name: Action Princesses
86524.description:
Choose your Action! Princess and get ready for an exciting adventure as you rescue Prince Simpleton!

On your way to save the Prince, you must conquer the Forest of Spelling, the Bog of Numbers, Triviaville, the Ancient Maze, and the action-packed Action Cave!

Action! Princesses features word and number play, trivia for girls, physical challenges, a dry-erase game board, and a TON OF DICE!

What's in the box?
8 letter dice, 5 spot dice, 1 JUMBO die, 3 number dice, Game Board, Four Princess Pawns, Dry Erase Marker, 40 Action Cave cards, 40 Triviaville cards, 50 Story cards,
and EASY-TO-FOLLOW rules!

(from Manufacturer's Site)

86525.name: A Brief History of Rome
86525.description:
Source: The Game Website.

The year is 300 BCE. All of Italy will soon be trampled under the sandals of the Roman legions and an empire that will last more than a thousand years is about to rise from a small city on the Tiber. It is up to you to muster the legion, conquor the known world, and defend the empire from the hordes of the barbarians.

86526.name: Imagine (Issue 26 - May 1985)
86526.description:
Imagine
Adventure Games Magazine
Issue #26
May 1985

GAMESFAIR Special

Cover art by Alan Craddock.

videogame: Battlefront: Corps Level Command in World War II
D-Day: The Beginning of the End
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume I, Bull Run to Chancellorsville
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume II, Gaines Mill to Chattanooga
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume III, Wilderness to Nashville
Gold of the Americas: The Conquest of the New World
Halls of Montezuma: A Battle History of the United States Marine Corps
MacArthur's War: Battles for Korea, June 1950 - April 1951
Reach for the Stars: The Conquest of the Galaxy
Western Front: The Liberation of Europe 1944-1945
86527.name: Twenty Wargame Classics
videogamecompilation: Battlefront: Corps Level Command in World War II
D-Day: The Beginning of the End
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume I, Bull Run to Chancellorsville
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume II, Gaines Mill to Chattanooga
Decisive Battles of the American Civil War: Volume III, Wilderness to Nashville
Gold of the Americas: The Conquest of the New World
Halls of Montezuma: A Battle History of the United States Marine Corps
MacArthur's War: Battles for Korea, June 1950 - April 1951
Reach for the Stars: The Conquest of the Galaxy
Western Front: The Liberation of Europe 1944-1945
86527.description:
User Summary:

Twenty Wargame Classics is a large collection of war and strategy games dating from the mid 1980's to early 1990's. Published by Strategic Simulations Inc. (SSI) in 1995, Twenty Wargame Classics also includes games previously developed and published by Impressions Games and Strategic Studies Group (SSG).

The collection actually contains a total of 26 complete games for DOS on one CD-ROM.
A second CD-ROM contains three playable demos of SU-27 Flanker, Steel Panthers and Silent Hunter, all for DOS.
Two additional CD-ROMs contain the documentation for all the games, one for DOS and one for Windows (pdf format).
There are a total of four CD-ROMs.

(A second release of Twenty Wargame Classics in 1996 substituted Panzer General with Great Naval Battles Vol. III: Fury in the Pacific, 1941-1944.
It also substituted the playable demo of SU-27 Flanker with a playable demo of Fantasy General.
The cover art, box front and back, was also slightly altered to reflect these changes.)

86528.name: Hysteria Project
86528.description:
User Summary

Hysteria Project is a survival horror game released for the iPhone and Playstation Network. The player controls a man that was captured by a hooded stranger, and must attempt to escape. Gameplay is set up as Full Motion Video, with the player given the options of turning left, right, moving, hiding, or another special action depending on the situation. There are weapons in the game that have a one-time use, including a knife and a plastic explosive.

86529.name: Nobis: The City-States Player's Guide
86529.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Nobis is a fantasy campaign for use with version 3.5 of the world's most popular role-playing game and other OGL products.

Nobis allows you to step into a world unlike any other. The Player's Guide gives you the tools you need to survive in the City-States region.


The sprawling city of The Gates creates a unique and exciting role-playing environment.
Simplecraft gives all players a revolutionary source of arcane power.
The Fencing Discipline pioneers a class-neutral combat style, providing an all new twist on classic roles.
The Reputation System rewards both a player's quality role-playing and a character's great deeds. This system finally allows a character's reputation to directly impact game play.
The innovative firearms system seamlessly integrates black powder technology with high fantasy.
The mongrel playable race gives players more options than ever and provides several unique avenues for character development.


The City-States region teems with adventure, danger and political strife. Noble freedom fighters, secretive underworld powers and scheming politicians threaten to tear the world apart. Will you fight for the cause of freedom or will you choose the path of tyranny?

86530.description:
After 3000 years of restless retirement, batty old elf Willy McWindup is suddenly called in to perform Head Elf duties amidst a wild case of snowball fever sending all of Santa's remaining Head Elves to bed rest. With mere days before Christmas Eve and piles of presents yet to construct, you must reign in old Willy's outrageous ideas and convince him to green light and produce your concepts to help save christmas.


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a quick family holiday themed card game for 2-6 Players, the more the merrier! It plays similar to Apples to Apples, using funny and disgusting combinations of IDEA and CONCEPT Cards, which together represent a finished present yet to be constructed. Taking turns playing the Head Elf, you draw an IDEA card and (reading aloud) present it on the table. Helper Elves (the remaining players) then choose a CONCEPT card that they feel best matches the IDEA card. Receiving the cards face down, the Head Elf then shuffles and (reading aloud) presents the CONCEPTS on the table. Using ANY criteria, the Head Elf then chooses which Combination of IDEA and CONCEPT to green light and send to production - thus scoring one point towards the win for the player whose CONCEPT was chosen. Roles then rotate around the table until there is a winner with the most CONCEPTS chosen (rules vary based on number of players).


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a Free Print and Play designed by Monster Make.

108 Cards, all files provided in High Resolution, including Rules and Tuck Box.

Currently files can be found HERE.

It is a large file (240MB) consisting of 14 pages of 8.5x11 (Letter) Cards with 9 cards to a page. It also contains 1 page of 8.5x11 PocketMod layout Rules, and 2 pages of 8.5x14 (Legal) Tuckbox layouts.
The files will eventually be loaded into the Database, but for now can be found at the above link!

Included is alternate rules for 2 players with the addition of A,B,C cards and a version for young (3+ years) players.


Thanks, hope you enjoy!!
Stephen - Monster Make
86530.name: Santa's Workshop Disaster

86531.name: Shining Force Neo
86531.description:
From the game box

The Light Crystals are shattered by the evil powers of the Clan of the Moon and the world is overrun by demons. Only one young knight, fresh from training, can close the demon portals, and so with 11 friends, Max sets out on a life-changing journey where he will become a hero just like his father.

86532.name: Shining Force EXA
86532.description:
Shining Force EXA is the successor to Shining Force NEO and inherited that game's battle and action RPG mechanics.

One new feature of EXA is the customizable robot castle Geo-Fortress. While adventuring, the party members left behind use the Geo-Fortress as a headquarters. They also protect and defend the castle in the event of an attack. In the beginning, the fortress is very basic and vulnerable. By collecting "Rare Material" from the given quests, the player is able to transform the fortress into two other forms. Once the fortress reaches the third form, it is capable of travel. The player is able to add more rooms for vendors and shops. In addition to a traveling store, the player is also able to train party members. The growth, layout, and defense of the fortress is managed completely by the player, thus allowing the Geo-Fortress to evolve to fit the style and tactics of the player.

The player upgrades characters through experience points and an assortment of items and weapons. In addition, using specific battle tactics of the party will grant it more power and range. As well as advancing the main character, the player progresses to master a variety of Power Arts to unleash special and magic attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shining Force EXA", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86534.name: Bush Shoot-Out
86534.description:
User Summary

You play as President W. Bush or briefly as Condoleezza Rice. Armed with a machine gun you try to defend the White House from wave after wave of terrorist attacks. After three levels of successful shooting in the White House you also get to fight the enemy helicopters and van.

86535.name: Rölli: Nurinkurinen noppapeli
86535.description:
Finnish children's character Rölli and his friends walk in the Rölli forest, trying to stay in the forest as long as possible.

Players roll dice and move their characters accordingly, gaining action cards. The cards help characters to stay in the forest longer. The winner is the last character still in the forest.

Actions in the cards: 5 steps back, 10 steps back, roll dice to step back, stop current move, everyone else roll dice to move forward.

86536.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 30 - Feb 1992)
86536.description:
Contents:
’’’Runes’’’
Stewart gives us insight into WHITE WOLF’s future
‘’’From the pack’’’
Letters written by you in a column put togheter for you
‘’’Raiko’’’
As Storm Knights quickly learn in this Torg adventure, Nippon corporations can sometimes fall victim to their own machinations
‘’’Curse’’’
Time is proven a fickle beast in this short story based on the Time and Time Again roleplaying game
‘’’New Shamanic Totems’’’
Expand your spiritual devotions in this addition to the Shadowrun
‘’’Feature Review: Darksun’’’
Take a detailed look into the deadly and wondrous new world from TSR
‘’’Pulling no Punches’’’
If you ever wanted to take a martial arts class, now’s your chance, through the teachings of the designers of CORPS
‘’’The Silicon Dungeon’’’
With reviews of some of Christmas computer releases, you can now fly through space and become Conan!
‘’’Deadly Legacy’’’
Family members look disconcertingly alike in this AGE of RUIN adventure set in the American south
‘’’The Scope of magic’’’
Some fun new spells that might light up your life in the Nightlife roleplaying game
‘’’Capsule Reviews ‘’’
In this issue we take a look at the new releases for AD&D, Shadowrun and WFRP

86537.name: Wraithwood Cavern
86537.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

A level 2 side adventure for 4th edition D&D characters.

The "A Dungeon Dash" series of side adventures by Kurt Sparkuhl are FREE products designed to enhance your 4th edition D&D campaign. Each Dash takes only 10 minutes or less to read through, and usually clocks about 3-5 hours of play time. With some additional preparation, each Dungeon Dash can serve as the foundation for a larger highly detailed adventure.

Every Dungeon Dash includes:

New custom monsters
New traps/hazards/puzzles
A detailed map and descriptions of every encounter
Treasure and reward guidelines
Example story hooks to blend the adventure into your campaign.

86538.description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.
86538.name: Black Stories 6

86539.description:
Welcome to Skreemer, a game of future hovercar racing for 2 - 10 players.
The game is based on the popular Wipeout computer games, and has tight bends, speed-up’s and of course....missiles to slow down your opponents.

The simple rule set allows players hovercars to use a speedometer to accelerate round the track. Moving over speed-ups will propel you forward. Moving over weapon pods will equip your car with rockets to slow your opponents down. Hits are calculated on a very simple dice throw. The winner is the player to cross the chequered flag after the final lap.
86539.name: Skreemer

86540.name: Age of Zombies
86540.description:
User Summary

Age of Zombies is a dual-stick shooter, where you (as Barry Steakfries) must defeat hordes of zombies throughout history. It features non-stop action, comic-style graphics, one-liners and zombie dinosaurs.

86541.name: Rush Hour
86541.description:
User summary

The classic puzzle game from Thinkfun in electronic version.
You must help the red car drive out of the parking lot, by sliding the other cars.

Rush Hour fearures 2500 different puzzles in 4 difficulty levels.

86542.description:
To set up Findevier, lay out the ten double-sided animal discs in a circle. Shuffle the deck of cards, place them in the circle, then reveal the top card, thereby showing the animal that players will search for in the first round. Place 1-4 tokens in the circle to account for the animals of this type that aren't visible. (Two cards show woodland elves instead of an animal, and the plaeyr who draws this card chooses which animal players will search for.)

On a turn, a player flips over one of the discs to reveal the animal shown on the other side. If the player reveals the target animal, she earns one token from the circle; if the player reveals the fourth animal of this type, the player takes the final token, along with the animal card. Once all four animals of the desired type are visible, reveal the next card. Once all twelve cards have been used, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. Each token and animal card is worth one point, while the two elf cards are worth two points each.

Game play in Taiga is nearly identical to that of Findevier, with the differences being (1) that the game has only ten animal cards and no elf cards; (2) that a player who reveals an incorrect animal must return a token to the bank; and (3) that each token is worth one point and each animal card is worth two points.
86542.name: Taiga

86544.name: Walkabout
86544.description:
From the PDF:

Welcome to the world of the Walkabout.

Those who still revere the old ways of science claim that it is a world where the mysteries of quantum physics and atomic chemistry unlocked the realms of the spirits, ushering in the apocalypse.

Those who follow the old religions make various claims about angels and gods smiting humanity for its hubris.

It is a world in need of heroes.

User summary:

The game is heavily steeped in the Alcheringa beliefs of the Aboriginals of Australia

86545.name: Christmas Spirit
86545.description:
It's that time of year! The air has gotten crisp and the elves are working overtime to ensure Santa's sleigh is ready to go on the big night! And boy have there been a lot of orders this year! From iPlods to Zebras (with Real Exploding Action), children's wish lists have gotten increasingly lengthy and complex!

This year, the big cheese himself has decided to bring in some migrant elves to help with demand. He even gave them their own factory floors and access to the common area! Needless to say, The pointy eared members of Christmas local #127 have become fearful of replacement if they fall behind on this year's manufacturing.

In Christmas spirit, players take control of one of the groups of elves competing to create toys for Santa's winter ride. The object of the game is to create more, better toys than the rival groups. The player with the most victory points in toy cards in Santa's sleigh at the end of the game is the winner and has a little job security for next year.

86546.name: Walkabout Addendum
86546.description:
User summary:

The addendum adds additional rules for creating spirits and shadows, the primary antagonists of the game.

The game is heavily steeped in the Alcheringa beliefs of the Aboriginals of Australia

86547.name: Morrigan
86547.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legendary heroes need legendary monsters. Enter the world of dark horror and prepare your heroes to combat against authentic medieval creatures of myth and fantasy. The Medieval Bestiary line of products empowers Game Masters to enliven any adventure or encounter by bringing truly ghastly monsters to life.

Medieval Bestiary: Morrigan features ghoul-like creatures intertwined with knowledge of fate and mysticism. They are known for stealing human children and raising them as their own.

This product provides Game Masters with the following for ease of use and thrilling play:

A full description and lore about the morrigan and their ghoul-raised children, the badb.
Two morrigan monsters: the morrigan and morrigan phantom queen
Three badb monsters: badb minion, badb mangler, and badb fatespinner
Combat tactics for each creature
Four example encounter groups from 7th to 12th level
A morrigan related quest
Racial traits to create your own deadly badb NPCs




Although designed for the Feudal Lords, this product easily adapts into your favorite campaign or adventures.

86548.name: Witch Puppet
86548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legendary heroes need legendary monsters. Enter the world of dark horror and prepare your heroes to combat against authentic medieval creatures of myth and fantasy. The Medieval Bestiary line of products empowers Game Masters to enliven any adventure or encounter by bringing truly ghastly monsters to life.

Medieval Bestiary: Witch Puppet features arcane creations whose sole purpose is to walk the lands as surrogates to secluded wizards hiding from the inquisition. Arcane creators bind the souls of the dead to form these constructs to do their bidding.

This product provides Game Masters with the following for ease of use and thrilling play:

A full description and lore about witch puppets.
Five witch puppet monsters: witch puppet servant, thresher, warrior, hexen, and awakened witch puppet (solo).
Combat tactics for each creature
Five example encounter groups from 3rd to 11th level
A witch puppet monster template: the witch beast.




And for the Players . . .

A full description and new character race - now you can play a witch puppet.
Two racial powers: Arcane Conduit and Threshing Claws.
Seven witch puppet feats.
And character options.




Although designed for the Feudal Lords, this product easily adapts into your favorite campaign or adventures.

86549.name: Alluria Campaign Setting Guide (4E)
86549.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is not a stand-alone campaign setting—it is a setting upon which material from your entire library of 4th edition campaign settings can be applied. The Alluria Campaign Setting Guide works as a framework upon which eclectic Dungeon Masters can build a widely diverse world. It provides a backdrop in which multiple worlds intermingle, characters that would not normally interact do, and culture is no longer a barrier. Best of all, it ties in all of the unique and wonderful creatures of Alluria Publishing’s Remarkable Races line with all of the most popular core races. So if you want a fun and interesting way to explain why your party’s warforged artificer, drow sword-mage, and zif explorer happen to be adventuring together, pick up the Alluria Campaign Setting Guide today!

86551.name: The Newly Discovered
86551.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the addition of the Player's Handbook 2 (D&D 4e), the game has seen a few new staples to the player character race ensemble. Among these, the racial paragon paths and racial backgrounds have been especially well received. To update the Remarkable Races, we decided to put out our own updates. These updates will be released in three expansions, one for each set of Remarkable Races. Included are five racial paragons, one for each race in the set. Each race will also have the option of several suggested character backgrounds. In addition, by popular demand, we have included racial and paragon power cards that can be printed on cardstock. As an added bonus, there are 10 cardstock miniatures included for use at your game table!

86552.name: Dance of the Damned
86552.description:
From the PDF:

Dance of the Damned is a storytelling game where the players tell the story of what happens in a castle as its inhabitants hide from a terrible plague that ravages the world outside. Will your character survive or fall to some decadent desire? Perhaps they will fall to corruption themselves. Maybe the
plague will find a way into the castle and destroy everyone...
To discover the fate of the inhabitants of the castle we use a deck of cards to adjudicate the action of the scenes and the outcome of the final days.

The game requires no Gamemaster and plays in around an hour or so, depending on how much detail you put into each scene. Each player tries to force cards from their hand onto the other players. The suits of the cards used define the way the scenes play out, and these scenes build the story of the castle. There is no real winner of the game, but a tenuous victory can be implied if one of the players manages to steer the events into a particular fate of their choosing.

86553.name: The Return of the Ancients
86553.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the addition of the Player's Handbook 2 (D&D 4e), the game has seen a few new staples to the player character race ensemble. Among these, the racial paragon paths and racial backgrounds have been especially well received. To update the Remarkable Races, we decided to put out our own updates. These updates will be released in three expansions, one for each set of Remarkable Races. Included are five racial paragons, one for each race in the set. Each race will also have the option of several suggested character backgrounds. In addition, by popular demand, we have included racial and paragon power cards that can be printed on cardstock. As an added bonus, there are 10 cardstock miniatures included for use at your game table!

86554.name: Mex
86554.description:
From back of the box

Dice trowing for the highest eyes! Mex is the highest score you can get and is the combination of a 2 and a 1. all other values are between 32 and 600. players with the lower scores get punished and eventually eliminated. but with bluffing you can avoid an exile; you trow the dice and hold the dice hidden under the cup. you claim a high score and hope that the next player won't get you. it all depends on your bluffing skills! the best dice thrower and bluffer will be the winner at the end.

86555.name: Flickin' Chicken
86555.description:
Try to land any part of your Flickin' Chicken on the target within the least of throws as possible. The player with the lowest score after nine-rounds is the winner.

SETUP
1 - Each player chooses a Flickin' Chicken. Pay attention to the color, this is YOUR chicken!
2 - Designate someone to be the score keeper. This person will keep score during the game using the included Score-Keeper and pencil. Write each player's name in the Score-Keeper.
3 - The youngest player takes the Target Disc first. They will be the first to throw the disc and their Flickin' Chicken.

PLAYING EACH ROUND
1 - Flickin' Chicken is played in 9 rounds. The person with the lowest score after nine rounds is the winner.

2 - At the start of each round, throw the Target Disc as far as you can. For the first round, the youngest player throws first. For subsequent rounds, the winner of the previous round, play paper-scissor-rock, flip a coin or other tie-breaking ritual to determinate the thrower. Greco-Roman Wrestling is not reccomended.

3 - Taking turns, and starting with the Target Disc thrower, each player throws their Flickin' Chicken at the Target Disc, trying to land any part of their chicken on the disc. If you land any part of your Flickin' Chicken on the Target Disc on your first throw, this is a "Pollo-In-One". Everyone should congratulate you, as it's quite a feat.

4 - After everyone has thrown, it is now time for your next throw (if needed). The player whose chicken landed furthest from the target disc will go next (throwing from where the chicken landed) continuing with the next furthest player, so forth and so on.

5 - Repeat this until everyone has landed any part of their Flickin' Chicken onto the Target Disc. Once you hit the target disc, remove your chicken from play. Keep track of your throws as each throw is equal to one point.

6 - When every player has landed their chicken on the target the round is over. It is now time to score the round.

7 - Repeat the above until you have played all nine-rounds.

SCORING
1 - The target Disc has 2 sides, a Bonus side and a Penalty side. Each round is different depending on which side of the Target Disc is facing up after it lands!

2 - If any part of your Flickin' Chicken is TOUCHING the center white circle of the Target Disc then score accordingly and as follows:
"Penalty +1" - Add one point to your score if any part of your Flickin' Chicken is touching the Penalty Circle.
"Bonus -1" - Deduce one point from your score if any part of your Flickin' Chicken is touching the Bonus Circle.

3 - After determining if any Bonus or Penalty points apply to a players score, write their score in the Score-Keeper using the including pencil.

4 - After 9 rounds of play, tally up the players' scores. The player with the lowest score wins! (from the Rules-book)

86557.name: Trenchzone Expansion: Tactical Advantage
86557.description:
Tactical Advantage is an expansion deck of cards that can be used in part or whole to enhance 'Trenchzone' the game.

This expansion contains:

1 Clear Plastic Box
1 Front Cover Card
1 Rule Card
4 Decoy Cards
36 Unique Tactical Advantage Cards
12 Blank Cards for you to create your own optional Tactical Cards

(Updated with one new advantage card 03/11/11)

86558.name: Superior Synergy: Fantasy
86558.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wondered why, when the pre-epic class levels allow you to have as many as 23 skill ranks in a given skill that synergy stops at 5 ranks? Yeah, us too.

Superior Synergy introduces new skill synergy levels at three new benchmarks: 10, 15 and 20. Not all benefits are merely increases in a simply synergy bonus, either. Some benefits include reduced times needed to perform tasks associated or altered DC modifiers with the synergy skill.

It doesn't end there, either. Superior Synergy also introduces feat synergy. Much like skill synergy, feat synergy allows two or more feats to work together for additional benefits they couldn't achieve on their own without having to take additional feats.

Don't be satisfied with poor skill and feat planning. Check out Superior Synergy: Fantasy, the first in the Superior Synergy series and let your characters make the most of their potential.

86559.name: The Abjurer
86559.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Abjurer is the third offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Abjurer you'll find:

The abjurer core class. These specialists wizards excel at defense and protection.
The arcane guardian prestige class. Able to get the most defense out of abjuration spell with a lot less effort.
The planar exciser prestige class. A mix of the cleric and abjurer classes, they hunt down extraplanar creatures to banish or slay.
10 new feats with a focus on the abjurer.
3 new magic items, the shield of the planes, bastioned spellbook, and ointment of defense, and a new special ability for armor and shields, attack reflecting, and one for magic weapons, dismissal.

86560.name: The Conjurer
86560.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Conjurer is the first offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Conjurer you'll find:

The conjurer core class. These specialists wizards excel at summoning something from nothing, be it materials or creatures.
The arsenal mage prestige class. A mix of conjurer and fighter, the arsenal mage is never without a weapon thanks to his ability to sacrifice spell slots in order to conjure weapons, shields and armor out of nothing.
The demonican prestige class. These spellcasters conjure Outsiders to trap so that they may steal their powers.
7 new feats centered around specialist wizards in general, with a focus on the conjurer.
2 new magic items, the summoner's egg and ring of sure travel, and a new special ability for magic weapons, summoner's bane.

86561.name: The Diviner
86561.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Diviner is the second offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Diviner you'll find:

The diviner core class. These specialists wizards excel at seeing beyond and through space and time.
The cosmic fist prestige class. A mix of diviner and monk, the cosmic fist uses his enlightened, prophetic abilities to gain an advantage during conflict.
The oracle prestige class. These spellcasters see into the future far better than even the diviner can.
Rules on using Bluff, Gather Information and Sense Motive together to pull off a false prophecy con.
10 new feats with a focus on the diviner.
4 new magic items, the deck of fate, eyepatch of truth, globes of insight, and seer's pool, and a new special ability for magic weapons, revealing.

86562.name: The Enchanter
86562.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Enchanter is the fifth offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Enchanter you'll find:

The enchanter core class. These specialists wizards excel at manipulation and control.
Rules for mundane hypnotism, using hypnosis through skill use and without magic or similar abilities.
The alpha warden prestige class. A master of beast and wilderness.
The enticer prestige class. Able to hypnotize and command with a glance or word.
9 new feats with a focus on the enchanter.
4 new magic items, the lover's arrow, bewitching stone, globe of trances, and thrall collar.

86563.name: The Evoker
86563.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Evoker is the seventh offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Evoker you'll find:

The evoker core class. These specialists wizards are experts at making something from nothing. In fact, existence has a way of ending up in their pockets (literally.)
The arcanamest prestige class. These wizards are able to temporarily enchant ordinary items, making them magical items.
The elemental troubadour prestige class. Bards that can focus their evocation talent to summon the elements.
9 new feats centered around specialist wizards in general, with a focus on the evoker.
3 new magic items, the force armor, ring of energy, and elemental instrument, and a new special ability for magic weapons, force-charged.

86564.name: The Illusionist
86564.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Illusionist is the fourth offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Illusionist you'll find:

The illusionist core class. These specialists wizards excel at faking reality.
The nightwalker prestige class. Combining the rogue's talents with that of the illusionist, they are able to dance between darkness and create illusory puppet versions of themselves.
The pretender prestige class. Experts at disguise and assuming alternate identities, right down to being able to use illusions to convince others that they are being affected by different spell effects.
9 new feats with a focus on the illusionist.
6 new magic items, false armor, the ring of belief, ointment of disguise, glamer lantern, shadow cloak and the sun globe.

86565.name: The Necromancer
86565.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Necromancer is the eighth and final offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Necromancer you'll find:

The necromancer core class. These specialists wizards masters of life and death (and everything in between.)
The corpse speaker prestige class. Masters of summoning undead.
The twilight warder prestige class. Holy warriors that guard the night against the unliving.
17 new feats with a focus on the necromancer.
2 new magic armor features, negative energy protection and turning, along with life armor, the ghoul arrow, dust of life, bag of bones, death wall and haunted spellbook.

86566.name: The Transmuter
86566.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever think that tacking on specialist wizards to the wizard core class was kinda lame? Ever think that the specialists needed to be written up as their own distinct classes? Yeah, us too.

The Transmuter is the fifth offering in The Core Specialist Wizard series. Each product of the series will present a different specialist as its own core, 20-level class, with distinctive abilities. Other related materials, including feats, two prestige classes tied to the core specialist class, and a small offering of related magic items, are also included.

Within The Transmuter you'll find:

The transmuter core class. These specialists wizards excel at changing one thing into another.
The fury prestige class. Barbaric masters of turning themselves into weapons.
The morph mage prestige class. Able to transform into progressively more powerful creature types.
7 new feats with a focus on the transmuter.
2 new magic items, the ever-weapon and casket of change.
5 new alchemical items.

86567.name: Unusual Core Classes: The Spellweaver
86567.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unusual Core Classes: The Spellweaver presents an alternate magic system that relies on the caster’s skill more so than just about anything else. Using the new Spellweaving skill, the Spellweaver is able to manipulate the threads of magic that cover existence like an infinite web of arcane energy. Spells of any level may be cast so long as the character is willing to risk the repercussions of failure, repercussions that can prove to be more hazardous with more powerful spells or when failing magic of a particular type.

Inside you’ll find instructions on how to integrate this new form of magic into your game setting, or how to replace the existing magic system outright, along with simple rules—presented in easy to read tables—on converting third party spells to Spellweaving DCs. Also within are …

All SRD spells converted to Spellweaving DC to save you lots of time
More than 30 new feats concerning this new magic system
The Spellweaver Core Class, along with the Epic Spellweaver
4 Spellweaving-related Prestige Classes: the Battle Weaver, Cartomancer, Fated, and Weave Dancer
A new race of natural spellweavers, the spider-like Ardekh
A new, Spellweaving-based goddess, a new cleric domain, new spells, and new magic items related to Spellweaving
4 new creatures and a new creature template




The time has come to break the mold and put spell slots aside.

86568.name: Alligator Dice Game
86568.description:
This is a game in Koplow's series of dice games that come in a tube and which usually feature dice where one side is replaced with a graphic of animal. In this case, you get five dice where the the one-pip is replaced with a graphic of an alligator.

The game is a simple dice rolling game - players roll the dice and need at least one alligator before they can score, They can set aside one alligator and other dice showing pipped sides which give the score - the other dice can be re-rolled once to attempt to improve the score. The player then decides whether to increase the size of their 'gator' by rolling all five dice and adding the sum of pipped dice to their score; however on this subsequent roll, any alligators rolled count as minus five points.

The player with the highest number of points after all the rolling wins.

86569.name: Steel + Stealth
86569.description:
From Introduction:

Steel and Stealth is an OGL rules resource that greatly expands four core classes: the fighter, monk, ranger and rogue. These are the universal versions of each class. Each universal class is a framework that lets players choose from a variety of special abilities. You can use these advancements to replicate the standard core classes (and you can, in fact, run standard characters alongside universal class characters) or you can develop your own unique combination of abilities.

Think of the rules herein as a midway point between the tightly defined niches of the standard core classes and generic “point buy” systems. Great care has been taken to leave each class with its own, unique niche. A fighter is still devoted to armed combat in all forms. Rangers are still supreme survivalists, rogues are still sneaky and monks are still masters of stylized fighting.

These four classes are classic pulp fantasy protagonists: mercenary swordsmen, sardonic thieves, tough wanderers and exotic adventurers. Steel and Stealth can be used to build a campaign that focuses on such characters, ensuring that while every PC cleaves to common thieves, no two are exactly alike.

86570.name: The Arcane Duelist
86570.description:
From Introduction:

Straddling the world between the training grounds of the professional soldier and the secluded schools of the spellcaster, the arcane duelist is spell-wielding warrior. An arcane duelist is too free-spirited or multitalented to study martial discipline or magical training exclusively. Instead, he combines elements of both to deadly effect.

Many arcane duelists are self-taught swordmasters and mages, relying on personal genius to excel in a unique form of combined combat. Others are the products of special academies devoted to the art of the wand and sword. Some of these schools specialize in particular weapons and spells; others encourage arcane duelists to explore their gifts through duels and adventures.

The arcane duelist is ready for almost anything he encounters. His combination of mundane might and magical techniques makes him a formidable opponent. An arcane duelist excels at protecting himself from magical attack while he assaults his opponent with spells and steel.

86571.name: D-Day
86571.description:
This is operational level wargame based on Invasion Normandy. Small size and easy rule game.
It is mostly called "SS D-Day" because there are many games of the same name.

The Allied player aims at a success of the landing operations. The German player aims at the obstruction of the Allied Forces. Each game turn is divided into three impulse. The number of times that it can be activated by the unit is different.

This game was firstly published as one of the SS(Small size war Simulation) series.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with Battle of the Bulge.

86572.name: L'effet Schrödinger
86572.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Un monde incertain

Depuis le début du 20e siècle, au fur et à mesure que la science avance, la nature de la réalité semble se dissoudre dans l'abstraction.

Le temps devient élastique, l'univers est remplit d'énergie noire, le chaos se révèle ordonné, les chats sont morts et vivants, etc.

Les mutants sont parmi nous

Au fur et à mesure que les mystères de la nature s'approfondissent, certaines humains autrefois normaux subissent des changements radicaux, et deviennent capables de bouleverser les réalités physiques et biologiques. Le chat s'est-il échappé de la boîte de Pandore ?

Les héros de l'Effet Schrödinger font partie de ces mutants, capables de manipuler intuitivement la structure sub-atomique de notre univers.

Useront-ils de leurs pouvoirs extraordinaires pour faire régner la justice ou la terreur ?

Notre réalité n'est-elle qu'une illusion ?

A vous de décider ... et de jouer !


User Translation from French:

An Uncertain World

Since the beginning of the 20th century, and as the pace of science advances, the nature of reality seems to dissolve into abstraction.

Time becomes elastic, the universe is filled with dark energy, chaos appears ordered, the cats are dead and alive, etc.

The mutants are among us

In the way that the mysteries of nature deepens, certain formerly normal humans undergo radical changes, and become capable of upsetting physical and biological realities. Has the cat been let out of Pandora's box?

The heroes of the Schrödinger Effect are part of these mutants, able to intuitively manipulate the subatomic structure of our universe.

Will they use their extraordinary powers to bring justice or terror?

Is our reality just an illusion?

It is up to you to decide... and to play!

86573.name: All Time 9
86573.description:
All Time 9 is a baseball board game that includes 160 of some of the all time great players in baseball history.
The statistical accuracy of the game lets players play out games using these all time greats from every era, up to the modern age of baseball.

The mechanic that sets it apart is the initial rolling of dice by the player controlling the pitcher, with a follow-up dice roll by the batter, in response to what the pitcher did. This accurately recreates the pitcher/batter duel, as opposed to other baseball boardgames that resolves all action in a single dice roll, with no input from one or the other of the 2 players involved.

86574.name: The Thief
86574.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've played a generic adventuring rogue, but come on: Don't you really want to play a thief?

A thief is a canny warrior of the streets. He combines stealth and action to steal what he wants or needs. Many thieves are selfish footpads and bandits, but others are heroic outlaws who fight and steal for the good of the common people. Thieves may be good or evil, but above all, they follow their own law. They value freedom and the power to take their own risks and run their own lives.

Thieves are stealthy warriors cut from the mould of heroic (or "pulp") fantasy. They're sneaky but able swordsmen who gain special benefits from fighting in the shadows. They don't just lauch "sneak attacks" -- they backstab!

86575.name: Modern Playaids: Sniper
86575.description:
From publisher blurb:

It takes skill and patience to kill with a rifle. Whether it is the casual hunter going up into the mountains for an easy weekend of camping, the trained SWAT team member zeroing in on a hostage taker or the lone soldier operating in no-man’s land, the ability to strike with impunity at great range has remained one of the chief roles of rifle weaponry. Modern Playaids: Sniper takes you into the world of the professional marksman, with new feats, skill uses, weapons and prestige classes designed to enhance any d20 Modern game.

86576.name: Polyhedron (Issue 145 - Vol. 20, No. 6)
rpgissuearticle: Bare Bones: Part One - The Miracle of Birth
Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guide to the FORGOTTEN REALMS
Illicit Wages at Blade's Point: D&D Brigands and Thugs
On The Trail: Round the World
You Rogues Want Some More?: Further Ideas For the Ethically Challenged
86576.description:
Cover art: It's always difficult to find the perfect place to sort out your loot. We recommend forlorn rooftops, as you're unlikely to attract passersby. As artist Ron Spears shows us, however, rooftops provide charming challenges of their own... (from the credits page)

This issue featured character creation rules for Living City and Living Force, and several articles of interest to rogues.
It also had a Reader Survey on page 64.

86577.name: Polyhedron (Issue 144 - Vol. 20, No. 5)
rpgissuearticle: Bare Bones: Training Your Thought Brownies
Beats Don't Fail Me Now!: Dungeons & Dragons Tips From a Playtester
Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guid to the FORGOTTEN REALMS
On The Trail: The Big Ones - A Look Back at Gen Con
The Palace of Passion: Ravens Bluff's Temple of Sune
Web Wanderings: The Wild, Wild Web
86577.description:
Cover art: Back in the ancient age of the very first issue of Polyhedron, artist Darlene Pekul created a forlorn centaur for the inaugural cover. Nineteen years later, Jeff Easley brings us back to that same centaur, whose life has suddenly become more colorful. (from the credits page)

This the first issue in new format.

It included a Reader Survey on page 64.

86578.name: Yonin Shogi
boardgameversion: The Shogi Association George Hodges edition
86578.description:
Yonin Shogi or Four-handed Shogi is a four-player variant of shogi invented in 1993 but published in its current form in 1995.

The game is played using two subsets of standard shogi pieces and a standard 9x9 shogi board. Each of the four players gets one king, one rook, two gold generals, two silver generals, and three pawns.

The players sit around the board, one at each of the four sides. At start, each player's pieces are arranged in three rows forming a triangular pattern centered along the respective edge of board:

The objective of the game is to capture your opponents' kings. Individual play as well as team play is possible. Movement and capture are identical to standard shogi, except for check and checkmate.

86579.name: Disassemblin' Dice
86579.description:
Disassemblin' Dice is a dice game for 2-4 players using the Nestortiles game system. In Disassemblin' Dice, players build dice using Nestortiles, roll those dice to score points, and then disassemble and re-assemble the dice in order to create more powerful dice. Rolling a higher score than the other players allows a player to push their opponents' dice markers towards the end of the disassembly track. Once a player is knocked off the track, their die is disassembled, and they are out of the game. The last player to have their die disassembled wins.

Each tile that a player uses to assemble their dice changes the score that any roll yields. Players must carefully remove and add different tiles to their dice in order to maximize their chances of scoring higher than their opponents. Careful manipulation of the six Nestortiles and a bit of luck result in victory!

videogame: Disciples II: Guardians of the Light
Disciples II: Rise of the Elves
Disciples II: Servants of the Dark
86580.name: Disciples II: Gold Edition
videogamecompilation: Disciples II: Guardians of the Light
Disciples II: Rise of the Elves
Disciples II: Servants of the Dark
86580.description:
Back of the box translation from French

Disciples II returns gamers to the magical realm of the Sacred Lands where four races - the Empire, the Mountain Clans, the Legions of the Damned and the Undead Hordes - continue the battle for the destiny of their Gods. A decade after the First Great War, the final prophecy continues to unfold. Deep within the crevices of the Sacred Lands, the Chosen One has emerged, fated to bring salvation to some and destruction to others. Braced with renewed faith and newfound conviction, each race must once again take up the sword for the sake of their people and the glory of their God.

- Included all the add-ons from the Saga : Guardians of the Light, Servants of the Dark and Rise of the Elves !
- Unlimited upgrade possible on all units and leaders !
- Over 200 individually animated units and over 100 devastating spells !
- Campaign editor allows you to make your own custom campaigns !
- Multiplayer supports up to 4 players !

86582.name: Free Realms
86582.description:
From the company's webpage:

Free Realms is a free 3D virtual world where you can do whatever you want, whenever you want! Jump in straight from your web browser! Once you create your character, you'll be in and playing in just a few minutes.

Decorate your house, then invite your friends over for a party! Teach your pet a new trick or dress them up in a sweet costume! Battle enemies as you search for lost treasure or duel other players, mine for gold, cook up a meal, or race your car! When you're ready for a different kind of challenge, play a wide variety of fun minigames, jump into the trading card game or check up with your friends on your profile page. Free Realms is the place to join up with your friends to discover, explore, compete, chat, share achievements and just have fun! In Free Realms, YOU RULE.

86583.name: Sink it
86583.description:
Early variation of the battleship type game.

ships noted are BB CA and DD's

Each ship generates a different number of shots and when the ship is sunk the player reduces the number of shots he takes.

Ship locations are noted on the pad and each turns shots are noted by turn. This creates a record of the game played.

The game appears to be a promotional item of the Krueger Brewing comapany. They closed their doors in 1961.

owner description:

86584.name: Beggars Night
86584.description:
From the Publisher:

Tonight is Halloween or, as it was once known, "Beggars Night"--a time for all kids to dress up, gorge on candy, and play a harmless prank or two. But perhaps some little monsters are taking the night's traditions a bit too far. Tricks can be fun but when children start disappearing, things get serious real quick. Can your kids get to the bottom of things and stop some mischief makers before it's too late?

86585.name: Konung III: Ties of the Dynasty
86585.description:
User Summary

Konung III: Ties of the Dynasty is an RPG title for the PC. The game is the third in the Konung series, and is set in Woodland – a fantasy land with its roots in Slavic mythology. The era of the Titans has ended, and the ruling princes have fallen into history, paving the way for the age of heroes. A vast number of warriors fight for the throne of the Grand Principality, and only the holder of the legendary Champion Sword will be victorious.

Konung III builds on the base gameplay of the previous series titles, adding a number of new features, including:

- New RPG skills
- Improved graphics
- Addition of new unique weapon and armor types
- Enhanced battle magic options
- A wider range of interactive objects
- More interaction with player-dependent settlements

86586.name: Discretion
86586.description:
This game is from Volume Sprayer Mfg Co of Tulsa Oklahoma and was produced in 1942.

The game comes with money in 1,000, 500,100,and 50 dollar denominations, 36 yellow and green combination cards and 36 red and black combination cards. The game also has 2 Dudecahedron dice (12 sided)

All of the number combination cards are placed face down and each player draws a card and places it face up. The first player decides if he is rolling red or yellow. The dice are then rolled and anyone who has a card showing on the table with the combination that has been rolled wins. If no one wins then they all keep the first card and turn over another one. The player must always declare the color that he is rolling. The accumulated cards that you have increases the payoff if you have a winning card. (you hold 6 cards, 4 red and 2 yellow. The roller declares Red and rolls a 3 and a 9. One of your red cards has that 3 and 9 grouping so you win the value of the roll times 4 for the number of red cards that you have.

A time limit is suggested as to when the game ends.

86587.description: In Monster auf der Flucht, five monsters are escaping from their exploding home planet to find a new home, and each player will secretly be assigned one of these monsters to watch over and care for. At the end of the round, the monster farthest away from its home planet scores 0 points – it went a tad too far, mind you – while the second farthest monster scores 3 points, and the other monsters in order score 2, 1 and -1 points.
86587.name: Monster auf der Flucht

86588.name: Six Shooter
86588.description: Six Shooter is a fun, fast-paced, easy to learn dice game where all players play at the same time. Each player rolls 6 dice and attempts to complete the goal on the current card. The first player to get 6 in a row on their board wins!

86590.name: Little League World Series Baseball 2010
86590.description:
User Summary

Little League World Series Baseball is a sports title for the Xbox 360 and Playstation 3. The game is based on the 2010 Little League World Series. There are several gameplay options to choose from, including World Series, Exhibition, and Minigame modes. World Series mode has the player choose 1 of 16 teams and attempt to make their way through pool play and then the playoffs.

86592.name: Journeys (Issue 2)
rpgissuearticle: A Short History of Amber Diceless Roleplaying
It's Never A Good Day to Die
The Winds at the World's Edge
86592.description:
Vol I, Issue 2

Cover artist: Janet Aulisio

86593.name: A Fistful of Tripods
86593.description:
A Fistful of Tripods is a set of miniatures war game rules that cover the Marian invasion described by H. G. Wells in his novel "War of the Worlds".

Players can re-create the first "historical" Martian invasion of 1890's (which was an all out rout of the humans), or play one of several alternate scenarios from the 1920's through the 1990's.

The rules are based on the Fistful of TOWS miniatures rule set.

This description is paraphrased from the introductory section of the rulebook.

86594.name: Journeys (Issue 3)
rpgissuearticle: Journeyer's Guide to AErth: Everyday Life in AEropa, Part II
The Gamemaster's Purview: The Grand Campaign
86594.description:
Journeys, Issue 3
Journal of Multidimensional Roleplaying
Cover art by Jim Nelson
The Cover: A resident of Phaeree comes to AErth for a little sunset serenade

86595.name: Jumping Flash! 2
86595.description:
Jumping Flash! 2 is a platform game released in 1996 for the PlayStation. It is the direct sequel to Jumping Flash!, which was released the previous year.

After Robbit foils Baron Aloha's plans to take over Crater Planet (events from the first game), Aloha flees for his life and return to his home planet, Little Muu.

While planning his revenge, however, Aloha's turn to face the fear of having his planet attacked comes. A gigantic alien invader known as Captain Kabuki descends upon Little Muu and starts taking it apart, piece by piece, just as Aloha himself had once tried to do to Crater Planet.

Aloha flees the onslaught in his space pod, and lands on an asteroid far away from Little Muu, where he swallows his pride and calls for help from his sworn enemy, Universal City Hall. Once again, Robbit is dispatched to help, and manages to free the parts of Little Muu which Kabuki has taken, and ultimately faces Kabuki one-on-one in mortal combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jumping flash 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86596.name: Skryptorium
86596.description:
We invite you into middle ages where in scriptorium (latin for "a place for writing") Benedictine monks would copy and illustrate books and manuscripts. Your task in the game is to help the scribe to collect sentences that were scattered through out the monastery. The player, who will collect the most complete sentences and will deliver them to scriptorium will be a winner. Game combines spin and move with classic memory mechanic adding some special twists into the mix.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland.

86597.description:
Capt'n Sharky and his friends have discovered a new island. Right in the center of it, Sharky sees a large palm with many of coconuts. The friends decide to pick them off, but watch out - upwards is not the only way!

An exciting contest is about to start - who will reach the top first and pick the biggest coconut.

Players draw cards, showing which two characters they support. These Cards are kept hidden.
Each Player has a set of cards, allowing him to move various characters up and down the tree. The goal is to collect the most valuable coconuts with the own characters without being identified by the others, what would enable them to play negative cards on the right target. The player who's characters have collected the most valuable coconuts at the end of the game wins.
86597.name: Capt'n Sharky: Ab auf die Palme

86598.name: Owlman
86598.description:
An asymmetric strategy game based on Britain’s answer to the West Virginia Mothman sightings. The game can be played using pieces from a chess and checkers set. Owlman is an abstract strategy game with unequal forces, based on a loose theme of cryptozoological investigation.

The Owlman side has just one piece (a black knight) which starts in the upper left corner. Doc's side has Doc (a white king starting in the lower right corner) and 12 helpers (checkers starting near Doc).

Owlman's main objective is to frighten all of Doc's helpers out of the woods. Doc aims to reach the Owlman's lair (the upper left corner), along with one of his helpers (adjacent to the corner), who will help him set up his "cryptozoological" camera.

The game is played in alternating turns, moving pieces on the 8x8 board. All pieces can step to an adjacent space. Only Owlman can capture, by stepping toward a helper, who is then frightened out of the woods. Owlman also has a special "swoop" move (like an elongated knight's move, but 4x2 instead of 3x2).

The game is published in the December 2010 issue of GAMES Magazine and online at http://owlmanthegame.blogspot.com/

Online play: Super Duper Games

86599.name: Ora et Labora
86599.description:
"Ora et Labora" is Latin for for pray and work is a principle of the Benedictine monasteries. In this game players are young helpers arriving to the monastery to learn about the life of Benedictine monks. This can be done by completing tasks (that ask players to collect sets of cards like writing materials, sentences etc.). Board presents a clock with main activities of the monastery (like prayers, work in the scriptorium or in the garden) and players can can choose in which of the shortly starting activities they want to participate (represented by them moving pawn on board). Next the player can use the ability of the field he moved to (drawing card, exchanging card with a common poll, completing tasks etc.). Each completed task gives a player certain amount of points and allows him or her to draw another task card. Game follows this pattern until one of the players collect enough points.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland

86600.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 19 - Mar 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Artifact: The Dollars of Dagon
Berenice Cartfield: A Delta Green Antagonist
Message in a Bottle: Dying Sunlight
Mysterious Manuscript: Henry Darger's Second Novel
Mysterious Manuscript: The Twelfth Book of Moses
The Eye of Light and Darkness
86600.description:
From the publisher:

The Unspeakable Oath 19 is edited by Adam Crossingham, Dan Harms, Shane Ivey and Greg Stolze, and illustrated by Dennis Detwiller. It includes:
The Dread Page of Azathoth

This issue’s foreword by editor-in-chief Shane Ivey.
The Eye of Light and Darkness

Reviews of games, books and movies that are of special interest to Cthulhu Mythos gamers.

Cthulhu Saves the World, reviewed by Brian Sammons.
Death in Luxor, reviewed by Matthew Pook.
The Freeport Trilogy, reviewed by Matthew Pook.
The H.P. Lovecraft Literary Podcast, reviewed by Brian Sammons.
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu, reviewed by Brian Sammons.
Lovecraftian Tales from the Table, reviewed by Matthew Pook.
Monsters, reviewed by Brian Sammons.
Shadows of Yog-Sothoth, reviewed by Matthew Pook.

Tales of Terror

Short descriptions of disturbing situations, each with three possible ways the game moderator could have them unfold in play.

"Property Values," by Adam Gauntlett, when a house is not a home but a horror.

"Sawbucks," by Monte Cook, wealth that really is a burden.

Arcane Artifacts

Deadly objects ready to be added to your games.

"Dollars of Dagon," by Bobby Derie, a numismatist’s dream that can quickly turn nightmare.

Mysterious Manuscripts

Tomes of forbidden knowledge, ready for play.

"Henry Darger’s Second Novel," by Pat Harrigan,long after his death, the famous recluse again redefines "outsider art."

"Joy Shusterman’s Basement," by Jeffrey Moeller, in which you can learn a lot from isolation.

"The Twelfth Book of Moses," by Adam Gauntlett, a New Age classic that would be better to stay underground.

Feature Articles

"Bernice Cartfield," by Greg Stolze, a modern-day occultist who’s a perfect Friendly or foil for Delta Green.

"Cheating Madness," by Brennan Bishop, tips for livening up your trips to the mental ward.

"Paramour of Y’golonac," by Oscar Rios, a seductive new monster.

Scenarios

"The Brick Kiln," by Adam Gauntlett, a Trail of Cthulhu adventure set in rural 1930s England.

"Suited and Booted," by Adam Gauntlett, a Call of Cthulhu adventure set in the grimy side of 1920s London.

Message in a Bottle

A short, self-contained vignette of Cthulhu Mythos horror.

"Dying Sunlight," by David Jacobs, a glimpse at the life of a photographer who took more than pictures.

86601.name: Corporation Licenses List
86601.description:
From the publisher:

A complete index of all Licenses in the Corporation RPG so far. An excellent tool for character creation.

86604.name: Corporation Equipment List
86604.description:
From the publisher:
