This is a complete index of all equipment featured in all Corporation books so far complete with page references. An invaluable guide for players and GMs alike.

86605.name: Random Events #1
86605.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’S COOKBOOK: Random Events #1 offers twenty random happenings in a hamlet, town or city.

Random and unexpected events can help give your campaign a realistic verisimilitude. It gives the players the idea their characters exist in a real breathing world and things are occurring outside the scope of their limited perceptions. They can hear snippets of conversation, witness strange actions that make little sense when you don’t know their context, or have unexpected encounters with denizens of the campaign world.

86606.name: Magic Armor
86606.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Armor for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 unique suits of magic armor for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86607.name: Magic Boots
86607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Boots for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 unique magic boots for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86608.name: Magic Bracers
86608.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Bracers for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 unique magic bracers for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86609.name: Magic Potions
86609.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Potions for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 unique potions for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86610.name: Magic Rings
86610.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Rings for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 magic rings for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86611.name: Magic Shields
86611.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Shields for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 magic shields for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86612.name: Magic Weapons
86612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Magic Weapons for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 magic weapons for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86613.name: Wondrous Items
86613.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buck-A-Batch: Wondrous Items for 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons features 25 magic items for your fantasy campaign.

The items are presented in two formats for your convenience: Standard book format and a card format for cutting out and handing to your players.

86614.name: Power Knowledge
86614.description:
From publisher blurb:

The path of an adventurer is never even, never perfect. There are many ways by which a hero can gain their strengths, master their spells, and present their faith. Power Knowledge is a means by which any character can learn additional powers and interchange them to play up a more versatile character without affecting the rules for power usage in the 4th Edition Dungeons and Dragons game.

86615.name: Bleeding
86615.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's more than one way to kill a villain...

Bleeding creates a new damage type and keyword for the 4th Edition of Dungeons and Dragons, presented here as a free PDF from Emerald Press PDF Publishing. Part of our Combat Advantage series, these free PDFs provide previews, optional rules, and playtesting material for the 4E game.

86616.name: Homebound
86616.description:
From the publisher:

Save the fallen! Destroy Addertongue and his minions! Become the heroes of an entire humanoid race!

Homebound is designed to be a one night adventure for a group of 3-4 PCs using the rules of the Divinity RPG. Homebound is a 12 page PDF filled with adventuring options.

Find the way home! Claim your Divinity!

86617.name: Horror Stalker
86617.description:
From the publisher:

Be afraid. Be very afraid.

They lurk in the shadows behind the tavern. Down the dark alley between abandoned buildings. Behind the trees in an otherwise mundane forest. Their goals are often alien, if they have any real goal at all. Some say nothing, allowing the viciousness of their attacks to speak for them. Others are alarmingly charming, right up to the moment they plunge a dagger in your back. They are the stuff of nightmares, as well as hundreds of horror movies.

The Horror Stalker class allows a game master to unleash unholy hell on his heroes. These relentless, tireless monsters will pursue their chosen victims without remorse and without mercy.

This 4-page PDF includes the Horror Stalker class as well as three sample Horror Stalkers (CR 5, 11, and 19)

86618.name: Tigerns Öga (Issue 1)
rpgissuearticle: Rollspel på nätet, gratis att ladda hem
86618.description:
First and only issue of this RPG fanzine.

Contents (In Swedish)

Redaktören har ordet
Westerm genom tiderna
Lite tillägg till Playelf2
Inför Skymningshem: Andra Imperiet
Hålla ordning på familjen
Rollspelstidningen Fenix
Rollspel på nätet, gratis att ladda hem
Slutklämmen

86619.name: Tigerns Öga (Issue 1.5)
86619.description:
User summary

This "issue" only contains additional material for Playelf and was labeled as bonus material to Issue #1

86620.name: Galactic Frontier
86620.description:
From the designer.

The year is 2382 and the Milky Way Galaxy is teeming with life. The petty intra-planetary squabbles of the last millennium have given way to the hustle and bustle of interstellar commerce and entrepreneurship. Can you compete in the 24th Century? Play Galactic Frontier and see if you have what it takes!

Players select unique races (variable player powers) and set out to be the most successful entrepreneurs in the Milky Way. Players use influence markers to stake claim to resources and to keep their opponents at bay. By carefully managing their research efforts in 8 unique fields, players gain access to more advanced technology. The player who earns the most victory points by delivering rare minerals, advancing up the technology ladders, and avoiding the pesky space pirates will be the winner.

86621.name: The Centry
86621.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is more to being a fey than just having pixie wings and a curious interest in children. The deep wilds of the Feyrealm hold mysterious yet unseen but the world... until now.

Created for the upcoming adventure, The Key of the Fey, Combat Advantage presents this exclusive preview of this new creature for your campaign. Designed as a playtest preview, we're looking for some input on this creation to see if it meets the needs and goals required for the adventure in the way that only a few dozen playtests can do.

86622.name: Heroic Talents
86622.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powers are useful in combat, but some characters excel in their non-combat training. Experts in Dungeoneering can enhance their ability to infiltrate a dungeon; a well-versed student of Nature can recover from a failed attempt to track someone down or pull themselves out from the deepest woods; and anyone in touch with their Insight can feel a tingle on the back of their neck when danger approaches.

Heroic Talents are powers available to trained skills and used to substitute utility powers in the heroic tier, giving characters an extra tool for dangers other than monsters and guards. If your campaign makes use of non-combat encounter, these talents can come in handy.

86623.name: Paragon Talents
86623.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hot off the heels of Heroic Talents, our fifth installment of the Combat Advantage series for 4th Edition continues with Paragon Talents. Continue to turn your skills into utility powers called "talents" for ability on and off the battlefield. Making use of action points and level-based modifiers, paragon talents can up your game for situations in which initiative and attack rolls bear no matter.

86624.name: Reputation Feats
86624.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sixth release of our Combat Advantage PDFs for 4th Edition features Reputation Feats, a new type of feat that can be awarded to PCs or purchased based on successful adventures.

Minor reputation feats grant a PC a minor benefit when encountering townsfolk, purchasing or selling items. They are never bought, but granted by the GM to award a PC for a job well done and are meant to represent the infamy a hero gains as he makes a name for himself.

Major reputation feats work as normal feats, but have unique requirements. For example, the Dragon Slayer feat can only be purchased by any character who has slain a dragon at least three levels higher than himself. Learning from his experience, the hero earns special advantages against other dragons, but leaves himself vulnerable against other dragons in the future.

86625.name: Night of the Zombie Kobolds
86625.description:
From the publisher:

As the Barcos (Big Folks) prepare for their annual harvest festival, the Quahali Kobolds prepare for an annual event of their own...the Annual Harvest Raid! And you are among the lucky kobolds chosen to participate this year. Bringing tons of grain and goodies back to the warren will earn you a lot of respect among your peers, not to mention the fun of raid!

But something is amiss this year. The itii (village shaman) has been suffering strange visions (at least, stranger than normal). The humans seem to have abandoned some of their holdings. Soon, the truth becomes known as you find yourself in a battle for survival against shambling hordes of undead! Will you and your party be able to get to the bottom of this new plague and save your warren, or will you too become a Zombie Kobold?

Night of the Zombie Kobolds is an adventure for up to eight 3rd-5th level characters. While this adventure includes information from the Koboldnomicon, this product includes everything you need to run the adventure, including:


The complete printer-friendly PDF file outlining the adventure.
printable brochure handout for players, explaining the basic premise of the adventure. The brochure also includes the racial adjustments for the Quahali Kobolds and eight character concepts for the players.
printable handout of the Vermin Kin player class from 1st-5th level, including Vermin Kin spells
Important NPCs with stats at multiple levels for flexibility, the Zombie Mite (the flea-sized parasite responsible for the outbreak), and the Zombie Mite Zombie template
Overland color maps of the Mill and Silo areas of the adventure


This adventure also includes story ideas to continue your kobolds' misadventures long after this adventure has ended.

86626.name: Sidekicks
86626.description:
From publisher blurb:

They are the loyal followers of mighty heroes, firm believers in the cause, sworn to repay a PC for his deeds with his life while offering no incredible skills. In time, they become an equal force within the party and contribute that unique element to the campaign to make it one of your most memorable ventures.

Sidekicks are a special role in that they are minions designed to aid the PCs. Typically beginning as NPC guides, packmules, and sources of comedy relief, a sidekick can become a precious member of the party over time and can learn to take on the rigors of a class to fight side-by-side with the rest of the party... possibly even becoming a player character themselves.

This special edition of Combat Advantage provides complete rules for creating sidekicks in your campaign, along with three examples and rules for expanding sidekicks into class-based NPCs.

86627.name: The Lost Tomb of Argorathor
86627.description:
From the publisher:

The Lost Tomb of Argorathor - a 3.5 OGL fantasy adventure for 8th to 10th Level characters.

Argorathor stood surveying the scene of carnage around him. He snorted loudly and deeply, sucking in the smell of death, the whiff of bloody victory. Today, many had died and the people of the South had all but fallen. The name of Argorathor burned brightly indeed, sending fear and terror through the hearts of his enemies, for his infamy was unparalleled and the tales of his terrible deeds were such that his legend would now never diminish.

Tall tales have long told of the ancient Argorathor and his fantastic and deadly maze. A legend of his time - a minotaur of supreme power and charisma who led those that followed him against the Freecities of the South and who drove his enemies before him - it is said that his labyrinth is filled with gold and riches beyond imagination.

Do you dare face the challenge of The Lost Tomb of Argorathor?

- a 3.5 OGL fantasy adventure for 8th to 10th level characters
- illustrated by Gillian Pearce
- cartography by Keith Robinson
- 34 pages, including 11 illustrations, 1 fantastic maze packed with memorable encounters, and the unforgetable Fountain of Mixed Fortunes!
- fully bookmarked PDF

86628.name: Celestial Champion
86628.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long for the days of paladins warding off evil creatures with a holy word, summoning a blessed steed to their side, and standing as a beacon against the forces of the Lower Planes? There remains an order of paladins held to those tenets of old - the celestial champions.

Use this paragon path to add a nostalgic touch to your 4e paladin, including two new uses of the Channel Divinity feat and a ritual for calling down a celestial ride from the heavens. This edition also includes the opening theme for May's Not Suitable For Work and a letter from the Head Honcho on the condition of previous CAs.

86629.name: Revenant
86629.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your character is going to die. There's very little you can do to avoid it, but you can make your death mean something... and rise again to crush your enemies.

Our ninth edition of Combat Advantage offers the revenant but not just as a revised monster. Presented as a "resurrection paragon path", this undead reincarnation allows you to bring back a deceased character with a vengeance. Brought back by powerful forces, the revenant must carry on his life quest to avenge his death and kill his enemies with new powers and path features providing bonuses against those who have wronged him with roleplaying opportunities galore.

Along with the revenant, CA9 presents an Open Call for Risen: The Guide to Resurrected Characters.

86630.name: The Rawl
86630.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the early days of human civilization, the rawl were plentiful and voracious. Sprawling across the open landscape, they claimed many of the premier locales needed by the humans to build their cities and they never feared to spill blood defending them. Without the advancements and knowledge of humans, however, they were quickly wiped out and forced to retreat into the mountainous hillsides of forbidden valleys. Today, they exist in small numbers and many explorers consider them a myth.

The rawl is a new player race designed for 4e. Huddled from the outside world by the mountains, they are brutal opponents sporting sharp blades of hair on their backs and arms. Slicing through armor and injecting their victims with twitching poisons, their solitude has been interrupted by the prophecy of doom forecast by the spirits. Presented as a fully detailed race, this edition of CA includes rules for creating rawl player characters, as well as standard monster stats.

As a bonus, CA10 provides the first sampling of our Not Suitable For Work: Darkvision entries. Get three examples of how your characters can gain darkvision in ways that could be more interesting than you would think.

86631.name: Gol
86631.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who says orcs are just for the heroic level? No one ever told Gol or the legion of orcs following his powerful rise to infamy. CA11 presents Gol, a 22nd level sorcerer NPC, his pets (a rage wolf and a slash tusk boar), plus a horde of minions to round it all out.

And curious to try out a tiny PC? We've got five of them here, all thanks to the Not Suitable For Work (NSFW) contributors on EN World. Zip through the air on wings, crawl and hop across the battlefield, or climb on top of the fighter and swing your sword in glory - they're all 4E compatible and ready to duke it out with the big boys.

86632.name: Epic Talents
86632.description:
From publisher blurb:

On July 29, 2008, we released our first edition of Combat Advantage with the idea of a free irregular release to showcase unique 4E concepts too small to sell on their own. In honor of this anniversary, we showcase what makes Combat Advantage for what it's become - epic!. Talents receive the epic treatment in the third and final part of the series on skill-based powers; we take a look back at the first CA for a second look at Power Knowledge; and there's a 5-page preview of Risen to whet your appetite.

86633.name: Dark October
86633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Combat Advantage #13 is available now. Setting off the Dark October curse, it features "Ghosts of Tieflings Past," a variable-level encounter taking place on a haunted battlefield by Tim Rose; the morue, a race of ethereal creatures walking around in dead bodies by Todd Crapper; a preview of the chaostician from Risen; and an interview with Andrew Wilson from Silent 7 Games and author of Huxtropy.

86634.name: Savages
86634.description:
From publisher blurb:

The nights are getting longer and a chill seeps through the window. Winter looms in the sky, instilling a sense of dread in your heart. Dark times call for dark characters and Combat Advantage delivers.

CA14 brings you the darker side of 4E. Try your hand as a merc and work for the highest bidder (but leave your morals at the door), tap into your inner beast with the Beast Warrior multiclass barbarian/druid paragon path, and take on the fortitude of Blades, a Goblin Warlord with a penchant for spilling blood... your blood.

86635.name: Special Preview: Amethyst
86635.description:
From publisher blurb:

2010 starts with a bang from a flash grenade as we offer our BIGGEST ISSUE EVER!! 55 pages of completely free 4e goodies to suit more than just your fantasy D&D campaign.

For starters, we are embracing the comparison of 4e to video games by giving you MORE ways to incorporate those pixilated elements into your campaign. Fend off an invasion by the demon lord Bh'ouser or sample from his arcane concoctions of growth, flame throwing, and flight; failure need not be an option with the respawning powers of Sor'Lune, the Inn of Respite; take literal control of your combat by grasping hold of the Delightful Prism of Games; and pull off the ultimate button mash with action surges. Plus we've also got a review of the Night Reign Sneak Peek Compilation from Destiny Games and our first Artist Spotlight on Kieron O'Gorman.

Eh, but why just give you what we always give you? CA15 includes an exclusive preview of the upcoming Amethyst campaign setting. Biohazard is a quick-play rules module previewing sci-fi applications to the 4e rules and we've crammed it inside this issue for your perusal. Provided by DiasExMachina and Goodman Games, schedule to release April 2010.

86636.name: The Three Rings of Cassia
86636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eternally spinning from a far corner of the Astral Sea, a bizarre dominion awaits. Three rings encircle a solar orb, each ring rotating around the orb in an endless cycle of motion. And when two rings pass over each other, incredible magic happens. Introducing our first mini-setting, The 3 Rings of Cassia, and the messenger specialist class. Learn about this wondrous planar locale for your campaign using any of the six realms or create a character using one of the four new races provided.

Plus we have TWO previews (the kapre from the upcoming Buan campaign setting by Nosfecatu Publishing and the Perilous Secrets of Wilford Manor for the Doombringer Saga by Neuroglyph Games), a review of Soundscapes and our Sketchbook with Martin Hanford.

86637.name: The Key of Fey
86637.description:
From publisher blurb:

Combat Advantage #17 offers up more 4e goodness than ever before with 60 pages of new material. Teach your characters with Traits & Talents, explore the secretive dominion of Endera, expand your abilities with the Relic Guard specialist class, read about the 2010 PAX Expo, and peruse through the complete first chapter of The Key of the Fey.

user comment
Battlemaps: The Key of the Fey is 21 full-scale battlemaps designed for use with this Item

86638.name: There Are No Spoons
86638.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's that time again! Combat Advantage #18 comes to you just as free as ever with over 60 pages of original 4e material, including three new class builds and two adventures.

Psecrets of the Psorcerer By Michael Evans. The first of three new class builds, imagine the power of a sorcerer tapping into the energies of the Far Realm. It's chaos meets chaos!

Will of the Taskmaster By Todd Crapper. If you like playing monstrous characters, then this version of the warlord is for you. Crack the whip over your allies heads and hold back enemy forces in this alternate class build, complete with full stats and feats for using whips.

The Reach of the Thrasher By Tim Rose. Our third and final new build places the powerful reach of the flail in the hands of a fighter. Add a little striker to your defender and watch what happens. Suggestion: It's time to add some blood to your minis.

There Are No Spoons By Alan "Xahlt" Glover is a 1st-level rescue to save a lost child from a hideous creature deep in a cave.

Mind & Iron By Corwin Riddle (www.readyanaction.com), the newest member to our team, has your heroic tier characters fighting off robots plotting to take over a village.

And to round it off, Neuroglyph gives us his thoughts on The Realms of Chirak by Zombie Gods Publishing and the latest Sketchbook from artist James Denton.

86639.name: Dark Classes: Assassin
86639.description:
From Introduction:

Not everyone can be the good guy. There are times when a more underhanded approach is needed and there needs to be more bodies. Ethics simply get in the way. In a world where humanoids are outnumbered by monsters, demons scheme behind the curtain, and the strongest heroes stand alone against powerful forces, others are called upon to do what must be done.

This is the world of Dark Emerald accessories for the 4th Edition of Dungeons & Dragons™. Investigating the darker side of the fantasy campaign, these products began with the Quick Kill, a guidebook for characters to kill opponent in one strike with skill challenges, and continues with Dark Classes: Assassin. Murderers for hire, they are the elite of their kind. Professional to the extreme, they operate in secret with legends of their target spreading the word and bumping up the pay. Whether they work to a code or take on with the highest bidder, assassins can add unique developments to any game.

In this PDF, you’ll find the complete assassin class (including over 70 unique powers), three paragon paths (the poisoneer, suicide striker, and hood), new feats, and a list of unique weapons common to the assassin.

86641.name: Kid Kool and the Quest for the Seven Wonder Herbs
86641.description:
Kid Kool and the Quest for the Seven Wonder Herbs, known in Japan as カケフ君のジャンプ天国 スピード地獄, is a video game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1988 by Vic Tokai. It is a platform game akin to the Mario series. There is also a small red creature, "Wicky," that the player can carry, which will eliminate enemies when thrown.

The main character is on a quest to obtain seven herbs needed to help cure a king from an illness. The game will gradually progress from "day" to "night" modes as a timer runs. The game must be completed in three of these "days". Each "day" relates to one hour in play time.

There are two endings to the game triggered by whether or not the player completes the game in under 3 ``days.

The Vic Tokai game Decap Attack (Magical Hat no Buttobi Tabo! Daibōken in Japan) are part of the same family of games, considered spiritual successors of Sega's Psycho Fox.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kid Kool", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86642.name: Non-Stop
86642.description:
A pure dice rolling two player game. To win the game, a player must be the first one to have all numbers from 1 to 10 either marked or locked. Two dice is used to hit the numbers. A turn, ie. rolling the dice, continues as long as results of both dice (individual results or their sum) can be used in actions.

The actions are:-
1 mark own unmarked number, or
2 unlock(mark) own locked number, or
3 unmark the other player's marked number

At the beginning of a turn, a player is supposed lock all his remaining marked numbers (that the other player has not managed to unmark on his turn). During a turn, a player has an option to unlock some of these numbers (depending on the dice results), but can decide to not do so.

86643.name: Food Poisoning
86643.description:
From the publisher:

Too Close to Home

People die every day. People without SINs die even more frequently. That’s not news. But when people without SINs are being poisoned, when it looks like they’re being targeted somehow -- well, that’s no good. If someone’s going after people without SINs, that means the next target could be one of your contacts, or your fixer, or even you.

That would be incentive enough for most runners to look into this spate of poisoning, but Mr. Johnson’s got some cash to throw around, and maybe some hints of where to start looking. In Food Poisoning, runners have the chance to trace the spate of poisonings to its source, and to uncover the double-crosses and machinations behind all the deaths.

Food Poisoning is the eleventh in the current series of Shadowrun Missions, giving runners a chance to get increasingly tangled in the corporate politics of the Sixth World’s version of New York City.

86644.name: Spin Control
86644.description:
From the publisher:

The Dirty Business of Exposing Secrets

Journalists have faced plenty of accusations of acting with a hive-mind mentality, but some covert operations in Manhattan are about to take things to a new level. What starts out for runners as a simple investigation into gang activities turns into an exploration of some of the city’s darkest secrets -- the kind of things that tend to make anyone who finds out about them turn up dead. If the runners are going to survive this mission, they’re going to have to fight hard, make tough decisions, and possibly join forces with some unusual allies.

Spin Control continues the series of Missions set in the corporate web of Manhattan, giving runners the chance to strengthen bonds with some of the factions they’ve impressed in past jobs -- or to really stick it to a faction they don’t like.

86645.name: Something Completely Different
86645.description:
From the publisher:

It's Not Just a Show, It's a Happening

As any artist will tell you, the art scene can be brutal, especially in a high-octane setting like Manhattan. There are plenty of horror stories to go around -- but none of them can touch what’s about to go down at the Guggenheim.

In this Mission, Shadowrun players will find themselves in the middle of an art opening unlike any other, with chaos and screaming and dancing statues. Unless they keep their wits about them, the latest masterpiece in the museum will be painted in blood -- and to make things worse, if they can’t defuse the situation, they might not get paid.

Something Completely Different is the latest Manhattan Mission, giving Missions players a chance to learn more about the creative spirit behind some of the city’s artistic masterworks while also giving them the opportunity to shore up their alliances with powerful megacorps.

86646.name: Firestorm
86646.description:
From the publisher:

It's the Easy Ones that Get You

If you've survived enough runs, you know that the ones that sound easy are the ones that get you. And what could be easier than recovering a runaway drone?

As it turns out, plenty. The drone is acting strangely--strange enough that two megacorporations are interested in its fate. And there are others, who are no fans of the megacorps, who have got the scent of what's going on as well. The chase for the drone is putting a lot of people on a crash course, and when they collide, guns are going to come out. Can you survive the crossfire?

Firestorm continues the Manhattan series of Missions, giving the players a chance to get in deeper with some of the major powers of New York--assuming they live long enough.

86647.name: Knight at the Opera
86647.description:
From the publisher:

Eight teams escorting eight Damien Knights. Will the real Damien Knight please stand up.

86649.name: Lost Man's Trail
86649.description:
From the publisher:

Bob Bledsaw's final contribution to the fantasy world he created, the Wilderlands. This adventure module runs some 24 pages, with 12 maps covering the areas of encounters, in addition to detailed Campaign Maps for Wilderlands Hexes 3615, 3715, 3815 and 3914 of the Roglaroon and Gasconfold Plains Regions, between Modron and Tegel.

The trail east from Modron to the Coast, known as Lost Man's Trail, has been a source of mystery for some time. Adventurers have a habit of disappearing from the trail. Are they lured away by some enticement, or waylayed by the legendary Skandic Raiders? The only safe place to stay, The Fat Deer Inn, offers good ale, soft bedding, and an assortment of characters; each having their own reason for being there.

This product was written by Bob Bledsaw for use with the Judges Guild Universal System, and contains the latest version of charts to date. It is in original PDF format, this is not a scan of an old product. Happy Gaming!

86650.name: The Krion Conquest
86650.description:
The Krion Conquest, known in Japan as Magical Kids Doropie (まじかるキッズどろぴー), is a side scrolling action-adventure video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System, made by Vic Tokai in 1991. Later, Genki Mobile ported the game exclusively to Japanese mobile phones.

Story

The year is 1999. The player is put in the middle of a war already lost when the Akudama Empire (known as the Krion Empire outside of Japan) attacks the Earth with its army of robots. No conventional weapon in existence is efficient against this opponent. The robots are however totally vulnerable to magic. A hired mercenary, Kagemaru, summons the only non-sealed witch, Doropie (known as Francesca outside of Japan) to stop the Akudama Empire's offense.

Gameplay

Players control the wand-wielding character, who can fire different objects based on the wand type the player has selected. The gameplay resembles Capcom's Mega Man series, while the cut scenes resemble the ones in Tecmo's NES version of Ninja Gaiden. Among other things, her outfit color changes when a different wand is selected (using a similar style menu). The powers included are the normal shot (red outfit), the phoenix ability (pink outfit), the freeze shot (blue outfit), the bouncing ball shot (green outfit), the shield ability (orange outfit), and the broom ability (purple outfit). There is also at least one enemy which resembles a Mettool (the hard-hat enemies; officially spelled "Mettaur" in the U.S.). Unlike the first three Mega Man titles back then, The Krion Conquest allows players to shoot directly upward, crouch to dodge enemies and projectiles, and shooting charged magic before the release of Mega Man 4 (December 6, 1991) and most later Mega Man titles that feature the charging "Mega Buster".

Development

According to its designers, the development of the Magical Kids Doropie project took approximately 10 months to finish. The title was originally planned as a licensed game based on the 1986 anime, The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, because the main designer wanted to. However, in Japan, the anime's copyrights were held by TV Tokyo. Therefore, the designers were unable to use it and decided to think up their own basic design until Doropie came about like that. Doropie's name is a remains of Dorothy in The Wonderful Wizard of Oz anime. The rest of Doropie's design didn't have any other Dorothy nor Oz references nor model in particular. But the character designer gave high priority to the point that quite a few people noticed in her design. Which is, Doropie having no eyelashes. Drawing eyelashing is a one of a expression method of a female character. But the character designer tried to make it cute without symbolic parts, and she was created. Her witch costume with a magical broom was the oldest heroine's design used in arcade and home video games back then.

Release differences

The North American version, The Krion Conquest, excluded some features from the Japanese version, Magical Kids Doropie, such as the removal of the "Continue" feature (making it more difficult), no lives to pick up, and no official English names for other characters (making its plot weaker). The most obvious difference between the original Japanese release and the North American version is the removal of every cut scene, except the introduction sequence and several redrawn in-game graphic elements. The circled hexagram seen at the end of each stage in the Japanese version was removed in the North American version due to Nintendo of America's rules not allowing religious beliefs in video games.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Krion Conquest," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86652.name: Opus Operandi: Dark Side of the Sun
86652.description:
From Introduction:

Dark Side of the Sun introduces an interesting new twist to the Opus setting which is sure to inject your campaign with some uniqueness. This is a very nonlinear format, so be prepared for that make-it-up-as-you-go-along element. Where possible we've tried to cover most eventualities.

Each Opus adventure highlights and introduces a different aspect of the Opus world. Dark Side of the Sun explores an historical aspect of Opus and is the first in the Chronicle series. Other sets include the Pantheon series (introducing one of the Opus religions) and the Locus series (focusing on an Opus location).

86653.name: Taint and Sanity
86653.description:
From the publisher:

Some places and items are so evil or filled with Chaos that exposure to them marks a character in a very real and difficult-to-cleanse way. Taint is evil. It is a corruption so deep that it warps the very plane of reality. A weapon used to slaughter thousands of innocents, a forest grown on land soaked in the blood of an evil deity, or a book bound in the flesh of an archfiend for his own horrible purposes, are all sources of taint. Taint makes evil a physical threat to the well-being of characters and can have a lasting impact on characters, even killing those who remain exposed too long.

Sanity is the natural mental state of ordinary life. Normal mental balance is endangered when characters confront horrors, entities, or activities that are shocking, unnatural, and bewildering. As a character encounters monsters, witnesses horrible acts, masters forbidden knowledge, or casts spells, his Sanity score, and his corresponding ability to function as a normal character, deteriorates. Soon, all that is left is a gibbering madman.

This 28 page supplement contains all the rules that GM's and Players need to add Taint and Sanity to their RuneQuest games.

Requires the use of the RuneQuest(TM) Main Rulebook available from Mongoose Publishing.

86654.name: Opus Operandi: Chains in the Dark
86654.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Chains in the Dark, to be used either as a standalone adventure or as part of the on-going Opus Operandi campaign setting. Everything needed to run this adventure is included within. Some of the details may conflict or not fit in with your own campaign if you are playing in an alternative setting. Named places and histories have been kept to a minimum and are easily changed.

Each Opus adventure highlights and introduces a different aspect of the Opus world. Chains in the Dark is the first adventure of the Pantheon series, introducing one of the Opus gods into your game, in this case Jetava, goddess of the air, the wind and the
light.

86655.name: The Lost City of Jershon
86655.description:
From the publisher:

Long ago, a treasure hunter long thought dead suddenly showed up in the small river town of Talara with tales that astounded everyone. He claimed to have found an ancient subterranean city hidden underneath one of the many mountains in the uncharted lands to the north. He had nothing to show for his journey, and what was left of his clothing was tattered and torn. Many thought he had simply lost his mind, while just a handful thought he had invented the story to account for his miserable failure as a treasure hunter. Regardless, the rumors of the lost city of Jershon have persisted to this day, bringing fortune and fame to the river town of Talara.

Welcome to the Lost City of Jershon supplement for RuneQuest! This book contains information about the once thriving river city of Talara, as well as a guide to Jershon, the mysterious city of legend. Game Masters can easily insert this city anywhere into their own campaign world, taking any portion of the material that they like, and tweaking elements of this material to better fit their own campaign.

Additionally, there are also descriptions of townsfolk, monsters and items that are associated with Jershon.

86656.name: Quiz!: Tack för att du visar leg.
86656.description:
A simple quiz game with cards. All in all the game comes with 160 questions in various topics.

No rules are included, other than that you play to 15 points.

86657.name: Outpost Qether (RuneQuest)
86657.description:
From the publisher:

Outpost Qether, for use with the new version of RuneQuest is a setting guide to the westernmost Tirasim frontier. This outpost is home to all sorts: traders, criminals, farmers, and military men. It's a place where hope is fading fast now that the Judges in the capitol Arioch have decided that the fifty-year-old installation has outlived its usefulness. Unless someone finds a good reason for the outpost to remain, it will be shut down.

Recently however, local scouts have returned with news: the Gadianti have set up a small post to the East and are digging for... something. Perhaps it might be just the thing to give the outpost reason to exist. All they need now is a party of adventurers to find out what's going on over there.

This adventure is ready to run right out of the box. Everything you need is within these pages, including: detailed NPCs, maps of Qether and the outlying regions, and the adventure itself.

Are you ready to uncover the secrets of Outpost Qether?

86658.description:
Heroes of Chaos Isle is a promo set of 6 brand new Characters for Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck. Featuring all new art by artist Beth Hancock and with an all new card design, the cards are printed on 4" x 6" card stock. You can get a great visual of your remaining life as you place tokens on your character on the new Hit icons. You can even mark off your hits using a dry erasable marker. This all new promo character set is available exclusively from the Board Game Geek store.

Requires the original Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck core game to play.

Disgusting Fact: the Hit icons on the cards were generated from real blood. Yummy.
86658.name: Chaos Isle: Heroes of Chaos Isle

86659.name: Kaiju
86659.description:
From the publisher:

Oh No! There Goes Tokyo!

Giant Monsters have been a part of modern fantasy and horror for more than 50 years. Now you can bring these behemoths to your modern d20 System games.
Kaiju contains:


Rules for creating giant monsters
Monumental creature type -- a new size category for d20 System creatures
Titanic damage -- a new type of damage caused by these giant creatures
Advice on how to use kaiju in your campaign
A history of giant monsters in the movies


Written by Stan!, whose design work includes d20 Modern, The Modern Player’s Companion, Urban Arcana, and d20 Future, Kaiju presents rules for giant monsters that fit mechanically into the core modern d20 System rules while still capturing the flavor of Japanese monster movies.

Requires the use of the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game, published by Wizards of the Coast, Inc.

86660.name: To Save a Nation
86660.description:
From the publisher:

To Save a Nation is an introductory adventure set in the world of Diomin for 4 to 7 beginning RuneQuest characters of good alignment and heroic disposition.

This adventure is an introduction to both players and Game Masters to the wondrous world of Diomin - a land where magic is real and the Gods play an active part in the lives of mortals.

The adventure begins at the docks of the Tirasim capital of Arioch and ends in the forests of the Arak, blue-skinned barbarians with an extreme dislike of trespassers. Players begin the adventure as hirelings, and come face to face with powers and people beyond their wildest imaginations as they quest for the lost sword Kammerath. They will confront the foul Gadianti, explore mysteries long thought answered, and bring hope to a nation.

In the end, they will become heroes.

Requires the use of the RuneQuest Core Rulebook published by Mongoose Publishing.

86661.name: To Save a Nation
86661.description:
From the publisher:

This adventure, for use with the new version of RuneQuest, introduces you to the legendary and mythic world of Diomin, a dark fantasy setting where the mighty deeds of heroes, and the terrible atrocities of villains, clash amidst the mysterious machinations of the gods.

Become immersed in a world where a dark and twisted race attempt to bring about the total annihilation of all life, and then offer up the world to their terror inspiring goddess. Where a once great race, blessed of their god, fled from their corrupted brethren back to the land of their ancestors. And a time when a people long divided, now stand face to face on the brink of a war that threatens all the races of Diomin.

Will the actions of the players be the great and mighty deeds of heroes? Or the dark plots that bring about the destruction of all creation? Only you can provide the answer!

Everything you need for an entire evening of play is included in this book, including 7 pregenerated PCs to choose from!

86662.name: MechWarrior 3: Pirate's Moon
86662.description:
MechWarrior 3: Pirate's Moon is the only expansion pack for MechWarrior 3, with an all new storyline and 20 new missions, plus six new 'Mech and a number of weapons. The player has the choice to play as either a pirate (attacker) or as 'Lance Leader' (defender) for the Eridani Light Horse.

Source: Wikipedia, "MechWarrior 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary
Pirate's Moon also allow you to pilot an Elemental power suit.

86663.description:
Ever felt like the Cultist needed some help taking care of those bullies who keep picking on him? Now he has it! Rat King adds a whole new dimension to monsters in Ascension! While up until now monsters have impacted the game only by providing a reward to the player who defeats them, the Rat King leads his hordes of Giant Rat minions to swarm all over the center row and wreak havoc on the best laid plans. In game terms, the Rat King cards are shuffled into the center deck, while the Giant Rats are placed on the side. When the Rat King shows up in the center row, cover every other card with a Giant Rat. Players need to defeat these rats — or the King himself — before being able to get to the other cards.

Ascension: Theme Pack – Rat King comes with two copies of the Rat King and ten Giant Rats, enough for the rodent infestation to strike twice in a single game!
86663.name: Ascension: Theme Pack – Rat King

86664.name: Le Super Morpion Tournant
86664.description:
Le Super Morpion Tournant (The Great Turning Tic Tac Toe) is a "tri-dimensional turning tactical game" according to the label on the side of the game box. The game is 3D four-in-a-row game with some distinct differences from the common forms such as Score Four:

The game is for two or four players.
The game box contains a brief rule sheet in French, a game board, and 64 beads in four colors, 16 of each color.
The middle of the game board consists of a four by four array of 16 rods, the central four of which are placed on a turntable. Thus, the central four rods may be turned relative to the board. In the periphery of the game board is space for an additional 16 rods which may be arranged in the corners (four player game) or along the ends (two player game). Each rod is able to contain a stack of four beads.

At the beginning of the game each player starts out with 32 beads, eight of each color (two player game) or 16 beads, for of each color (four player game). All of beads are positioned at the peripheral rods at start.

On turn, each player is either placing one of his/her beads on one of the 16 central rods on the game board, or turning the central plate 90 degrees clockwise.

The objective of the game is to create alignments of four different colored beads. Each such alignment earns the player one point. The player with most points at the end of the game (when all the beads have been played) is the winner.

86665.name: SUWS/NSUWS
86665.description:
SUWS/NSUWS is a simple introductory system which allows to simulate land and naval battles mainly during the pre-gunpowder era.

It is easy to understand and play and players must face the same problems of their historic counterparts, finding some battles very hard to win, and to lose, or very slow or fast, finding themselves in the same climax of the leaders which fought hundreds of years ago.

The game includes:

Two set of rules, basic, for easy introduction, and advanced, for a deeper game.

Two scenarios books including naval and land battles ranging from ancient Greek and Roman era to European medieval and to Japan civil war; covering battles never simulated before like Al-Qadisiyyah or Dan-No-Ura.

Each battle has its own map (of a standard size) and includes advanced and special rules if needed.

More than 1,000 front-back easy-to-understand counters including Leaders, infantry, cavalry, archers, ships and other units with unique symbols based on era and geographic area, European and eastern, of all forces involved.

Charts and table.

The game is open to suggestions, new ideas and scenarios, and a blank map and blank counter sheet is included to help in development.

Actually the game is in Italian tongue only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

86666.name: SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE
86666.description:
SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE is a science fiction game of exploration, colonization, war and conquest in deep space; it is a cross-over of the first edition of Twilight Imperium and of Conquest of Paradise from GMT taking elements from both.

It is a fast and easy game to play and learn, it is good to introduce new players to wargames or for a one-session evening.

The game includes:

Easy to understand Rules
240 Megahexes used to build the map
Nearly 800 front-back counters including troops, colonies, planetary defences, warships, explorer and more
27 Random events cards
Charts and tables for easy play
The game system is based on Kevin McPartland Conquest of Paradise (GMT) fantastic game.




Currently the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

86667.name: E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?!
86667.description:
E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! is an economic-oriented game inspired to Role-Playing Games, what future awaits an old sorcerer, fighter, paladin etc. after their retirement?

How they invest their gold pieces and how they maintain their glory and fame?

In E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! 3-6 players are ex-adventures whose, once retired, are trying to invest their gold, trying go to become more and more famous and to climb social hierarchy and now, becoming older, they need the services of young adventures.

To reach their targets now they must buy land, build manors, trying to attract people and build a little village, engage young adventurers to defend their proprieties, and defend themselves from any kind of bureaucracy, an hard work, the main challenge must still start…

The game includes:

Easy to understand Rules
Map of a city and surrounding area
Counters including gold, adventures, manors and more.
Charts and tables for easy play.
The game system is based on “Metropolis” (Editoy) game.




Actually the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Designer Gian Carlo Porciani
Artist Gian Carlo Porciani

86668.name: Ardwin
86668.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Land of Ardwin is another REIGN mini-setting for use with the REIGN rules. More, though, it gives you a toolkit for the traditional fantasy races. Ardwin is home to orcs, elves, dwarves and more, ready to step into their traditional roles. At the same time, it can serve to examine why they occupy those roles, and what the impact of biology and society are on orcish bloodlust and elfin hauteur.

86669.description: Catan Scenarios: Helpers of Catan – a mini-expansion for Catan that's compatible with Catan: Seafarers and both Catan: 5-6 Player Extension and Catan: Seafarers – 5-6 Player Extension – consists of ten character cards, each of which has a different special ability that the player can use once or twice before trading for another. For example, Marianne lets you take any one resource card if you rolled something other than a 7, but didn't get resources from that roll. As each player builds her second settlement, she takes a specific card based on player order, with approximate utility increasing to help combat earlier player advantage. A player must use her card's ability before she may turn it in, but she may choose which card to take, adding a level of strategy.
86669.name: Catan Scenarios: Helpers of Catan
boardgameexpansion: The Settlers of Catan: 15th Anniversary Wood Edition

86670.name: Glories of the Most High
86670.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Secrets of the Incarnae Revealed

The Exalts of the Unconquered Sun, Luna, and the Maidens of Destiny have always known that the Incarnae have had an interest in them, but what is really known about the Incarnae themselves? Glories of the Most High reveals many secrets of these higher powers, and a slew of new materials to use in your Exalted series.

The book includes:
-Complete stats on the Unconquered Sun, Luna and the five Maidens.

-Dozens of new Charms for use by Solar, Lunar, Sidereal and Abyssal Exalts.

-Additional secrets, rites, characters and errata for use in your Exalted game

86671.name: X-Blades
86671.description:
From the back of the box:

Her Looks... CAN KILL!

Journey through ancient temples and ruins with Ayumi. An alluring treasure-hunter determined to unlcok the secrets of a powerful orb and acquire untold riches. However, everty treasure has its price - Ayumi has been struck by a mysterious curse upon finding her greatly desired artifact. Can you help Ayumi free herself from the curse? In this thrilling anime-style action-fest. You will encounter fierce battles as you help Ayumi confront her ultimate fate - whatever it may be.

- Use Ayumi's pistol-blades to engage in melee or ranged combat instantly
- Over 20 different unlockable spell abilities
- Non-stop hack-and-slash action in beautifully detailed enviornments
- Gripping fantasy story with two possible endings

86672.name: Dragon Flight
86672.description:
Dragon Flight is a racing game for 2-4 players.

Using strategy and luck, players must race their dragons across a modular map, avoiding obstacles and attacks from their competitors.

On each turn players use hand cards to enable their dragon to fly at defined speeds and altitude across a modular hex map, containing obstacles of various heights, namely floating mountains.

Race your dragons through the rings, placed at various height weigh points and back home again, making best use of your cards and the available thermals (up-drafts and down-drafts) to gain and lose height. Attack your enemies with powerful flame attacks and force them to lose control.

86673.name: Paranoia
86673.description:
Paranoia is a game of tiles fast-paced and furious. And that happens because there are no turns. As in a discussion without a moderator, where no one respects the word and all speak at once, in Paranoia all play at once. But, in the middle of this whirlpool, there are rules that everyone must respect and give the game a fair balance between the noise and reflection, between order and chaos ...

Initially, all players receive 10 hexagonal tiles and they must put them in their stand.

The objective is to be the first to play all your pieces.

86675.name: Dârkh
86675.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Notre monde est envahi par les Démons ; quelques anti-héros luttent pour les renvoyer en Enfer...


User Translation from French:

Our world is being invaded by the Demons; some anti-heroes struggle to return them to Hell...

86676.name: Totémique
86676.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

L'ancienne civilisation humaine a disparu depuis bien longtemps.

Ses villes sont devenues de vastes forêts de béton et de verre, hantées par les cybériens, terribles créatures métalliques et paranoïaques, disciples de Cybernet, un dieu électronique dont l'influence s'exerce sur la planète.

Les derniers Hommes se sont alliés à la Nature pour vaincre Cybernet. La domination du dieu-machine a duré plusieurs siècles, et l'heure de la renaissance humaine est venue !


User Translation from French:

The old human civilisation disappeared a long time ago.

Its towns have become vast forests of concrete and glass, haunted by the cyberians, terrible metal paranoid creatures, disciples of Cybernet, an electronic god whose influence they exert on the planet.

The last Men are allied with Nature to defeat Cybernet. The domination of the god-machine has lasted many centuries, and the time of the human resistance has come!

86677.name: A Time of War Quick-start Rules
rpghonor: 2011 ENnies for Best Free Product - Silver Winner
2013 ENnie for Best Free Product - Silver Winner
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
86677.description:
From the Publisher:

The Quick-Start Rules for A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG includes rules, recordsheets and since 2010 also provides a brief adventure (Probably Too Good To Be True) to get you familiar with the game and its mechanics.

user comment
the print version was bundled with Shadowrun Quick-Start Rules (Free RPG Day 2012 Edition)

86678.name: Sphérurges
86678.description:
From the Game's Description:

Elles sont apparues un jour sur Terre. De grosses sphères colorées, de 1 à 6 mètres de diamètre. Quel est leur but ? Sont-elles une manifestation des pouvoirs cachés de l'esprit humain ? Nul ne le sait, mais certaines personnes ont appris à entrer en harmonie avec une sphère...


User Translation from French:

They appeared one day on Earth. Some large coloured spheres, 1 to 6 metres in diameter. What is their purpose? Are they a manifestation of the hidden powers of the human spirit? Nobody knows, but certain people have learned how to achieve harmony with a sphere...

86679.name: Corners of the Realm: The Myrddin
86679.description:
From the Publisher Blurb:

Far out at sea, a mysterious race known as the Myrddin lives in seclusion. Bring them out of hiding and into your game with this first installment of Corners of the Realm, a new series designed to bring exotic races and places into your 4th edition adventures.

The Myrddin are a race of nimble eel-folk that use their electric tongue attack to stun prey and attackers. Though they once lived in rivers on land, they were hunted to near extinction and exiled out to sea. Struggling for survival, they banded together to form giant floating cities from the remains of driftwood and wrecked ships. Come explore what secrets the sea can hold in this new fully loaded supplement, with everything you need to incorporate the Myrddin into the game whether you're on the high seas or not.

86680.name: Enigma
86680.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

1942 : Allemagne nazie domine l'Europe. Cabalistes juifs, résistants, agents secrets, les héros s'opposent aux sociétés occultes nazies, cherchant à mettre la main sur les plus précieux et mystérieux manuscrits du monde.


User Translation from French:

1942: Nazi Germany dominates Europe. The heroes (Jewish Cabalists, resistance agents, secret agents) oppose the Nazi occult societies, trying to get their hands on the most precious and mysterious manuscripts in the world.

86681.name: Corners of the Realm: The Tvari
86681.description:
From the Publisher Blurb:

Deep in the darkest parts of the swamp live a not so quaint race of mushroom folk. Created long ago by a clumsy wizard, the Tvari are ready to spice up your 4th edition Dungeons and Dragons game.

The Tvari are a race of intelligent mushrooms with a great love for the arcane magics that brought them to life. They live for stories of high adventure and are just waiting to explore. Watch out though, this highly competitive race has a natural spore attack that can poison, blind, or even cause an enemy to have hallucinations! Embrace the magic and see what the Tvari are made of. You'll never think of mushrooms the same way again!

86682.name: Fantastic Races: The Arak
86682.description:
From Introduction:

In the language of the Arak, the word “arak” means “the First.” This is the source of their pride, their noble carriage and their isolation.

According to the other races of the world, the Arak are little more than blue-skinned barbarians who live in the outskirts of the world. If during a conversation with an Arak you were to call him a barbarian, he would probably snort and mutter, “What do you know? You are but a simple T’endrak.” Unless you spoke Araki, the fact that you had just been given the worst insult that one of the Arak can utter would be lost on you. If you did speak it, you’d know that he had just called you “a Second.”
That is the core of the Arak worldview. You are either one of the Arak, or you are just a Second…simple, foolish and one of the lost.

Play an Arak if you want...

to be a member of a race proud of your ancient heritage.
to be tough and wise.
to strike your enemies with the skill of the expert hunter.
to be a member of a race that favors the barbarian, ranger, shaman and warden classes.

86683.name: The Elkram
86683.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elkram are the newest edition to the Poison Ivy Press family of excellent races for your D&D 4th Edition game! Designed to be used as both a playable race, and as NPCs/villains, this supplement is a perfect edition to any campaign. This new race is packed with all of the extras, and as always, delivers all of the tools you need to add new characters and encounters to your adventure. We provide the full range of options for the elkram to be used as a playable race, as well as plenty of plot hooks, campaign advice, and new monsters for low-paragon level combat.

The Elkram are a suspicious sentinel race who guard the natural world vigilantly. Resembling walking stags, and able to shift in and out of the spirit world, they are the reactionary agents against any force that would threaten to harm or pervert the natural world. They lurk in the forests and wait in the shadows for the opportunity to destroy aberration and abomination wherever they lay. They’re quick in their deliberation, and will end a life for the greater good of protecting the sanctity of nature without second thought.

This race is an awesome way to get ready for all of the great primal content coming in the new PHB2. As usual, we’ve gone above and beyond to bring you a load of content in this supplement. In addition to all of the great flavor, we’ve brought a host of new options, including magic items, feats, paragon paths, monsters, and more. Included in this supplement is…

The Elkram as a playable race, including 5 new feats and a racial paragon path
The ecology of the Elkram, including their origins, physiology, and culture
Elkram characters, and advice on adventuring and roleplaying as an Elkram
8 new monsters for low paragon tier battles, including villains like “Otaktay, the Cold One”
Using Elkram in your campaigns, including sample adventure hooks, NPCs, and locations

86684.name: The Kroola
86684.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ahoy there, Kapt’n!

Tired of pitting your players against the same old orcs and kobolds in every campaign? Well give the swabbies somethin’ to cheer about, and send them on a rip-roaring adventure with the Kroola! Whether you’re roamin’ the swamps, sailin’ the seas, or just need a tough-as-nails mercenary to get the job done, the Kroola are ready for any kind of campaign!

The Kroola are reckless, roving race of swashbuckling crocodile pirates that spend their lives chasing fun and treasure, wherever it may lay. They are born in the swamps and raised aboard ships on the high seas, learning to fight for surivival, forage whatever they need, and take whatever they want. A Kroola enjoys a fresh drink, likes a good fight, and loves a great prank, and isn’t afraid to go overboard on any of the three! After all, with a Kroola’s regenerative blood, it’ll all grow back, right?

With their tough hides and resilient bodies, a Kroola can play a vicious defender that won’t get pushed around. They’re also slick and sneaky strikers who can take advantage of wild terrain to get the edge on an unsuspecting opponent. A Kroola can come in many shapes, sizes and colors, from the small and crafty croc to the hulking Kroola Kolossus. With their reckless attitude, their penchant for violence, their long toothy snouts and scaly hides, the Kroola make for an intimidating race that many folks consider the scourge of the seas. But some landlubbers will never understand that a Kroola is just out to have some fun.

Here at Poison Ivy Press, we don’t like to scrimp on the rations. We give you access to the whole hoard, with somethin’ for every member of your krew! Here’s all the booty you get with the Kroola supplement:

The Kroola as a playable race, including a range of racial feats and the Kroola Kolossus paragon path
The ecology of the Kroola, including their physiology, settlements, and societies
Kroola characters, and advice on adventuring and roleplaying as a Kroola
New monsters, from the swarms they use as pets to unique Kroola villains like Kruncha the Pirate-King King!
Using Kroola in your campaigns, including sample locations and NPCs




Break out the rum, boys! The Kroola have arrived!

86685.name: The Kroola: Koldbloods and Karnivores
86685.description:
From publisher blurb:

They're back!! In this free supplement for The Kroola, we've brought you a whole second round of content for using kroola in your campaigns! In case you missed them before, kroola are seafaring, swamp-dwelling brigands with regenerative cells, a love of the fight, and a penchant for violent pranks. Good natured, they make fierce enemies, trustworthy allies, and a great addition to any campaign!

This product includes:

A new epic destiny, the Kryptid!
7 new kroola monsters, including 2 villains, Kommidore Karnax and Srix, the Knife.
A new basic weapon type, the cutlass.
A set of printable counters for your battlemats.

86686.name: Barony of Cul
86686.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Baron Frostweaver proclaims Cul to be a land of freedom and opportunity, but that gracious claim extends only to the frostborn. Members of other races are subjected to high taxes, harsh punishments, and severe beatings. As Cul grows stronger, the neighboring realms watch in anticipation, for many suspect the usurper plans to unleash his armies upon them in the near future. And yet at the same time they must play a game of appeasement, for Cul commands a small but important trade road.

86687.name: Book of Friends and Foes: Under the Mountain
86687.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Get personal- fully fleshed arch-nemeses and cohorts for your characters await within! The Book of Friends and Foes delivers five NPCs to fill out your game session. Each supplement describes distinctive personalities based on a locale or theme and targeted to a specific CR range. Built for character interaction, these NPCs can both help and hinder a party as your story requires. Use them to hang plot hooks and move your adventure along.

Go Under the Mountain and meet your doom and your comrade in arms. Inside this CR 5-7 supplement, you will find:


Sak’Aeda: the dark creeper out to hunt dwarves
Samm Kull: the human at home in the deep caverns as any dwarf and twice as gruff
Night Wraith: the vampiric champion and advisor to the svirfneblin court
Dead-Eye Grimpick: the dwarven priestess and clan executioner
Merrin Rubneck: the retired warrior and owner of the Headless Orc Brewhall

86688.name: d66 Compendium
86688.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Roll your dice and enhance every aspect of the universe you love. Know the names of Moons, Space Stations, and that scruffy-looking Vargr sitting at the bar as soon as your players ask. Blast off for Adventure and leave the details to the d66 Compendium.

Based on the one of Traveller’s best-selling PDF series, this collection of quick-reference lists brings the Traveller universe to life with an abundance of imaginative multi-use descriptions to embellish your worlds, your characters and your encounters. It delivers those niggling details about technologies or cultures that make your game come alive-gender-specific names for many of the setting’s alien inhabitants plus mega-corps, manufacturers, pirate ships and even seedy underworld organizations. Tie up the finer points of character creation with names, contacts, homeworlds, scars, and more. The d66 Compendium gives players and referees alike the charts to adventure.

86689.name: d66 Planet Names 2
86689.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

By popular demand, Planet Names 2 bring you 36 all new worlds names for your players to explore. Have the right name at the tip of your tongue.

86690.name: Nicolas Sarkozy
86690.description:
User Summary:

A one-page RPG in which each player takes the role of an aspect of Nicolas Sarkozy's personality. It is designed to work best with three players; any additional players beyond that number instead play the role of public opinion, deciding which of Sarkozy's character facets gains the most control.

86691.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 13 - October/November 1996)
rpgpublisher: Sleipner - Landsforeningen af rolle- og konfliktspillere i Danmark
86691.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page): Johan Sennels
3 Leder (Editorial): Peter C. G. Jensen
4 Indhold (Index)
6 Gammel vin på nye flasker... (The editors)
7 Nyt dyr i stalden (The publisher): Morten Jørgensen
8 Rollespil, Satan og Massemordere (RPGs, Satan and Serial Killers): Brian Rasmussen
12 Nyheder (Game news): Brain Rasmussen
14 Kort om kort (Card games): Mads Lunau Madsen
18 Heureka! (Ideas from newspapers): Sebastian Flamant
23 Get a life nerd! (Interviews): Peter C. G. Jensen & Palle Schmidt
26 Tegneserie (Comic): Palle Schmidt
28 Brevkassen (Letters): Rasmus Rasmussen
32 Mørkets Hjerte (Heart of Darkness): Merlin P. Mann
38 Centralen (Club news): Kristoffer Apollo
41 Få dem på Krogen, Part III (Get them hooked, part III): Peter C. G. Jensen & Merlin P. Mann
41 Græsset er altid grønnere (The grass is always greener): Kasper Nørholm
42 Que?: Balder Asmussen
42 Drengestreger (Boys stuff): Mads Pedersen
43 Smilet (The smile): Kåre Kristiansen
43 En ulykke kommer sjældent alene (bad things come in threes): Kåre Kristiansen
44 Sorte Øjne (Black Eyes): Paul Hartvigson
56 En Trolds Tårer (Tears of a troll): Troels Johansen
58 Dømt som nørd! (Judged a nerd!): Palle Schmidt & Merlin P. Mann
60 Anmeldelser (Reviews): Kasper Nørholm
60 Cybertechnology: Matias Stuven
60 Netrunner: Brian Rasmussen
61 The Autumn People: Brian Rasmussen
61 GURPS Celtic Myth: Brian Rasmussen
62 The Elders Revenge: Paul Hartvigson
62 King of Chicago & The Secret of Marseilles: Paul Hartvigson
64 Bagside (Rear page)

86692.name: d66 Planet's Main Industry 2
86692.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

By popular demand, Planet's Main Industry 2 helps you to shape your world with 36 all new main business. Describe your worlds in unique ways to your players.

86693.name: d66 Space Station Names 2
86693.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

By popular demand, Space Station Names 2 is here and ready for your game. 36 all new space station names allowing you to focus on the plot of the game.

86694.name: d66 Mercenary Company Names 2
86694.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

By popular demand, Mercenary Company Names 2 brings you 36 all new names of the deadliest in private military forces. These men, women and aliens fight for the highest bidder and can be in the way of your players.

86695.name: d66 Objects Orbiting a Planet
86695.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

The space around a planet is seldom empty. Now with Objects Orbiting a Planet, you can tell your players what is out there with confidence. No more fumbling while you quickly try to come up with something new. Now you can tell them exactly what is on their sensor screen with confidence.

86696.name: d66 Spaceport Bar Names
86696.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Many spacers love a good drink once they land and businesses are happy to sell them a desire. Spaceport Bar Names gives you the names for those bars, taverns and alehouses for your game. Give the spaceport some new flavor with this d66 list.

86697.name: d66 Spaceport City Names
86697.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Every advanced world has a city with a main spaceport. Spaceport City Names quickly gives you that city name, allowing you to focus on storytelling. Each evokes a unique flavor for your memorable locations.

86698.name: d66 Uses for a Hiver
86698.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Hivers plot and scheme but did you know they also have their uses. Uses for a Hiver is a list of useful ideas conceived of by a the Avalar Brotherhood and distributed throughout the Foreven Sector of space. Read more about what they think are some of the best uses for Hivers in this latest d66 list.

86699.name: d66 Graffiti
86699.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Graffiti covers much in run down urban landscapes. Evoke a sense of dread and danger in your players and add color to the location with these short descriptors.

86700.name: d66 Organized Crime Boss Names
86700.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Organized Crime Boss Names provides with a name to hire or hunt down the player characters. The criminal underworld is a dangerous place and someone has to keep it inline.

86701.name: d66 Fronts for Organized Crime
86701.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Fronts for Organized Crime give names of "legitimate" businesses and organizations that criminal syndicates use to launder money, distribute their illicit goods and provide cover for their other illegal activities. Give your mob bosses legal cover today.

86702.name: d66 Shipping Company Names
86702.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Shipping Company Names gives you a quick name for a shipping service that transverses the blackness of space. Give your players some competition and a rival corporation.

86703.name: d66 Planetary Survey Team Names
86703.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Unknown worlds on the edge of civilized space need scouted out. d66 Planetary Survey Team Names can give you a quick name for your players to interact with. Keep your players intrigued.

86704.name: d66 Mega Corp Names
86704.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Governments come and go but the corporations go on and on. d66 Mega Corp Names supplies with the names for these behemoth, profit-making organizations. They're always hiring enterprising individuals that do not ask a lot of questions for some...work.

86705.name: d66 Ship Names 3
86705.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

When your players scan five ships in a row and want you to name off of them, d66 Ship Names 3 can get you out of a jam with ease. This takes the pressure off of coming up with names of ships that that are of little consequence in your game.

86706.name: d66 Cargoes 2
86706.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Need a new and interesting cargo for your players to find? d66 Cargoes 2 brings you 36 brand new and interesting options to send your players way. Their next big score may be a roll of the dice away.

86707.name: d66 Exotic Atmospheres
86707.description:
Publisher Blurb:
