Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Exotic Atmospheres helps you to describe worlds without breathable atmospheres. Add some flavor to your solar systems with a different atmospheres.

86708.name: Urbi & Orbi
86708.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Dans ce jeu de rôle, les joueurs interprètent des agents secrets du Vatican, chargés d’enquêter sur les sectes hérétiques, les découvertes scientifiques douteuses, les blasphèmes et le communisme.


User Translation from French:

In this role-playing game, the players play secret agents of the Vatican, responsible for investigating heretical sects, questionable scientific discoveries, blasphemies and communism.

86709.name: d66 Robot's Current Instructions
86709.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Seldom are robots simply sitting around doing nothing. Most are engaged in some activity. Describe the activity to your players with d66 Robot Current Instructions. Just watch out. Not every robot is ordered to engage in honest activity.

86710.name: d66 Random Things Found in a Ship's Hold
86710.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

If your character believes the only thing ever found in cargo hold is cargo, they would be rather surprises. d66 Random Things Found in a Ship's Hold details any number of items that you might find in a hold besides cargo. Give your characters something interesting inside ships they board.

86711.name: d66 Robot Names
86711.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Robots need names also. When you're stuck without a name, d66 Robot Names is there to help. Inspired by popular science fiction from the past thirty years, give your robots a name that will make your players feel right at home.

86712.name: d66 Smells on a Ship
86712.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

The moment your players step on a ship, they should smell a particular oder. That sensation should change from ship to ship. d66 Smells on a Ship helps to create the proper atmosphere you are trying to convey to your players. Help every ship they set foot on come alive by describing a whole new sense to them.

86713.name: d66 Reasons for the Communication/Sensor Systems Not Working
86713.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Reasons for the Communication/Sensor Systems Not Working gives you thirty-six different reasons why your players cannot use such equipment. Inspired by popular science fiction and real world possibilities, your players will have to figure out how to properly fix their equipment or their situation before going further.

86714.name: d66 Pirate Ship Names
86714.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Pirate Ship Names helps you out when the players ask for a ship name and you had not prepared one. Now you can quickly get yourself out of such a situation as well as have a valuable resource while getting ready for next session. Strike fear into the hearts of your players when the pirates come acallin'.

86715.name: d66 Comet Names
86715.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Comet Names helps you flesh out your solar systems. Each gives you the name of a floating ball of frozen gas for your players to mine or refuel from deep in the vacuum of space. The real mystery is what lies inside that cold ball, locked away for thousands of years.

86716.name: d66 Planet Names
86716.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Planet Names bring you all new names for world in your game. Few systems only possess one world. Now those worlds can be named quickly and still be vary widely. Bring depth to your solar systems and keep the action moving with this list.

86717.name: d66 Alcoholic Drinks
86717.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Alcoholic Drinks describes the names of thirty-six unique drinks. Now your players can enter a bar and order more than a beer. Give them instead a Starchaser Pale Ale. Create a character that only orders only Lemon Avalar, "Shaken, not stirred."

86718.name: d66 Planet's Main Industry
86718.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Planet's Main Industry gives you a quick method to characterize a planet and bring it to life. Never have another planet, moon, or base in your universe without a reason for why they are there.

86719.name: d66 Mercenary Company Names
86719.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Mercenary Company Names gives a unique name to groups for players to encounter. Additionally, it serves as an inspirational spring board for players searching for their own group's identity.

86720.name: d66 Space Station Names
86720.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Space Station Names provides instantaneous named for the myriad of orbital cities, relay stations, weapons platforms, and research facilities floating among the stars in your game.

86721.name: d66 Ship Quirks
86721.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Ship Quirks gives character to a ship the players come across. Make every ship encountered fun and unique.

86722.name: d66 Damage to Abandoned Ships
86722.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Damage to Abandoned Ships describes why a ship floating in space or lying around a planet is no longer functioning. Give your players a new mystery to uncover.

86723.name: Yonaguni
86723.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

1942 : Le Japon impérial domine l'orient. L'île de Yonaguni, près de Taïwan, est la plus occidentale des Îles Ryukyu, intégrées à l'empire à la fin du 19e siècle. Un jour, de mystérieuses ruines cyclopéennes émergent au large des côtes : qui osera les explorer ?


User Translation from French:

1942: Imperial Japan dominates the orient. Yonaguni Island, near Taiwan, is the westernmost of the Ryukyu Islands, incorporated into the empire at the end of the 19th Century. One day, some mysterious cyclopean ruins emerge offshore: who will dare to explore them?

86724.name: d66 Ship's Galley Contents
86724.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Ship's Galley Contents describes anything players might find to eat on a ship, be it either in their own galley or in a random ship they encounter. Describing a great bounty of food after a profitable run or an empty hold helps to deliver the gravity of the situation to your players.

86725.name: d66 Personal Spacecraft Names
86725.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Personal Spacecraft Names deliveres names appropriate for someone's personal pleasure ship. Pirates or corporations need not apply; these ships belong to the rich and the meager owners of outer space travel.

86726.name: d66 Emblems
86726.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Emblems describes a crest, logo, pendant or other distictive marking for your players to remember. Everything you need to give a royal house, corporation or mercenary company that extra bit of flavor can be found on this list.

86727.name: d66 Ship Names
86727.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Ship Names gives you with a wide range of ship names for your players to encounter. Everything from pirate ships to private yachts to corporate mining vessels can be found right on this list.

86728.name: d66 Aslan Names
86728.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Aslan Names makes both player creation and NPC creation a snap. Finding the perfect name for a random NPC or for that special encounter with this list.

86729.name: d66 Cargos
86729.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Cargos gives your players something unique and interesting to find. Instead of just having a nondescript cargo worth so many credits, why not give your players something they might enjoy for themselves.

86730.name: d66 Tattoos
86730.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

d66 Tattoos gives your NPCs a splash of flavor. Instead of just another faceless description for your player's next contact, why not liven them up with a few tattoos.

86731.name: The Club
86731.description:
Primarily a score-based game, The Club is Bizarre's take on the third person shooter. The gameplay is fast paced and very arcadey; don't even think about hiding behind cover in this one folks! A unique new scoring system asks you to chain kills together in quick succession, building up your combo and grabbing you more points. The higher your combo the faster the bar ticks down, so it gets tougher and tougher to continue your deadly killing spree.

To keep your score high you'll need to burst into rooms of enemies with all guns blazing; the combo system pushing you further and further to your limit. However, don't take too long dispatching your target or your score will drop. If there are 30 bad guys in the level, that's potentially a 30x combo you could earn... practice, practice, practice!

The Club has been compared to all sorts of games in a variety of genres; is it a shooter, a racer, or a fighting game? Well in practice it's a little piece of each...

Source: The Publisher Website.

86732.name: Sand Cobras
86732.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Sand Cobras borrow through deserts and beaches. Their venom slows the mind and their strength pulls those they grab under the sand to their doom. Stand up to the challenge and save the day, or fail to defend yourself and become this creature's next meal.

86733.name: Krakodarans
86733.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Krakodarans swim through the ocean searching for food. What should you do when hunger drives them to see your ship as their next meal. Fight with all your will and endure their terrible shout.

86734.name: Necro-Soldiers
86734.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Necro-Soldiers carry out their tasks from beyond the grave. With a computer for a mind and dead heart for a soul, these merciless troops complete their mission with deadly accuracy.

86735.name: Ice Goliaths
86735.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ice Goliaths rule the frozen wastelands of winter worlds. Blending in with the ice and snow they attack from nowhere. Their skin flaps give them control over their descent while their fangs and claws prove deadly weapons.

86736.name: Paskrin
86736.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Paskrin bite and chew their way through wood, rock and bone to get to their favorite meal. Unfortunately, that meal is the metal used to make jump drives, life support and other key systems. These tenticled rats earn their place as the bane of engineers and mechanics everywhere.

86737.name: Spiders
86737.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Spiders have killed creatures of all sizes throughout time. Even after spending centuries living among the stars, these eight-legged menaces still pose a threat. Having adapted to new environments, some grow to human size. This issue presents rules for spiderwebs and introduces rules for several different types of venom.

86738.name: Spiked Scorpions
86738.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Spiked Scorpions normally lie in wait for their pray. Now these creatures begin attacking bases and civilian locations on worlds they inhabit. Their pincers crush anything it catches and their tail delivers a powerful attack. With their thick armor covered in spikes that harm those that use natural attacks, these creatures remain a formidible threat to those unprepared to those not prepared for them.

86739.name: Jump Angels and Demons
86739.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Once inside Jump Space, it is easy to feel safe and secure. But even here unknown creatures fly through the hull of a ship. Through the walls, Jump Angels and Demons chase and taunt those they encounter. Bullets do not harm these being of energy and those that tell their tale after encountering these beautiful and terrifying creatures receive laughter and ridicule for their sincere warnings.

86740.name: Tarhhuf Riding Wolf
86740.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Tarhhuf Riding Wolves stand as tall as a horse and face down foes larger then them. When riden, they represent a deadly force. These trained hunting animals also make excellent status symbols among the rich and powerful (as long as it doesn't eat their pretentious owner).

86741.name: Vampire Skrillids
86741.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Vampire Skrillids swarm their target and feed before laying their eggs. If the eggs hatch inside the target, they rip a whole on their way out to their next target. Find out all you can about these tiny creatures before you encounter them and are caught off guard.

86742.name: Ants
86742.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ants build, tunnel, and destroy. They break down any barrier that gets in their way. And they fight. They take on creatures many times their size, devouring them in a matter of moments. Ants range in size from small enough to step on to large enough to tear small spacecraft apart, and they pose a serious threat to anyone that gets in their way.

86743.name: Creatures of Distant Worlds Compendium 1
86743.description:
Publisher Blurb:
On distant worlds in the deepest regions of space, unknown creatures await unwitting explorers. Close to home, devious politicians and gangsters lure native wild life to carry out their dirty work while maintaining denyability. On a frontier outpost, primitive life forms walk the uninhabited regions hoping claim the civilized place as their new home. Be prepared no matter where your players go. Be ready with the Creatures of Distant Worlds.

Compendium 1 brings you the creatures from across science fiction all in one place. Each one represents a threat faced by characters in books, movies and video games that you can bring to your table. Combine the creatures with diseases, poisons and mundane animals, and this book spells trouble for your players.

86744.name: The Worshipping Swords
86744.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Religion is meant for the masses, not the clerics and the paladins alone. While not everyone can cast divine spells, anyone can live a life dedicated to their god and anyone can pray. But only a few serve for centuries in a weapon for the god.

Book of the Faithful: The Worshiping Swords details nine swords containing the soul of a faithful follower that choose to serve their god for all time. One sword for each of the nine alignments, The Worshiping Swords gives your players unique weaponry to obtain, use, or destroy. Give your players new challenges and new weaponry.

86745.name: Everyday Machines
86745.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Everyday Robots 1 presents normal, everyday machines of the far future for your characters to own, interact with, and encounter. From construction mechs to holographic computers to servant robots, this supplement rounds the science fiction out the feel for your game.

86746.name: Spaceport Tech 1
86746.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Every spaceport buzzes with tech. Security bots, weapons scanners, repair drones, and mechanized casino workers. With your players skipping around from planet to planet, they may experience a wide range of technology designed with the intersteller traveller in mind. Spaceport Tech brings your far future setting alive with new and different robots, scanners, and drones for your players to encounter and own, as long as they get past the customs inspector robot with the twin Gatling gun arms.

86747.name: Battle Dress 1
86747.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Battle Dress 1 presents four all new battle dress for soldiers, military units and private owners: the Krieg designed for heavy weapons combat, the Wind Dancer for high jumps and agility, Thunder optimized for law enforcement, and Wolf built for snipers to evade detection. As a bonus it details the Hummingbird compressed sonic rifle. Protect yourself with the best in defense.

86748.name: Colombo
86748.description:
Players are sailors who try to reach America before the other players, starting from Europe and crossing Atlantic ocean. During the perilious travel they'll have to avoid storms, mutinies, hull crashes, winds, also thanks to Colombo's cards' help.

In order to achieve their objective they'll have to draw and play the right cards and to move their ships the fastest way possible to reach the american coasts.

86749.name: Fighters and Small Ships
86749.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ships streak across the sky, carrying cargo and passengers within a solar system. Fighters battle pirates and other disasters of space. This indispensible tech keeps the wheels of commerce flowing from outlying bases and outposts to major worlds. Fighters and Small Ships details these support vessels for your game, making your universe come alive.

86750.name: Villehardouin
86750.description:
From the Perfect Captain website:

The first in our series of Spare Change games, Villehardouin is a campaign game of the Byzantine Reconquest of the Morea in southern Greece in the year 1263 AD.

Players take the role of either the Achaean Franks under Prince William de Villehardouin, freshly back from captivity in Constantinople, or that of the Byzantine Empire under the Sebastocrator Constantine (the Emperor Michael VIII's step-brother).

As with all of our games, supply and logistics are as important as naked force. Never fear- there is of course no bookkeeping. At the start of each turn players figure out how much "change" they gather to fuel their activities for the turn. Simply marching off into arid and barren territory, even if it is strategically important, will leave you high and dry and out of supply- forcing a humiliating retreat. Players must plan carefully where they are going, how long they will be there, and what can go wrong; losing a battle will deplete your treasury as well as your army.

The opposing armies are different too, adding another element to strategy. The Franks have excellent cavalry and good foot troops, but not many skirmishers. The Greeks have an abundance of archers and ambushers as well as hard fighting regulars, and a corps of Turkish mercenaries (of dubious loyalty..). Both sides have to pick their battlefields and their timing must be near-perfect to pull off a game-winning battle.

The terrain is not the friendliest; each players base is green and lush, but you can't win by sitting still. Feint and counter-feint will be the order of the day, but when the time comes, you must strike. Sieges can be long, but sudden assaults costly. Greeks can set up ambushes while the Franks can attempt impetuous charges- either one can, if handled properly, bring about your opponent's overthrow.

This is the kind of game where there can be no wasted moves; everything is important, and dilly-dallying will hurt you sooner rather than later. This is a game that will lead to taut nerves and a lot of beard stroking!

Does it take long to play?
That's entirely up to you. You could easily fly through it in an hour, but if you want to win you'll need to think things through very carefully. Still, it's one of our quickest-play games.

86751.name: Sabria Armored Cargo Transport
86751.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Warp speed! Engage! Now your crew in your Traveller setting can travel faster than light as you pass through normal space. This ultra-high tech ship travels one or two parsecs in a fraction of the time it use to. Check out this ship and tell Jon Brazer Enterprises what you think.

86752.name: Danguard
86752.description: Two players game: one player will take control of Danguard, hero of the humanity who will have to stop the other player evil project to harm terrestrial bases with his terrible ufo robots. Danguard will win by destroying 3 ufo robots. Ufo robots will win by occupying and destroying 4 terrestrial bases

86753.name: Camel Adventures
86753.description:
Adventure game where players will travel worldwide, from Africa to America, from Asia to Australia. The game is divided in two main phases: during the first phase players will decide where to go, the right season, try to search a good sponsor supporting their expedition and buy the right items to survive.
During the second phase they'll leave for the expedition and try to do their best to avoid accidents and hazards also thanks to their equipment.
The winning player is the one completing the adventure first.

86754.description:
Team-based card-game with a fantasy theme.

Players group in teams and struggle for the dominion over the land of Mystras. Each team starts with a treasury of 50.000 Iros (the local currency) and tries to exaust the other team's treasure by winning battles. Players have also to spend the Iros in order to gain cards from the personal marketplaces of each player, thus needing to balance the expenses in order to avoid damaging their own team.

The game box includes:
- 36 pages rulebook
- 196 cards
- 8 Marketplace player mats

Available in Italian since October 2010. International editions to follow.
86754.name: I Signori dei Draghi
boardgameexpansion: I Signori dei Draghi: I Segreti di Mysthras

86755.name: Monsters and Other Childish Things
rpghonor: 2008 ENnies - Product of the Year - Nominee
86755.description:
From Introduction:

Monsters and Other Childish Things is a roleplaying game about kids with pet monsters. Like childhood, its tone is intended to be in parts whimsical and horrific.

Kids from age ten up to early teens find themselves bonded to horrors from beyond time and space who want to be their friends, play fun games, and devour the souls of their enemies.

The adult world is still reeling from the revelation of monsters, and many can’t help wondering, “Why now?”

But while it’s about kids, this game isn’t really meant to be played by kids. Gamer kids could totally handle the mechanics, but I think mostly adults will appreciate the gallows humor and the occasional grownup themes.

From user summary:

This is the original version available prior to the publication of Monsters and Other Childish Things: The Completely Monstrous Edition.
rpgpodcastepisode: AP – Monsters and other Childish Things – “DSCM 1: New Arrivals”
AP – Monsters and other Childish Things – “DSCM 2: The C-Team”
AP – Monsters and other Childish Things – “DSCM 3: Down in a Hole”
AP – Monsters and other Childish Things – “DSCM 4: After Curfew”
Monsters and Other Childish Things: Coronet
Monsters and Other Childish Things: Junkyard on the Edge of Forever

86756.name: Blood and Brains: The Zombie Hunter's Guide
86756.description:
From publisher blurb:

zombie (ZOM-bee): n. 1. According to voodoo belief, a supernatural power that can enter into and reanimate a corpse. 2. A corpse revived in this way. 3. One who looks or behaves like an automaton. 4. Target practice.

Our professionals at the National Center for Reanimation Prevention and Control (NCRPC) have done all the hard work so you don't have to - chopping, hacking, chainsawing, and blasting the bloody gibbets off of the shambling undead, all to make your life a little easier. If you've got a case of the zombie blues, this book's the cure.

Blood and Brains: The Zombie Hunter's Guide is a d20 Modern supplement full of zombie hunting goodness, including:

10 new occupations
a new organization (The National Center for Reanimation Prevention and Control)
16 new feats
plenty of stuff to blow zombies up with, including the trench spike and Shaolin spade
seven new combat techniques
five new advanced classes
three psionic powers and 37 spells
madness and trust rules
five new FX items
and of course, lots and lots of zombies (over 20), including a random zombie generator




So what are you waiting for? Grab your shotgun and your axe and start the dezombification process in your local town today!

86757.name: Blood and Fists: Modern Martial Arts (d20 Modern Edition)
rpghonor: 2004 ENnie for Best Rules Supplement - Runners Up
86757.description:
From publisher blurb:

From Aikido to Zen!

This supplement contains over 100 real world martial arts styles and maneuvers as well as science fiction styles for space and post-apocalyptic settings. From Aikido to Zen, Blood and Fists has it!

86758.description:
How many words, movie titles or famous people, can you and your team guess in 90 seconds? Set the word generator on your head, press it and a word appears. More than 2000 names, movies, objects and animals can be shown on the word generator. You're teammates can sing or yell instructions. You should lose no time to guess who or what's on your head because you have 90 seconds to guess as much words or names as possible. Ben Ik Napoleon is a party game where the fun and enthusiasm splashes.

(From the Publishers website)
86758.name: Ben ik... Napoleon?

86759.name: Bible Caravan New Testament
86759.description:
Bible Caravan is a travel game that takes players on an imaginary trip through the Holy Land for the purpose of learning the location and significance of 30 places described in the Bible.

Each player gets a map board of the Holy Land depicting a caravan route. Players then select text filled tiles that match their caravan route cities, and play the tiles upon their board, matching the city tiles with Bible verses printed on the right side of the map board. Scoring is determined by locations filled and correct verse identifications.

86760.name: Lost Lineage Volume I: Phantom Elves
86760.description:
From Introduction:

This installment of Lost Lineages focuses on the Lythain, commonly referred to as phantom elves. The Lythain are significantly different from the common elves presented in the core rules, but great effort has gone into making sure that they can exist in the carefully woven fabric of your campaign without the GM having to put in undue effort or use a shoehorn. That effort notwithstanding, if phantom elves do not fit into your campaign per se, you can still use the items and classes presented in this product to give a bit more depth to your own elven cultures.

86761.name: Lost Lineage Volume II: The Giant-Blooded
86761.description:
From Introduction:

This installment of Lost Lineages focuses on the Dana-Tuath, commonly referred to as the giant-blooded. The Dana-Tuath are significantly different from the common races presented in the core rules, but great effort has gone into making sure that they can exist in the carefully woven fabric of your campaign without the GM having to put in undue effort or use a shoehorn. That effort notwithstanding, if Dana-Tuath do not fit into your campaign per se, you can still use the classes presented in this product to give a bit more depth to your own cultures.

86762.name: Wondrous Items I
86762.description:
From Introduction:

The Reliquary introduces new magic items for use in d20 fantasy games. This installment of the Reliquary focuses on wondrous items, but also includes a rare and precious nonmagical armor as well as four new special abilities for magic arms and armor.

86763.name: Mixed Magic Items I
86763.description:
From Introduction:

The Reliquary introduces new magic items for use in d20 fantasy games. This installment of the Reliquary runs the gamut, covering specific armor and weapons (one type of each), four new magic rings, three unique staffs, and fifteen wondrous items.

Some of the items presented here have values uncharacteristic of their category. This is because while they may be very expensive and difficult to produce, their impact on the game is less than their price in gold pieces would suggest.

86765.name: Social!
86765.description:
Social(c) is the game of social interaction! While working together, construct a question that someone must answer. Each player gets a hand full of cards with a single word on them. As the turns go around the table, each player plays a single word. Once the question is complete, someone must answer the question. Will it be you? The question being asked is both uniquely your choice and the choices of others. Be careful though, you might be the one that must answer! Earn points based upon the words chosen in your sentence. After the question is answered, the real fun begins. Participate in mini-games that include everything from storytelling, acting, dance offs, trivia challenges, a game of craps, or a stare off. Each expansion comes with its own twists and challenges!

Social comes in several different flavors, each to meet the needs and interests of the gamer. Unlike most modular expandable games, Social does not require all previous expansions to be able to play the game. A single base kit is required along with any number of expansions to create a personalized deck of cards. Some base kits come with expansions. The purpose is to provide new gamers with popular expansions for cheaper pricing and an enhanced level of customizations to decks.

Additional expansions are able to be purchased separately.

The white label expansion includes the very basic set of Social.

Included within this tasty morsel are 189 playing cards that are sure to keep even the most loquacious gamers busy. 2-4 players. Ribbon, box, and cards included. A great starter set for any Socialite!

Source of information (Company website, Social Flyer, and Instructions).

86766.name: The Kerberos Club (Savage Worlds)
86766.description:
From the back cover:
THE HEROES AND VILLAINS OF A STRANGE CENTURY!

Doctor Archibald Monroe, the erudite chemist and physician-chimpanzee.

"Stony" Joe Smithson, the honest London boxer transformed into living rock.

Maeve O'Connel, who by darkness defends Whitechapel as the terrifying Night Hag.

Who the victims and enthusiasts of magic and bizarre science meet in an infamous club for "the Strange", thrilling action is sure to follow!

The Kerberos Club is a Wild Talents sourcebook for superheroic roleplaying in Victorian London. It includes a treatment of Victorian society in its every particular, especially the incredible and sometimes awful changes that "the Strangeness" comes to wreak upon Queen and Country alike.

The Kerberos Club (Savage Worlds Edition) is a sourcebook for superheroic roleplaying in Victorian London. It includes a detailed history and thorough treatment of Victorian society in its every particular, especially the incredible and sometimes awful changes that "the Strangeness" comes to wreak upon Queen and Country alike. It requires Savage Worlds and the Savage Worlds Superpowers Companion to play.

There is, after all, every good reason for the club's motto: "MALUM NECESSARIUM."

86768.name: Abetto
86768.description:
“Abetto” is a dynamic, exciting game, where players become gentlemen and ladies brought from Arsen Lupin's stories and compete with each other for the name of the greatest burglar, lover and fencer of the nobel underworld.
There are several ways to achieve success. By means of committing burglary you can get trophies and gadgets that are essential to win the game. They also help you in overcoming challenges of the game as well as give you an opportunity to harm your opponents. By shooting at rivals or dueling with them you can steal their chosen trophies but you may also lose yours.
Mechanics of the game is based on modified roulette rules. Players bet the result on a special even/odd table and a number table (1-36). The probability of failure is small – only 25% - and can be further reduced by means of some gadgets. The esthetic wooden roulette is attached to the game.
In order to smooth down certain randomness that accompanies burglaries, shoots and duels, so called task cards were introduced to the game. There is a different task for each round and after accomplishing it a player receives prize in the form of trophies and gadgets. Fulfilling the task depends solely on player’s behavior.
The game board is based on a tile system. Players arrange it themselves and each time they compose a different district in which the game takes place.
Abetto game provides large interaction between players and a great deal of emotions. Even during another player’s turn you take active part in the game.

Publisher Blurb

86770.name: Sundered Skies Compendium 1
86770.description:
Publisher Blurb:

TAKE TO THE SKIES, BEFORE THE SKIES TAKE YOU!

Sundered Skies: Compendium 1 contains 4 thrilling adventures full of peril, horror and madness.

A shattered world. A thousand floating islands. A constant glow of madness. Sundered Skies begins where every other world ends.

The Ice Tower takes the heroes to the artic wasteland of the Draining Sea. There they must contend with the elements, savages, and zealots if they hope to pillage the ancient resting place of The Battlelord.

Fate of The Summoner sends the heroes all over the skies in an attempt to recover cursed salvage causing mayhem and madness. Can they hope to solve the mystery of the lost skyship, The Summoner?

In Blade of Destiny A find on a forgotten island out in the void sets in motion a series of events which sends the heroes to the hottest depths of the Skies, as they seek to save the soul of one of their number. Can they cheat fate as they struggle against The Blade of Destiny!

Mindthief starts off with a routine courier job, which soon becomes a desperate race against a powerful member of the Bright Cabal with the ability to tear memories from its victim’s minds. This adventure takes the heroes from the monster haunted ruins of the Shattered City to a temple hidden below the teeming streets of Gateway and a desperate chase across a haunted, forgotten island, where alliances must be forged with the most untrustworthy of allies to survive a terrible threat.

Sundered Skies is a dark fantasy setting for the award-winning Savage Worlds by Triple Ace Games.

86771.name: Time of High Adventure
86771.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is the Time of High Adventure...

Whether racing to contain a plague of inhuman proportions, quashing a cult dedicated to one of the oldest horrors in the known world, or delving into one of the most twisted dungeons ever devised, this is indeed the time of high adventure, when heroes rise, villains fall, the dead walk, and pech sell tickets!

Embrace the Days of Peril and Plunder

-Three adventures playable by parties of any level
-The Realm, a plug-and-play campaign setting
-Decorative and print-ready maps and handouts
-Stat sheets to prep NPCs and adversaries in minutes
-Sessions and sessions of gaming goodness!
Time of High Adventure brings back the old-school excitement of classic fantasy modules, thrusting you into a land of turmoil and danger, a land begging for champions and a return to the glory of old.

Your Legend Shall be Chronicled

boardgamecompilation: Koffer zu und ab die Reise
86772.description:
This game takes us across the map through the large cities of Europe and the adjacent Mediterranean countries. The aim is to be the first player to put down all of his Citycards. You can do this by working the shortest route between cities. The more often you play the game the better you will know your way about the map, the better you willbe able to select your routes critically, and the faster you will be able to put down you cards.

The game is a variant from Journey Through Europe but without dices.
86772.name: Where shall we go?

rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
86773.name: So It Begins
86773.description:
From the publisher:

Answering a simple cargo hauling job post leads the players down a path of discovery that will change the Twilight Sector forever. 'So It Begins' is the first installment in a new exploration campaign set in the Twilight Sector. From humble beginnings the players will gradually pull back the curtain on some of the Twilight Sector's ancient secrets.

86774.name: Reiner Knizia's Ra
86774.description:
User Summary

This is Reiner Knizia's Ra for iOS.

86775.name: Deadliest Catch Sea Adventure Board Game
86775.description: Now you can be the captain of your all-time favorite Deadliest Catch ship: Time Bandit, Wizard, Northwestern, or Cornelia Marie and compete for the most "red gold" aka Alaskan King Crag. Survive the hazards of the Bering Sea as you race to drop your crab pots and return to port with the largest crab count. The board game that recreates all the winning show action! Game includes quad-fold game board, 18 navigation cards, 20 crab pots, 6 hazard chips, Coast Guard chip, and 4 ship markers

86776.name: Shokrok Throwdown
86776.description:
From the company's webpage:

Shokrok Throwdown is a futuristic team sports game in which creatures from different worlds come together to compete in a dangerous arena. Form a team with your friends and control your athlete from a first-person shooter style view. Choose from several different creatures like the bestial Varulf or the hi-tech Juggernaut, each of which has a unique set of skills. Play one of three positions and fight to help your team win. Players must coordinate closely with other team members to neutralize the opposing team's strategy and
develop an effective one of their own. Different creature/position combinations allow for highly varied playing styles.

Shokrok Throwdown also features:

> a musical score with 12 original tracks
> 25 different single player "levels"
> original artwork, a slick interface and tons of visual effects
> 18 different creature/position combinations, each with a unique set of special abilities
> over 50 different skills and abilities to master
> up to 12 players can play together over LAN or the internet
> AI controlled bots for use in single or multiplayer play
> a highly detailed stat tracker

The objective of Shokrok Throwdown is simple. There are 7 shokroks in an enclosed arena. Your team must capture and defend more shokroks over the course of ten 60 second turns than the other team to win.

86777.name: Riddle of the Sphinx: An Egyptian Adventure
86777.description:
User Summary

Riddle of the Sphinx: An Egyptian Adventure is a first-person Myst-style adventure game. The archeologist Sir Gil Blythe Geoffreys has been cursed after making a discovery about the Great Pyramid of Giza, and the player must explore the area and solve puzzles to free him from the curse.

86778.name: 100 Really Dumb Things You Have to do While Playing This Game
86778.description: In 100 Really Dumb Things YOU have to DO while PLAYING this game, players will do some ridiculous things while laughing uncontrollably at each other. Players might draw cards that tell them to salute the nearest wall, do the Chicken Dance around the room and meow like a cat while wearing a cat nose. Other cards set off chain reactions among players. Your actions might cause players to tap their heels together and say 'There's no place like home,' do a hula dance using a tambourine, pretend to jump rope or hiss like a snake. One dumb thing definitley leads to another in this zany game of craziness!

86779.description: A cooperative game in which 1-4 players race against time to jointly solve crimes. The game board is a map of the city of Osh Vegas. Crimes occur randomly throughout the city. The police move to the crime scenes as allowed by a special movement die. Then using five 6-sided dice, crimes are solved if the police on the scene can roll 3 of the same number. To win, the players must solve all of the crimes before time runs out.
86779.name: Osh Vegas Police

86780.description:
This mini-expansion contains 9 bonus planets for use with Eminent Domain. It includes 3 Prestige planets and 6 Utopian planets. These planets are intended to spice up the game and add an interesting twist to the Survey role, making your choice of planets, and therefore your strategy, more interesting

Prestige Planets
There are 3 Prestige planets, each with a different cost, representing important or famous worlds that confer a lot of influence. However, they do not help to satisfy any research requirements, they do not provide symbols, and they do not have any resource slots.

Utopian Planets
There are 6 Utopian planets, each with the same cost, representing impressive utopias where any type of resource can be produced and any type of technology can be studied. The resource slots on Utopian planets can store any type of resource, so when producing a resource you may choose which type to produce.

When researching technology, a Utopian planet counts as any type of planet you already have for purposes of satisfying planet requirements. However, for each research role you may only count 1 Utopian planet this way. For example, if you have 1 Advanced planet and 2 Utopian planets in your Empire, then you could choose Advanced technology cards from level 1 or 2 (but not level 3). You could not choose any Metallic or Fertile technology cards unless you also have planets of those types in your Empire.
86780.name: Eminent Domain: Bonus Planets
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 017 – I, Geek interviews Seth Jaffee

86781.name: Gyromancer
86781.description:
Gyromancer is a puzzle and role-playing video game developed by PopCap Games in collaboration with Square Enix. In the game, the player moves through a map of an enchanted forest, battling monsters using their own summoned monsters through a puzzle-game battle based on PopCap's Bejeweled Twist. In these battles, the player rotates groups of four in a grid of gems to line up three or more jewels of the same color; when enough lines have been created damage is dealt to the enemy. Between battles, a story is told through a series of cutscenes, while the player and the summoned monsters gain experience and power using role-playing game elements.

The initial idea for the game was inspired by Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords, a 2007 video game which members of both companies were playing at the time. The game was proposed to Square Enix half-jokingly by PopCap's chief creative officer Jason Kapalka during a meeting between the two companies in 2007, and was released on the Xbox Live Arcade and on the Steam platform for Windows PCs by Square Enix on November 18, 2009. Gyromancer received a generally positive reception from reviewers. Critics took issue with perceived limited graphics, some aspects of the music, and a weak and confusing plot. Despite these flaws, in general they found the game to be fun and addictive, and to have a great deal of replay value.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gyromancer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86782.name: Doug Brown
86782.description:
User Summary

Doug Brown is 46 levels of 24 relatively straightforward mini games. It is occasionally narrated with snippets of "hard-boiled noir storyline," but don't expect an immersive experience or Raymond Chandler.

86783.name: Church Windows
86783.description:
From the box: The beautiful stained glass windows of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John need your help. Use all of your cards to rebuild the apostles and you win Church Windows!

User summary: Players "rebuild" church windows by swapping cards from their hands to mixed up windows on the table. Once a window is repaired, a new window in the opposite color (red or black) can be built next to the repaired window.

The player who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

86784.name: Football Card Game
86784.description:
From the box:
Hours OF FUN for 1 or 2 players. Play at home or carry along to play while traveling.

YOU CALL THE PLAYS! Run...Kick...Pass. There are touchdowns, pass interceptions, fumbles, penalties, field goals, in fact, everything but a water boy.
All the thrills of a real football game are enjoyed while playing this game. Never two games alike.

Play using regulations football rules of your choice: high school,college or professional rules. Se enclosed cards with rules on how to play and instructions on easy way to keep track of te first downs, line of scrimmage, etc.

86785.name: Organized Crimes
rpgissuearticle: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly
86785.description:
From the back of the book:
Armed robbery..a high speed chase through slick city streets..and a cache of diamonds. The makings of a routine mission-until your heroes cross paths with the Organizer and face the menace of the MIDNIGHT MEN!! (Bring plenty of bandages)

86786.name: Search for the Sensei
rpgissuearticle: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly
86786.description:
From the publisher:

This scenario has been designed for use with the revised gaming system for Villains and Vigilantes, and presents a complete adventure setting for four or more players. This product is designed for the Gamemaster's use only. Anyone planning to participate in the adventure as a player should not read any further.

It should also be noted that the material in this scenario is subject to the Gamemaster's expansion, deletion or alteration in order to make it more suitable to his/her campaign. Special attention should be paid to the statistics and powers of the Amida Tong, the NPC villains provided for this adventure. Although experience levels are supplied, The Gamemaster may find it necessary to modify these values slightly, depending upon the levels of hidher own player-characters. It is suggested that the combined total of the villains' experience levels (those with super-powers only) should be at least three to four times as high as the combined total of the player-characters' experience levels. A few NPC heroes are also provided, and may be worked into the adventure if the Gamemaster finds the sides to be drastically unbalanced in favor of the villains.

The scenario is designed to take place on both the East and West Coasts of the United States, specifically New York City and San Francisco, It may be more favorable to the campaign, however, to have the first location fairly close geographically to wherever the player-characters have their headquarters. The second locale, on the other hand, should be left a good distance away.

Although this is a complete adventure, the Gamemaster is encouraged to add his/her own ideas and to expand on any details he/she wishes in order to make this a more exciting adventure for the players. Any changes made to this scenario should be made prior to the start of the action, rather than during play. No matter how complete a scenario has been made, circumstances are bound to arise that no amount of preplanning could anticipate. In these instances, the Gamemaster will have to make spur-of-the-moment decisions which should be based upon his/her overall knowledge of this adventure.

86787.name: Krusty's Fun House
86787.description:
Krusty's Fun House is a video game based on the cartoon series The Simpsons. Originally named Rat-Trap, it was developed by Fox William for the British software house Audiogenic, who licensed it to Acclaim Entertainment, the US-based publishers of a range of games based on The Simpsons.

The game was released in 1992-1993 for the Amiga, NES, IBM PC, Sega Master System, Game Boy, Super NES, and Mega Drive/Genesis. Acclaim published the console versions, and sub-licensed the home computer versions to Virgin. The 16-bit versions on the Super NES and the Mega Drive/Genesis were entitled Krusty's Super Fun House.

Gameplay

The player directs small rats to an extermination area through complicated maze-like levels. The player controls Krusty the Clown who must navigate through his Krusty Brand Fun House. Each level is a puzzle in which a number of rats must be exterminated. Using different objects and obstacles, Krusty must create a path for the rats to follow, and guide them towards an extermination device. Other creatures such as snakes and flying pigs attempt to hinder Krusty's progress by injuring him; he must throw pies in order to defeat them.

Source: Wikipedia, "Krusty's Funhouse", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86789.name: Roadstriker
rpgitemversion: Roadstricker: The Transformable Vehicle Supplement for Mekton and Advance Transformables
86789.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Take the action into the streets with this new supplement for MEKTON, the Japanese Robot Combat system. With Roadstriker, converting Mecha Cars, Armorbikes, personal armors, advanced police and high tech combat vehicles are at your command! Roadstriker comes with Basic Combat Map and counters and the exciting Mecha Police adventer, ARCADIAN DEATHROAD.

Advanced Transformables - a new expansion for designing multiform MEKTONS! Now Astrofighters, Hydrofoils, Tanks, Walkers Beastmecha and other exciting types can all be added to your MEKTON campaign!

86790.name: Winter Voices: Avalanche
86790.description:
A small village buried in snow, lost in the northern regions of the Kingdom of the Three-River Principality. A sudden death, a hostile home, new sensory capacities rising like a storm, and the departure towards the unknown. Escape is the only way out, besides death itself... The orphan heroine is forced to leave her father's village by the voices of her unconscious. Through a long journey in search for answers in her past and present, she will have to overcome anger, sadness, pain and fear, and discover eventually what the Voices of Winter have to say to her.
It's your turn to live the experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

86791.name: Escape from the Underworld
86791.description:
Play as a fallen angel in this exploration platformer.

Banov made this for Indie Kombat ( http://www.indiekombat.com ), in which he competed against a developer named Andrew Brophy during the month of October 2010. They had to make a game using elements of their opponent's games, and at the end of the month both games were released and users vote on the best one. There was also some trash talking involved.

Source: The Game Website.

86792.name: Peanut Butter Party
86792.description:
From the instructions: Peanut Butter Party is a fun, fast-paced game based on answering riddles. Follow the friendly animals from the Peanut Butter Pond series along a path filled with special places. Answer exciting riddles as your travel toward the pond.

User summary: Answer riddles correctly to draw "Peanut Butter Party" cards, which allow movement along the board, either one or two spaces, or to one of six designated "Special Places". Reach the end goal (pond) and answer a final riddle to win the game.

86793.name: American Basketball
86793.description:
Statistical replay game on basketball, featuring many different expansion sets. Basic game is very simple: each team is rated for points made, points allowed, rebounds and assists, plus it has a special value based on historical performance in the tournament (used to give a possible random variation to a few of his ratings). Opposing teams compare their value and a die is rolled for each team to determine the score. It is a fast replaying simulation, with a good bit of accuracy in the final result.

For the moment the following sets are available (directly from the designer, Roberto Chiavini or from Wargamer Vault): WNBA (all seasons) NBDL (all seasons), original ABA (all seasons), all the NBA from 1951 in single decades

86794.name: Olympic handball
86794.description:
Peculiar statistical replay game on a minor sport game, handball, dedicated to all the editions of this sport in the olympic games.
Basic system is really simple, as each team is rated for goal made and allowed, plus a killer instinct capacity (the ability to win point to point games) and a random modifier based on historical performance in the competition. Opposing teams compares values, then a die is rolled for each team to determine the final score (after a few possible modifications).
Very simple and very fast to replay an entire tournament in a very short time

86795.name: Mutation
86795.description:
This is a strategic dice placement game for 3 - 5 players. Each player takes the roll of a strain of bacteria in a petri dish, and begins to mutate and grow their strain in an effort to be the biggest.

Every turn you roll two D6 spotted dice, and then place one of these on the board according to a set of simple rules. Do you extend your strain or do you focus on breaking apart an opponents? Do you risk expansion into a contested portion of the playing area or do you focus on strengthening, but not lengthening, your strain? Every turn has interesting and strategic decisions to be made all from a simple roll of two dice.

86796.name: Rogue Trader$
86796.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Les personnages sont jeunes traders dans la salle des marchés d'une grande banque, au front office (autrement dit : ils jouent en bourse). Maintenant, ils sont les rois du monde avec leurs téléphones et leurs jolis ordinateurs plein d'écrans !


User Translation from French:

The characters are young traders in the trading room of a large bank, in the front office (in other words: they play on the stock market). Now, they are the kings of the world with their telephones and their pretty wide screen computers!

86797.name: Apocalypse sur Seine
86797.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Février 2008...

Les habitants de Neuilly-sur-Seine se rebellent contre le candidat désigné par Nicolas Sarkozy : David Martinon. Ses colistiers le laissent tomber, notamment le fils du président : Jean Sarkozy.

Mars 2008...

Pendant la période électorale, des émeutes d'une violence extrême déchirent la cité, et les élections ne donnent aucun résultat concret. Devant la gravité de la situation, le gouvernement décide d'ériger un mur d'acier autour de la ville, où s'affrontent désormais des hordes de rebelles en blazer, et des milices de retraités sur-armés...

Mars 2009...

Le président Nicolas Sarkozy décide que Neuilly mérite enfin un maire. Pour choisir celuici, plutôt que de faire une élection risquant de dégénérer en guerre civile, notre sémillant président a décidé que le maire serait le dernier candidat qui survivrait à un série ultra-violente de défis armés, où tous les coups sont permis !

Il ne peut en rester qu'un ... avec ses sbires sanguinaires (mais dignes et bien habillés).


User Translation from French:

February 2008...

The inhabitants of Neuilly-sur-Seine rebel against Nicolas Sarkozy's chosen candidate: David Martinon. His running mates leave him to fall, notably including the president's son: Jean Sarkozy.

March 2008...

During the election period, extremely violent riots disrupt the city, and the elections do not give any concrete result. Given the gravity of the situation, the government decides to erect a steel wall around the city, where hordes of rebels in blazers, and a militia of over-armed pensioners now congregate...

March 2009...

President Nicolas Sarkozy finally decides that Neuilly deserves a mayor. To choose him, rather than running an election that could risk degeneration into civil war, our frisky president has decided that the mayor will be the last candidate who will survive an ultra-violent series of armed challenges, where anything goes!

There can be only one... along with his bloodthirsty (but dignified and well dressed) minions.

86798.description:
You are Giraffe the hero of this game and you arrived in a small inn. Suddenly during the night something was attacking the inn. It’s a horde of ZOMBIES!!!. Nobody survive except you and the inn keeper’s daughter, Mari-chan. Survive the game in 3 nights without anyone dying.

This game is inspired by the genre tower of defense, where a horde of zombie, comes and attack the inn wave by wave. Your job is to control Giraffe, Mari-chan and occasionally Dogmeat by moving them through the inn, defending against the zombies, set barricade, buy stuff to upgrade and protecting Mari-chan while surviving yourself.

You need at least 1 six sided-die (the more the faster the game goes), 4 counters(different kind or colour) in which 1 of them represent zombie (which you need at least 7), a pencil and an eraser to jot down equipment, hp, bp and so on.

download the game here http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2010/11/horde-of-...
86798.name: Horde of the Dead Minigame

86799.name: Go Diego Go!: Safari Rescue
86799.description:
User Summary

This is the first of the Go Diego Go children's games designed to take advantage of the Wii Remote's motion sensors. It is a side-scrolling action game that let's players guide Diego through various safari adventures using real motions such as digging, swimming and jumping.

The Safari Rescue game also has a Safari Guide Helper Feature that lets an adult use a second controller to assist the main player, and two players can participate in a racing game using a variety of vehicles and animals.

86800.name: Go Diego Go!: Great Dinosaur Rescue
86800.description:
User Summary

This is the second of the Go Diego Go children's games designed to take advantage of the Wii Remote's motion sensors. The story is similar to the cartoon episode in which Diego and friends journey back in time to help a maiasaurus named Maia journey to Egg Island.

It is a side-scrolling action game that let's players using real motions such as digging, climbing and clapping while completing the adventure. The Dinosaur Rescue game also has a Dinosaur Guide Helper Feature that lets an adult use a second controller to assist the main player.

86801.name: Aztec
86801.description:
User Summary

Aztec is a platform-scrolling adventure game designed and programmed by Paul Stephenson and published by Datamost in 1982. In the mode of the first Indiana Jones movie, Aztec involves an intrepid, fedora-wearing explorer daring to plumb the depths of the Tomb of Quetzacoatl with the object of finding an invaluable jade idol that is supposedly hidden there. It was given a respectable 5.79 out of 9 in the reader ratings published in the May-June 1983 issue of Computer Gaming World; in a review published in the same issue, Tom Jones wrote: "The graphics are among the best that are now available on the market."

The large tomb that is to be explored is randomly created with each new game and consist of rooms divided into three on-screen vertical levels that connect horizontally with each other and are sometimes connected vertically by stairs. One room usually has a staircase that descends to the level below, although it is also possible to blast through the floor using dynamite. Armed with a pistol, machete, and the aforementioned dynamite, the player has to make his way past everything from Aztecs, snakes, and jaguars to strange tentacled monsters living deep in the bowels of the tomb.

But the most dangerous aspect of the Aztec god's tomb is the numerous traps, which can involve doors that lock behind you, ceilings that descend upon you, trapdoors that open beneath you, and water that fills up the room. Once trapped, there is no cleverness that can save you, only dynamite will serve.

Fortunately, the tombs are liberally populated with chests and piles of trash, some of which inexplicably contain bullets, dynamite, and other useful items. The movement controls have an unusual quirk in that jumping is faster than either walking or running, so players often preferred to move by repeated leaping from point to point rather than walking or running.

The graphics are quite detailed for its time and the random nature of the tombs allowed for a greater depth of gameplay than was common in 1982, although they also occasionally led to tombs that were impassible dead ends from the very first room. There are eight difficulty levels which relate primarily to the number and aggressiveness of the tomb's denizens.

From the game

A few weeks ago a rumor surfaced that Professor G. Von Forster, noted tomb robber and archeologist, had discovered the entrance to the Tomb of Quetzalcoatal.

Inside this tomb there is a jade idol worth a fortune to any one who can find it and return alive.

You are now standing at the entrance to the tomb.

Before you enter remember that the tomb is guarded by terrible monsters and men without mercy. Also, don't forget about Von Forster's nasty streak... He may have left some deadly surprises behind...

One more thing... the value of the idol is high right now but dropping steadily. The faster you return under the greatest difficulty the larger your reward will be. If you are good enough you could well become a millionaire...

Press any key...

86802.name: Reforger '88
86802.description:
User Summary:

A division-level wargame simulating an attack by the Warsaw Pact against NATO in Central Germany.

By Gary Grigsby

86803.name: Mech Brigade
86803.description:
User Summary:

Using a modified system of their Kampfgruppe game, Mech Brigade is SSI's platoon-level game of modern combat between Warsaw Pact and NATO units in Europe.
Major equipment types are modeled for four countries, the US, Britain, West Germany and the USSR.
Four scenarios as well as a random battle generator are included.

By Gary Grigsby

86804.name: Four Color to Fantasy
86804.description:
From the Book's Introduction:

The Four Color to Fantasy rules fit perfectly with the core d20 System rules, allowing you to play a medieval-style superhero game. You can also use the core rules to simulate different genres (modern day, futuristic, pulp) simply by changing a few details. Often all you need to do is remove or restrict spellcasting classes and incorporate appropriate weapon and armor rules. Core Rulebook II contains rules for varying your campaign style to fit different time periods, including stats for handguns, grenades, futuristic ray-guns and so on. In some ways, this can actually be beneficial, because many superheroes use weapons common to fantasy settings, and many of the staple monsters of a fantasy bestiary would make perfect foes for super-powered heroes. We even include a new class in this book, the Specialist, which represents more mundane characters, who rely on knowledge, education, or training, like real-world people. With just the Fighter, Hero, Rogue, and Specialist, you can easily create heroic characters for the modern day, without needing anything beyond the core rules and this book.

However, you may choose to use another rule-set for your game. The most common superhero tales are set in the modern age or in the near future. For these games, we recommend that you use one of the modern d20 system games or settings that are available. You’ll find d20 games and settings out there based on modern-day spycraft, on 1930s pulp, or on futuristic fantasy. Regardless of what ruleset you prefer to use, as long as it uses the d20 system rules as its basis, you should be easily able to add the rules from Four Color to Fantasy.

86805.name: Battle Group (1986)
86805.description:
User Summary:

Sister game to Kampfgruppe, Battle Group is a platoon-level simulation of the West European theater of WW2. German, British and US equipment types are modeled. The game includes several scenarios, as well as an editor to design your own.

By Gary Grigsby

86807.name: Ramar of the Jungle, The New Jungle Game
86807.description:
This game is a spin and move game where the object is to capture valuable animals in the jungle. The game board is filled with face down animals and by spinning a spinner and then moving your playing piece onto one of those animals you capture it. The game continues until all of the animals have been captured. Turning over each animal reveals a value attached to that particular animal. The player who captures the most valuable animals wins the game. When a player lands on an animal, his playing piece remains on that spot until his/her next turn and other players cannot land on or move over that spot, They must use their roll number to move around the opponents piece. The designers name appears to be Dexter Wayne but research is still being done on that fact.

Game for ages 7-10

86808.description:
Brand new introductory set for Legend of the Five Rings. Features the Dragon Clan and Lion Clan in two pre-built decks ready to play right out of the box. A lavish rulebook quickly teaches new players everything they need to know to start defending the Empire of Rokugan.

The set also comes with many choice rares for the current environment, giving players a quick foot up in the game! Combine with the free Imperial Gift set (150 cards free!) and you'll be serving with honor in no time!

(publisher blurb0
86808.name: Battle of Kyuden Tonbo

86809.name: Teekessel im Quadrat
86809.description:
From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

86810.name: Shattered Horizon
86810.description:
From the official website:

Experience intense zero gravity combat and complete freedom of movement in this multiplayer first-person shooter set in near-Earth space 40 years from now.

Use your rocket pack to fly freely through space and then land on any surface. Engage your enemies in furious firefights, or ambush them from unexpected angles.

Join your friends in action-packed 32 player battles fighting to control hollowed-out asteroids, huge fragments of Moon rock and the ruined remains of the International Space Station.

Familiar and intuitive FPS controls let you take full advantage of the zero gravity environments while astonishing graphics and advanced lighting effects immerse you in the cold reality of combat in space.

86811.name: Damnation
86811.description:
User summary:

Damnation is set at the beginning of the 20th century on an alternate Earth where the American civil war is still going on. You play Hamilton Rourke, captain of a rebel group called Peacemakers. Your goal is to foil the plans of evil Prescott Industries and its determination to turn America into a totalitarian dictatorship.

Work with or against a number of different characters, such as the Indian healer Yakecan, the cowboy Ramon Sepherius Zagato, and Commander Selina. You get to carry up to three weapons and have to fight through hordes and hordes of enemies as well as do a variety of acrobatics and other stunts in order to accomplish your objectives.

Experience rich, innovative vertical environments, as emphasis on vertical movement adds a whole new dimension to the concept of holding the high ground in a firefight.

Play epic single player missions or multiplayer modes for up to eight players.

86812.name: Karnak
86812.description:
User summary:

Theme - A fortune telling game based on cards and pendulum. Played solo or between two players with roles of questioner (later on just Q) and interpreter (N). The interpreter leads the game and the questioner is the one receiving information about his/her home, work, personality, love, future and past.

Game-play - The game-play is divided into two phases 1) the card turning and 2) the pendulum swinging.

1) The card turning phase starts by picking up the proper coloured scarabs to the game board; the hair, eyes and favourite colour of the Q. The Q shuffles the purple 54 card deck and hands it over to N. N divides the deck into 3 separate decks of 18, 9 and 27 cards. The cards are dealt on the game board in the order 18, 27 and 9. The 18 cards are dealt on locations shown at the front page of the rule leaflet. The cards have 6 words in them and one of those is picked depending which is forming a pyramid with the game board (the black half of the pyramid on the left side of the card and the white half of the pyramid on the game board). While the cards are dealt, the N questions the Q if the word on the cards have any special meaning. The forming words are related to either home (1st vertical row), work (2nd), personality (3rd), love (4th), future (5th) or past (6th), depending which vertical row the cards are placed to. The 27 cards are then dealt on the game board (some restrictions apply, see the rule leaflet). Then the deck of 9 cards is used as a key to whole interpretation. At last the rest cards of the deck of 27 are used to check if something is being dominant on some areas of the Q's life. The final interpretations varies each playing time.

2) The pendulum swinging phase starts by placing the four decks of 28 cards onto the game board. The decks are placed on lower part of the game board, around the pyramid (letter A shown on the first page of the rule leaflet). The decks represents the areas of home, work, personality and love. The players decide one of the four categories and Q decides a question he/she wants to get answered related to that category. The transparent pyramid is placed on the game board and the pendulum is used for random number selection. There is numbers of 1-28 around the pyramid on the game board and the random pendulum swing decides the number of the chosen card. The N reads the text on the proper card to the Q. Same is repeated to other categories and questions.

Goal of the game - Interpreting the message gotten with cards and pendulum and gaining more self-consciousness.

The game includes:

1 game board
1 transparent pyramid
1 pendulum
4 decks of cards (28 cards each)
1 purple deck of cards (54 cards)
2 bags including different coloured scarab buttons
1 rule leaflet (4 pages)

From Finnish intro on the rule leaflet:

"Karnak on kiehtovan jännittävä ennustuspeli, jota voi pelata yksin tai yhdessä. Se perustuu eräisiin muinaisegyptiläisiin mysteereihin ja kulttuuriperinteisiin. Koska peli on tunnettujen astrologian ja horoskooppien asiantuntijoiden suunnittelema, pelaajat voivat sen avulla myös kehittää omaa kuudetta aistiaan ja salattuja kykyjään. Luonnollisesti sitä voidaan pelata myös pelkkänä pelinä, mutta moni varmasti mielellään käyttää sitä oman itseymmärryksensä kehittämiseen ja hankkii sen avulla tietoja sisimmästä minuudestaan. Näitä tietoja voi sitten soveltaa toisten, kenties vähemmän onnekkaiden ihmisten auttamiseen."

86813.name: London 1593
86813.description:
From the publisher:

This playset is for those who love Shakespeare, a master of fiascos if ever there was one:

Elizabeth, Queen of England, has enemies everywhere.

If you can read and write, if you can tell lies with quill or voice, you might have a place as a peddler of bombast, as a player of parts, as a nefarious practitioner of the business of show… or as a spy. For all the world is a stage and the great lords of England and abroad are writing the parts that lackeys, liars, agents, and actors shall play.

Show business and skulduggery are tangled together—here like lovers, there like brawlers—and all those within reach of politics and art must balance their secrets against their ambitions. Love and lust and loyalty are all called into question as poets seek the literature of the age and spymasters seek the enemies of the crown.

Yet for all that the strife of the age claims to be about crowns and kingdoms, so much comes down to the common quagmires of coins and cons, jealousy and greed, love and spite. Petty gripes and dirty designs conspire to determine the fate of England. Some folk may hang or burn and some may slip away smelling of roses.

But, for sure, a reckoning draws nigh.

86814.name: Mech Collection
86814.description:
Back of the box
Two great Mech games & an exclusive expansion pack for one great price!

This is earth shattering, 31st century 'Mech warfare. A compilation that blasts out action, speed, killer strategy and battles tactics across a wide range of missions. Mechwarrior 3 features the awesome firepower of 18 BattleMechs in a dynamic 3D world and, with the Pirate's Moon Expansion Pack, lets you do battle against the ruthless MechWarrior pirates on the planet Veil. Finally, MechCommander Gold gives you complete command in a superb tactical warfare game across an isometric 3D world.

User Summary
Electronic Manuals are included on disc.

86815.name: Relief Action
86815.description:
User Summary
