Relief Action is a horror science-fiction game by Loriciels. It was one of the few Amstrad games that used realtime wireframe 3D for graphics, and included a stereographic 3D display mode for use with the 3D glasses which were packaged with the game.

A xenobiology experiment goes wrong on the starship NMI, and a genetically-engineered creature breaks out of the lab and massacres the crew. Only one crew member escapes the slaughter by hiding in an hibernation chamber. Now, alone on a derelict spaceship and hunted by a deadly predator, you must find your way to the shuttle and flee the ship.

The game is a classic adventure game. The player must explore the ship, find ways to dodge the monster or temporarily incapacitate it, pick up various useful items and repair some ship subsystems before reaching the shuttle.

Other than the 3D graphics, another "feature" of the game is the total lack of sound.

86816.description:
Königsberg ´45( # 104-1 ), is a boardgame covering the Soviet attack on East Prussia in 1945.

The game handles the 20 first days of the attack starting on the 13th of January 1945. The 3rd Belorussian Front under command of Cherniakhovsky launches an attack into the northeast of East Prussia while the 2nd Belorussian Front, commanded by Rokossovsky, one day later starts an attack from the south east. However, Army Group Mitte, under the command of Reinhardt, puts up an astonishing defence desperatly pushing the Soviets back.
The time is however on the Soviet side and when the defence finally crumbles there is nothing left to withstand the Soviet troops to ravage the country.

Königsberg ´45 is taught in 30 minutes and easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players. It is built around the same system of rules that have shaped both Plan West and the upcoming Tanneberg 1914.
The game uses a chit pull system telling you which armies to move. Each turn is two days and the game has 10 turns.

Components:

50 x 70cm-size map
280 die-cut counters
1 six-sided die
Rules
Box
86816.name: Königsberg '45

86817.name: Village Run
86817.description:
Banana village is having their annual village run. This year you entered to win the Banana Cup, but you are not the only one who hungers for the cup.

Village Run is for 2 or more player game where players roll for speed and hoping to take the first place. During the game players will get power up box to take advantage over their opponents. The game use a unique speed system, in where players will have a decision whether to stay on the same speed or try to roll their luck to speed up or getting slow. Village Run also features combat in which players will try to land on a box tile to get an advantage over the other players. The game can be played around 15 minutes and whole lots of exciting laps of Village Run.

86818.name: Qin
86818.description:
User Summary

Qin is a graphical text adventure game developed by the team behind SRAM I and II (Jacques Hemonic, Serge and Ludovic Hauduc), also published by ERE informatique.

The game takes place in 780 AD in medieval China. The main character is a descendant of the famous architect Liou (the man who designed emperor Tcheng's tomb hundreds of years ago) searching for the mystical secret of Qin, buried

The player's character, a descendant of the famous architect Liou (the man who designed emperor Tcheng's tomb hundreds of years ago), after several prophetic dreams, decides to search for the secret of Qin, allegedly buried inside the tomb his forefather built.

Like the SRAM series, Qin uses a text parser for player input, and a mix of graphics and descriptive text. The game world is huge (it uses four floppy sides) and steeped in medieval Chinese culture and mythology: a part of the game involves praying to Wenchen (god of Time) in order to travel in time and meet the character's ancestors. The game graphics are heavily inspired by ancient Chinese paintings.

86819.name: Put-In-Bay-Opoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
86819.description:
The classic Monopoly game. This theme: A game celebrating Island life!

Players roll and move along the board to collect the properties of the Lake Erie area, in the United States. When they have a complete collection of one color, players can build houses and even hotels. If another player lands on a property, the player who's owning it, can ask rent.

The object of the game is to let the other players go bankrupt.

86820.name: MadStone
86820.description:
MadStone is a fast-paced competitive puzzle game. Players must clear the path for their elemental MadStones to reach the bottom of the screen. Blocks can be broken by striking them directly or by the force of falling objects. Novices will try frantically to break enough blocks while master players create cascading collapses with only a handful of direct strikes. If you create a large enough combo, you can shake the Wii Remote to cause a sensational avalanche of destruction!

Source: The Developer Website.

86821.name: Primate Panic
86821.description:
When their plane crashes on an uncharted island, two travelers discover an uncanny civilization inhabited by monkeys and apes. After a peaceful day of gathering fruit with friendly monkeys, they learn of a tyrannical baboon who wants to conquer the island and make it his empire. With their newfound monkey friends, the two travelers set out on a quest to bring peace to the island.


40 hand-crafted levels.
5 beautiful environments.
Unique puzzle-action gameplay!


Source: The Publisher Website.

86822.name: Plan 1919
86822.description:
Plan 1919 is a variant for 1918: Storm in the West, which was published in Command Magazine Issue #16. Here we assume no decision was reached during the campaigns of 1918, leaving the Allies with the task of driving the Germans from France and Belgium during the sprimg and summer of 1919.

This variant uses the 1918 map and most of the parent game's original counters, along with the new ones (32) provided in this issue. Except as added to or amended in the rules, the standard rules of 1918 apply here unchanged, along with optional rules 16.4, 16.7 and 16.8.

(From the introduction)

86823.description:
Published in Vae Victis nº 77, this expansion adds new cards, rules and counters for the original game Les deux Bretagnes (Vae Victis No. 76) which covers the dynastic struggle in Brittany during XIII and XIVth centuries.

The new cards are added without surpassing the total activation value of the player. They can also replace other cards with same activation value.

The new markers are reminders of some important game events or played cards (Ex. "Bombardes" or "du Guesclin va en Normandie"). They can also be associated with the new cards (the two green markers).

The 3 new characters counters are for "Jeanne de Flandre" and "Jeanne de Penthièvre". The "Jean de Monfort" counter is a variant.
86823.name: Les Deux Bretagnes: Expansion et nouvelles cartes

86824.name: Cool Spell Volume II - Animals
86824.description:
As your kids play Cool Spell Volume II - Animals, they will learn how to recognize and spell animals from all over the world. From the mountains to the plains to up in the trees, and even under the sea. Now with even more stunning hand-drawn illustrations.

Source: The Publisher Website.

86825.name: Cool Spell Volume III - Sports & Hobbies
86825.description:
Help your kids learn to spell all their favorite sport and hobbies, as well as some they may never have thought of! Soccer, archery, golf and more!

Source: The Publisher Website.

86826.name: Cool Spell Volume IV - My Home
86826.description:
Cool Spell: My Home puts tons of items from around the house up for your kids to spell. From crayons to shoes, this one is sure to have your kids running around the house spelling anything and everything.
Buy Game

Source: The Publisher Website.

86827.name: Cool Spell Volume V - Things That Go
86827.description:
Your kids will learn to speak and spell planes, trains, and automobiles in Cool Spell Volume 5: Things That Go! Diggers, trucks and cars will keep your kids entertained and educated for hours on end.

Source: The Publisher Website.

86828.name: Cool Spell Volume VI - Music & Arts
86828.description:
Cool Spell: Music & Arts concludes the Cool Spell series with style. Instruments, dancers, paint, and puppets will dazzle your kids and have them laughing with glee as they learn to spell.

Source: The Publisher Website.

86829.name: Tibor
86829.description:
From the back of the box (translated from croatian):

"Tibor becomes a vampire. To return among normal people, Tibor has a long way from his village to the castle of Countess Zarina Sibilskog in which Kosinius, a scientist created a magic potion for the vampire. Will Kosinius' magic potion help Tibor to become again an ordinary person?"

Content:
1 board
40 playing tiles
10 scoring tiles

In this simple game the players place tiles on a grid, trying to connect their village with their castle (if they place a tile with a garlic on it, they gain a score tile with 1-3 points). The player who first reaches the castle gains ten points.

86830.name: Who Wants to be a Football Millionaire?
videogamefranchise: Who Wants to be a Millionaire?
86830.description:
From Cup Final to Final Answer... 2waytraffic brings 'Who Wants To Be A Football Milionaire?' for the iPhone and iPod Touch.

Test your knowledge of the 'The Beautiful Game' with 15 levels of football trivia questions from around the globe and become a virtual fooball millionaire?

Featuring all-new 'Who Wants To Be A Football Millionaire?' design,but with the classic lifelines, and Fastest Finger First round.

Features

1,000 brand new questions
Beat the clock: challenge your reflexes with slow and fast timed games
Do you want to Phone-A-Friend, use your 50:50 or Ask The Audience?
OpenFeint achievements and leaderboards
Play offline - no internet connection needed. Scores will be uploaded the next time you connect




Source: The Publisher Website.

86831.name: Spot the Differences
86831.description:
It offers a journey through odd and attractive scenes on various themes:
travel, gastronomy, playground, sports, pets, wildlife.

3 game modes are available:
- Arcade:
Images appear in a random sequence.
Spot 5 differences in each picture!
- Select pictures:
Play with pictures you choose!
- Time Attack:
Spot one difference in each picture.
Spot as many as you can while the timer runs!

The game is nicely executed with user-friendly interface and controls.

Source: The Game Website.

86832.name: MechWarrior 4: Vengeance & Black Knight
86832.description:
User Summary

Compilation of MechWarrior 4: Vengeance and its expansion Black Knight.

86833.name: Spiral Billard
86833.description:
A dexterity/skills table top game based on flicking or trowing small metallic balls.
There is a round board with 6 spiral channels;reaching the end of each route score points.

86834.name: MechWarrior 4: Mercenaries
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
86834.description:
MechWarrior 4: Mercenaries is a standalone expansion to MechWarrior 4.

Source: Wikipedia, "MechWarrior 4: Mercenaries", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86835.name: Jeremiah's Bounty Hunting Gear
86835.description:
From the document's introduction

Bounty hunting’s an ancient and honorable profession often taken up by old, dishonorable folk. There’s coin to be made, no doubt, and some of it legal, so if you’re up for the task you might think about getting some specialized gear. Some bounties specify dead-or-alive so two barrels is good enough. However, many want their quarry alive, and even some of the DOA bounties pay more if they’re still kickin’ when you bring ‘em in.

Here’s an assortment of non-lethal tools of the trade that can prove invaluable when you need to bag the mark without dropping him dead. Refer to the table at the end of this article for specific game statistics.

86836.name: MechWarrior 4: Inner Sphere Mech Pak
86836.description:
Back of the box

FOUR MORE MECHS.
More metal muscle for the best-selling, award-winning MechWarrior 4: Vengeance.

MORE BATTLEFIELDS
Mechs fight to death in the Colosseum - the Inner Sphere's most legendary arena.
MORE FIREPOWER
Leave a wake of destruction with a devastating new Heavy Gauss rifle.
MORE TECHNOLOGY
Use the new IFF Jammer to spread confusion among enemy ranks.

86837.name: MechWarrior 4: Clan Mech Pak
86837.description:
Back of the box

290 TONS OF NEW MECHS.
More metal mayhem for the award-winning MechWarrior 4: Vengeance : Masakari, Cauldron-Born, Arctic Wolf and Kodiak.

MORE BATTLEFIELDS
A deserted factory on the Solaris gaming world becomes the perfect combat zone for an all-out Mech massacre.
MORE WEAPONS
Turns enemies into scrap metal with the SMRM, a new homing version of the Medium Range Missile.
MORE TECHNOLOGY
Enhanced optics give Mechs a larger field of view when zooming in on distant action.

86838.name: Pilot for Hire
86838.description:
From the document's introduction

...Begin cortex news feed for June 12th, 2514

SENATOR WEATHERBY DEAD

Although details are still coming in at this time, we can confirm that Senator Alexander Weatherby is missing and presumed dead. Senator Weatherby was the senior Member of Parliament from Persephone and served in that position for over 15 years. The Senator is better known throughout the system as the ‘Voice of the Browncoats.’ It was Senator Weatherby who successfully led the campaign to grant clemency to all the independent soldiers who fought against the Alliance in the War of Unification. It is ironic that the Senator was fulfilling the promise he made, in his recent Unification Day speech, to visit the outer planets at the time of his death. Sources in the military tell us that Alliance Lieutenant Edward Blake, who was in command of the Senator’s transport, is being questioned in the affair. However, it is too early to know if the Lieutenant will face any kind of court martial.

User comment

Details the NPC Edward "Ned" Hancock
Blake, [Call Sign: "Mother"], and his background

This was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website

86840.name: Zip!
86840.description:
Zip! is a tactical boardgame for 2 to 4 players, in which each player is searching for a buried treasure and, once found, tries to get away with the loot.
Who finds a treasure, has a bigger chance to win, but has to be extra careful too, because each player can "zip" his/her stone around the board to hit an opponent's stone in a flash, removing the opponent from play and stealing his/her treasure on top of that.
All stones are being moved simultaneously (players can hit the stone of an opponent in another players' turn) and for expert players there's a variation in which all player's stones are invisible!

86841.name: Schäfchen ins Trockene
86841.description:
The lush green grass of irish meadows and a homey shelter provide a pleasurable life for black sheep as well as white ones. A feast for the old lazy wolf. That's why you should keep an eye on your herd with help of the shepherd and his dog.

A strategic two player game about tending sheep. Each player moves sheep around the meadows and either into the shelter for twosomeness or off the board to score. A core mechanic is to keep an eye on blancing the size and composition of the flocks. The wolf will kill one of the sheep in the largest flock and you should make sure its not one of yours! You win by scoring enough points or reduce the opponents sheep so they can no longer mate.

As all the "Mini-Lederspiele" of Hiku-Spiele this game comes with several semi-precious stones in a leather pouch that when opened is the board of the game.

86843.name: Sam's Smugglers Emporium
86843.description:
From the document's introduction

It’s taken a while to find the store, hidden
away from the main strip as it is. You’re
somewhat surprised to find it to be little more
than a battered metal door set into a grubby
wall, with little to identify it beyond a crudely
painted sign nailed above it. The sign has only
a single word, painted in bright red letters:
"Sam’s."

Despite your doubts, everything you were
told confirms this is the place, so you push open
the door and cautiously step into the gloom.
Somewhere, a bell rings, announcing your
arrival.

User comment

Details a few new pieces of equipment

Was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website

86844.name: Word on the Street
86844.description:
From the document's introduction

At first glance, the dimly lit nondescript tavern seemed so perfect for a clandestine meeting that it might as well been a cliché out of a bad tri-dee stage setting. Moving inside the tavern, the nervous young man put on a brave face and let his eyes adapt to the smoky darkness. He could see a handful of customers, all sitting in pairs, scattered among the poorly lit booths. One barely visible figure sat alone and had no trouble making a friendly gesture toward the newcomer.

"Welcome young’un, glad ya made it fit as a fiddle. Some folk say they are interested in, shall we say, alternative money makin’ opportunities, but when they find where they gots to go to get started in the ‘business’ as it were ... well let’s say I get stood up more than I don’t. Not that I take it personal, my line of expertise ain’t for the weak-kneed. Now I know what your first question already is, so excuse me if’n I just cut ya off a’for ya ask..."

User comment

An adventure hook.
first in the Word on the Street series

Was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website

86845.name: Word on the Street II: The Tongs
86845.description:
From the document's introduction

The young man walked into the tavern with an air of confidence he didn’t have the first time he visited. He walked directly to the booth in the back to meet his contact, only to find the booth empty. He managed not to panic and, instead, cast what he hoped was a surreptitious look around the dim room. He heard a soft rustling to his left and wheeled toward the sound, his hand shifting discreetly to the small of his back, before he recognized Frankie ‘Twice Pipe’ Whitaker grinning at him.

"Hey young’un, there’s no need for the ironmongery. So I’m sittin’ somewheres else. You need to know up front you don’t live long in the business if ya go gettin’ predictable..."

User comment

Details an NPC organization.
second in the Word on the Street series

Was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website

86846.name: Word on the Street III: Ship Heist
86846.description:
From the document's introduction

The man known as Frankie ‘Twice Pipe’ Whitaker waited in a run down section of the Persephone spaceport silent as a ghost. His hand rested on the butt of the cut-down shotgun that was the source of his nickname as he watched a young man approach. The new arrival looked around, oblivious to Frankie’s presence, trying to keep up a brave front despite not seeing his contact anywhere. He took up a reasonably defensible position near some solidly built crates and waited.

"Good spot young ‘un," Frankie said aloud. "I’d say you’ve got a future in the business, but that might make ya’ll’s head bigger than it needs ta be." The young man smiled; if he was surprised, Frankie was impressed by how well he hid his reaction.

User comment

An adventure hook.
third in the Word on the Street series

Was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website. The document, when downloaded, came with the odd gray shade and unaligned cuts seen in the representative image.

86847.name: Crash Garrett
86847.description:
User Summary

Crash Garrett is a graphical text adventure by Patrick Dublanchet set in 1938. Crash Garrett is a freelance pilot. He is hired is to fly Cynthia Sleeze, a famous Hollywood reporter to Dr Thorn's experimental psychiatric clinic for an interview, but things are not what they seem and Crash finds himself involved in a nazi conspiracy. The player must help Crash uncover the nazi plot, rescue Cynthia Sleeze and save his life.

The game uses a text parser for player input. The graphics and the story are heavily inspired by comic books, the pulp genre and the Indiana Jones movies. A nice touch is that the player is not the character, but rather the "little voice" Crash often hears in his head guiding him. Crash can actually find out about the origin of the voice in one of the subplots of the game.

86848.name: Word on the Street IV: Smuggler Essentials
86848.description:
From the document's introduction

"Ya know son," Frankie ‘Twice-Pipe’ Whitaker said to his young companion. "Based on yer last second decision not to go through with stealin’ that Pride-Class mid-bulk freighter last week, it occurs to me that smugglin’ might be more yer cup o’ mud than the shipjackin’ gig."

The two of them sheltered in the lee of a warehouse near the Eavesdown Docks on Persephone from the fierce rain that was lashing the area. The rain made conditions unpleasant, but provided a welcome level of cover from any prying eyes that might be about to notice the two men hidden in the shadows.

User comment

An adventure hook.
fourth in the Word on the Street series

Was available as a download, (free bonus content), from the publisher website

86849.name: Total Soccer
boardgameversion: FT Champs "La Supersfida" Juventus: Napoli edition
86849.description:
Total Soccer is the classic table footballs which recreate a Football game play with fingers.

It has evolved from the Subbuteo game, improving material quality and the playability, besides to have the licenses of the best football clubs around the world.

The way of playing is nearly identical to Subbuteo, player flick minature soccer players around the field to move, pass the ball, and attempt to score on the goal.

For two players, you can use only the fingers to win the match. Normally the duration is around 30 minutes (15 minutes for half).


Total Soccer es el clásico juego de fútbol de mesa que recrea un partido de fútbol con los dedos.

Es un producto que evoluciona del Subbuteo, mejorando la calidad de los materiales y su jugabilidad, además de ser licenciado por los mejores equipos del mundo.

El modo de jugar es idéntico a Subbuteo... pero con mejores componentes!!

Para dos jugadores, solo puedes usar los dedos para ganar el partido. Normalmente la duración son 30min aproximadamente (15 minutos por tiempo)

86851.name: Sinterklaasjournaal Bordspel
86851.description:
The Game consists of 3 games: The Steamboatgame (Het Stoombootspel), The Giftgame (Het Pakjesspel) and The Memoryvariant.

All games are based on a dutch special-day: Sinterklaas. This is the dutch version of SantaClaus and is celebrated on december 5th each year.

In The Steambootgame players use there playingfigure to collect presents from the hold of the ship on the gameboard. They do no know the value of the present they took.Via stairs and rooms of 3 different colors they attempt to bring them to the deck, to secure them. To do so, they throw a dice with the 3 different colors on it. A player must stop in a room of that color. When 2 players are in the same room, they have to switch presents. Two special actions which are in some rooms give players the chance to look at another players present, or his own, or to catch up with another player who is at max two stories higher in the ship. If all presents are on the deck, the player with the highest value of presents wins the game!

In The Giftgame players buy a few small presents upfront. They agree on the amount of money to be spent. You can also use the chips in the game and play for points.In this game also the colordice is used to decide to what field on the gameboard the player moves his playingfigure to. On each field is a different symbol, each giving a different action. The possible actions are: Take a present, switch presents and open them up, give present away to the player with the fewest presents, all presents in front of the players are passed to your neighbour in a clockwise fasion. and finally open up a present. When there are no more presents in the pile, the game ends. When playing with chips in stead of real presents, the game ends as soon as the last chip is taken from the supply. The player with the most points wins!~

The Memoryvariant is just another memory: There are 2 pairs of 12 different colored-and-valued chips. Turn them up-side-down so the sack is showing, shuffle them, and try to find the matching pairs as in regular memory. The player witrh the most chips wins.

86852.name: A Trick on the Tain (C&C)
86852.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Enter a harsh and unforgiving tundra known as the Tain where traveling these lands means certain death for most. The party of adventurers become caught up in the the plight of the native inhabitants and the cruel designs of an evil hag. The actions of these heroes could bring about the end of a people or save them depending on the choice they make.

This 20-page full-sized module is intended for a group of low-level characters (about 6-8 total levels) with a Challenge Level of 1-5. In this module, you will also find:

12 New Illustrations
3 Different Maps
4 New Creatures for Castles & Crusades
1 New Magical Item
1 Quick Reference for the adventure's encounters

86853.name: Unkindness
86853.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An evil man in a bird costume is on a crime spree throughout the city. Can your superheroes put an end to his rampage before he begins kidnapping children?

Unkindness is a superheroic adventure for ICONS and the HERO System. It includes a supervillain and his minions, an arc of scenarios and numerous plot options, and some useful reusable maps such as a jewelry store and a science museum.

Inside are useful maps:

a jewelry store
a restaurant
a suburban home
a museum

Also:

a new supervillain and his minions
dozens of plot seeds
optional encounters

86854.name: Pretty Hate Machines
86854.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes straight to the bone...

Mr. Hideous is the ugliest man in the world. He has come to the city to make everyone as ugly as he is. Getting beat with that Ugly Stick is gonna hurt. Only your heroes stand in his way.

Pretty Hate Machines is an adventure for four to six experienced HERO System characters of 450 - 550 points. It requires the HERO System 6th Edition rulebook to play.

Inside are detailed write-ups:

a supervillain and his gang
attack and getaway vehicles
dangerous battlefields
poisons, toxins, and dangerous chemicals
fires, explosions, and mayhem
an extensive list of breakable objects

Inside are useful maps:

a convention center
a warehouse
a condominium
a refinery
a hangar
a street section

Things are about to get ugly!

86856.name: Scaling The Great Dragon
86856.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Some dragons are large, others huge. You get a few gargantuan and colossal ones, and the miniatures for those are really impressive on your tabletop (and empty your bank account really fast!). We’ve gone one step further... a dragon so big that it is your tabletop.

This set of double-sided maps represents one section of scales on the greatest of great dragons, with the classic 1" square grid overlayed. And on the other side...

...The great undead dragon!

That’s right, now your characters can fight a mile long monster who’s also a zombie or dracolich. Gamescapes are printed to the highest quality on strong card stock and coated with an easy-wipe surface to give you years of dragon hunting pleasure.

Gamescapes are printed to the highest quality on strong laminated card and coated with an easy-wipe surface (Dry and wet erasable) to give you years of gaming pleasure.

comment
published by Cubicle 7 Entertainment in conjunction with Savage Mojo

86857.name: Ship Shape
86857.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Waves crash and epic tales gather like a hurricane - whether she’s a pirate, merchantman, or your characters’ own exploration ship, we offer you three decks of high adventure on the high seas. And on the other side...

...the sunken ship!

That’s right, you’re only one scenario and a flip of the mat away from seeing your ship sinking off a desert island. Or maybe this is the wreck you’ve been following that treasure map to, the one with a cargo hold full of gold. Watch out for the sea monster though!

Gamescapes are printed to the highest quality on strong laminated card and coated with an easy-wipe surface to give you years of pirate pleasure. This set is printed with the classic 1" square grid overlaid.

Gamescapes are printed to the highest quality on strong laminated card and coated with an easy-wipe surface (Dry and wet erasable) to give you years of gaming pleasure.

comment
published by Cubicle 7 Entertainment in conjunction with Savage Mojo

86858.description: Wend-maze is a path building game in the Wend family for two to four players. The players use Wend tiles to construct a maze which they are trying to escape from. They have a series of actions they can take to place tiles, move or rotate them, switch the lights on or off, or move along the maze. They roll dice to determine the action they will take. The object of the game is to be the first player to escape from the maze.
86858.name: Wend-maze

86859.name: Bcmll
86859.description:
A word game based on the popular Catalan TV show "Bocamoll", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya since 2007. Following the show structure, it is composed by six different tests on words: matching words with their definitions, guessing words from images and symbols, filling-in popular song lyrics with the correct words, deciphering SMS language texts, etc.

The game includes:
- board
- 500 cards
- 4 markers
- bag
- hourglass
- rules booklet

86860.name: Caçadors de bolets
86860.description:
A roll-and-move game based on the Catalan TV show "Caçadors de bolets", aired by TV3 Televisió de Catalunya. The players try to win in this particular race of mushroom hunting, correctly identifying mushroom types.

The game includes:
- board
- 6 markers
- 112 mushroom cards
- 300 cards
- rulebook

86861.name: Knights  of the Dinner Table Magazine (The Bag Wars Saga)
rpgissuearticle: The Bag Raiders: Best Played Plans
The Bag Raiders: Of Dice and Men
The Bag Raiders: The Dark Side of the Bag
The Bag Wars: The Share Giver
Gary Jackson's Understanding Hack-Magick (AKA the J-Doc)
86861.description:
publisher blurb

The Knights of the Dinner Table are embarking on their greatest adventure ever... THE BAG WARS SAGA!!

From the secret lair of Rot Gut the Swack Iron Dragon... To the Lost Temple of Ali Gee... Through the Veiled Caverns of Agin Kyree... And then finally into Bag Wurld itself!!

The Gloves are off. Not only are they fighting for their lives, but for their honour as well!!

It's an epic battle pitting Gamemaster against Player.

This book brings together all the strips in this fan favourite story arc and puts them between two covers. But make no mistake - this is no mere compilation of previously published material. The entire BAG WAR SAGA has been restoryboarded with new art, a fresh layout as well as being reimagined and expanded with over thirty pages of new material!!

86862.name: Rollespilsfotos 2008
86862.description:
From the Preface:

When all is said and done, Live Action Role Playing (short form: larp) is just playing - neither more nor less. And as with other forms of play, costumes and props are not a necessity. And yet it is more fun to play cops & robbers, when the robbers look like robbers and the pistols say "Bang!". And therein lies part of the explanation for the popularity of larp in Denmark. For we are a small country with nearly 5.5 million citizens, and of those more than 100,000 play larp. 15 years ago that number was below 1,000.

There are many reasons for this growth - not the least of them being the Lord of the Rings movies and the wave of Fantasy literature. But one of the most important reasons is, that the play has become more visual. Beautiful costumes and impressive settings can sometimes make you feel like you are part of a movie, and who doesn't dream of being the hero of one's own adventure? It was these reflections that laid the foundation for this, which is a collection of pictures from some of the larps we have done in 2008 - for children through the organization Junior Roleplaying Copenhagen and for the adults through The Roleplaying Factory organization. Because even though this is only the tip of the iceberg, when it comes to what Danish larp has to offer, it shows a little of the variety, diversity and enthusiasm that is hidden in the realm of imagination. So come with us through the universe of play.


User Summary:

A book of larp photos. Nearly all pages contain a single large colour photo. All the photos are from various larp events in 2008.

86863.name: B.A.T.
86863.description:
User Summary

B.A.T. is a French science-fiction adventure game with RPG elements. It's the beginning of the 22nd century and the Council of Galaxy faces a terrible threat: Vrangor, a scientist and escaped criminal has sent them an ultimatum: either the entire population of Terrapolis, capital city of Selenia is evacuated within 10 days and Selenia officially given to Vrangor, or the whole planet will be vaporized. Selenia being the only known source of khergol, the starship fuel, the Council sends an elite agent of the B.A.T. ("Bureau des Affaires Temporelles", Bureau of Temporal Affairs) to Terrapolis. His mission, find Vrangor and his accomplice Mérigo and stop them.

B.A.T. is primarily an adventure game in which the player explores the huge city of Terrapolis (more than 1000 different locations) looking for clues and questioning the population, but it also features some RPG elements (the character has stats and skills and there is a level-up system), and several games inside the game (a 3D flight simulator, fighting sequences...). The game uses a point-and-click system for player interaction, and a feature called B.O.B., a microcomputer carried by the character on his wrist that keeps track of the character stats, translate the languages spoken by the many different aliens and robots present in the game, and can even be programmed by the player (a BASIC-like scripting language with few features). Another feature of the game is its open-endedness, as players can use many different strategies to complete the steps required to find Mérigo and Vrangor.

The game received a lot of praises when it was released, earning a "Tilt d'or" as best computer game of the year by French videogame magazine Tilt.

86864.name: Magi & sværd
86864.description:
translated from the preface:

Roleplaying games are fantastic adventures where you and your friends are the heroes. With this book you get an introduction to what roleplaying games are and a lot of hints for getting to play yourself..

In the first half of the book you can see how roleplaying games works and get ideas for your own roleplaying game adventures. The second half of the book is a simple RPG system so uoy immediately can start to play with your friends.

The book i intented for all who either never played before or is looking for an RPG in danish. It only requires pencil and paper, a few dice and a healthy dose of imagination.

86866.name: Bust-a-Move Bash!
86866.description:
From the back of the case:

Launch colorful bubbles to make a match in more than 500 puzzles bursting with challenging fun! Play as 10 different characters across 4 game modes. Blast bubbles from all angles in the brand new shooting mode.

User summary:

The modes are:
Puzzle-Five areas of 50 levels with eight different colored bubbles. Match 3 or more bubbles to remove them, remove them all to clear the level before time runs out.

Shooting-Use the Wiimote to shoot bubbles with a matching sight.

Endless-Bubbles continuously come down from the top.

Versus-2 to 8 players compete at the same time. Certain bubbles have jewels. Destroy the most jewel bubbles to win.

86867.name: Germany 1985
videogameversion: North American Apple II (First Release) edition
North American Apple II (Second Release) edition
86867.description:
First game in SSI's When Superpowers Collide series, Germany 1985 supposes a Warsaw Pact attack upon NATO forces in West Germany. Two operational level battles are depicted, the first a meeting engagement, the second involving Soviet paradrops behind NATO lines. The computer can play either side (not both).

By Roger Keating

86868.name: RDF 1985
86868.description:
User summary:

Second in SSI's When Superpowers Collide series, RDF 1985 depicts an attack by America's Rapid Deployment Force (RDF) upon an oil-rich area of the Middle East which has been seized by the Soviets.
The rules accompanying this game are only a supplement to the earlier Germany 1985 game, first in the When Superpowers Collide series, which means in order to understand this game, players are required to own the earlier title.

By Roger Keating

86869.name: Baltic 1985
86869.description:
User Summary:

Third game in the When Superpowers Collide series, by Strategic Simulations Inc. (SSI), Baltic 1985 centers upon NATO's rescue of a besieged Berlin.

By Roger Keating

86870.name: Norway 1985
86870.description:
User Summary:

Fourth and last title in SSI's When Superpowers Collide series, Norway 1985 supposes a Soviet attack upon that country, with NATO in defense.

By Roger Keating

86871.name: Draconus
86871.description:
Draconus is a platform game developed by Cognito in 1988.

The hero wants to reclaim back his kingdom from the Tyrant beast. In doing so he runs or jumps through various screens, in which he encounters on bats, balls or giant rats. These may be eliminated permanently by a punch or fire breathing. The fire breathing is limited, but may be replenished once in a while by collectible symbols. As superior task, the hero must find four special abilities and then face the final battle. One of the abilities allows him to metamorphose through special platforms into a water being granting him access to further areas.

Source: Wikipedia, "Draconus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86872.name: A 16th Century Mediterranean Galley Wargame
86872.description: It is a 12-page booklet describing the rules for a naval battle, intended to use with Navwar's miniatures. Each ship has maximum movement, fighting value and armament. Players simultaneously decide about movement, then each ship can fire. There are also rules covering ramming, close combat and morale.

86873.name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – The Duke of Cadwallon
86873.description:
(User Summary)
A mini-expansion to the original game.
The Duke comes with one painted miniature as well as the Duke's card, two color bases, and rules for including the Duke in the game.

86874.name: IQ: A szerencse és logika játéka!
86874.description: The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

86876.name: Hilfe, der Zauberlehrling ertrinkt!
86876.description:
user summary

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about the poem of a Wizard's apprentice by Goethe. The characters are sent out to correct the poem which has magically changed. The heroes will encounter some wild animals and characters from the poem in this outdoor adventure.

86877.description:
From the back of the box:

TURANGA – an expansion for Shuuro.

Turanga transforms Shuuro into a four-player battle.
Together with your ally on the opposite side of the board, get ready to fight for supremacy. But watch out: only with perfect timing and harmony of intents, is your team going to achieve victory!

Requires a copy of Shuuro to play.
86877.name: Turanga

86878.name: Drôles d'animaux
86878.description:
The game contains 60 cards, these are divided in 3 times 20 each numbered from 1 to 20. The three categories are: body, face and legs.

The cards are then divided between all the players. Each player gets the same amount of faces, bodies and legs. Now the players have to make the most animals with the same number on all the three body parts.

The rest of the cards they can exchange with other players. There are different ways to do this in the rulebook. The player with the highest number of animals reconstituted won.

(User Summary)

86879.name: Le concert des animaux
86879.description:
The cards all show a couple of different animal types. There are six different animals - donkey, frog, rooster, cat, cow and pig - on the cards and there are one, two or three of them on each card. The cards are dealt, in his turn the player turns the top card of his stack and places in front of him.

If somebody sees a series - i.e. one, two and three animals of same type on one card - it makes the noise of this animal and gets all the played cards. Player who calls 4 times first is the winner. Whomever calls wrong must give one card to other players as a penalty. Who has no cards left is eliminated.

86881.name: Le jeu des fruits
86881.description:
In Le jeu des fruits you have to get rid of all of your cards. There are six sorts of fruit on the cards: pears, bananas, plums, strawberries, oranges or pineapples. Each fruit is now 0-5 times on the cards.

A player must always play a card that has more fruit on it then the previous card that has been played in one of the fruit categories. For example, if the visible card shows two pears, three plums and a banana, you can play any card that contains three or more pears, two or more bananas, four or more plums.

86882.description:
Medieval Mastery is a board game of tactical conquest based on the feudal system that existed in Europe throughout the Middle Ages. Set in France, during a time of turmoil, each player assumes the role of a provincial lord as the country erupts into a war of succession. Send your brave knights forth to conquer the surrounding lands in an all-out struggle to claim the throne!

Medieval Mastery incorporates area control, hand management and modular board design as well as variable player powers and phase order. The rules include alternate gameplay variations. This, coupled with a modular game board and a random combination of crowns, orbs and sceptres, means that no two games will ever be the same! In addition, the number of components included allows for up to three games of varying sizes to be played simultaneously!
86882.name: Medieval Mastery

86884.name: Tricky Double
86884.description:
Tricky Double works a bit on the principle of Raj but makes it an 'adult' version. Players simultaneous choose a card and reveal it and then have to select a second card and reveal this one too. You win with the combination of these two cards.

The lower cards in the deck hold coins, the person who gets the most of these coins wins the game. The lower the card, the more points it has. So if you want to score a lot of points you will also have to play out a low card from your hand but still want to get the highest result in the end.

(User summary)

86885.name: Marchand de sable
86885.description:
The game has two phases: first you have to put all the stars on the board and after this you can turn of the light and they will glow in the dark. Now that we are in the dark the second phase starts.

Each at a turn takes away one star from the board. The player who's star stays on the board as last wins the game. It sounds easy but since you are in the dark, a good memory will help.

The game contains:
- A large die
- Twelve twinkling starts
- A board
- A sandman

(User summary)

86887.name: Heilig of Geilig?
86887.description:
Heilig of Geilig? is a dutch partygame. It can be translated as Holy or Horny?

The players take trivia cards on which a 3 different hints are stated. These are vague and ambiguous and describe an object. The players have to guess the answer to get points. When they get it wrong they show their own 'horny' nature.

All players start at the same starting point on the board, this is in the middle of the board. On the one side are the holy/heilige points, on the other side the horny/geilige pionts. The oldest player begins. He takes a card and chooses one of the three hints from the card and reads it to his neighbour his leftside. When the player guesses the object with this one hint he may move up to 4 places. If a second hint is needed he moves up 3 places. After a third hint he can move up 2 places. But if passes after the 3 hint he has to move back 1 place. When he guessed wrong he has to move back 2 spaces. The game ends when a player gets at the top of the holy points.

The game contains:
- A board
- Pawns
- 300 playing cards

86889.description:
Crime & Mystery - that says it all. The players are cadets of Scotland Yard, who create stories about one of the prime suspects in a murder case using "evidence"-cards. Afterwards, all the cards are shuffled and 7 cards are drawn. On the back of the card, the players decode a question with a red foil. If you answer these questions correctly, it will lead you to the murderers.

In this game you have to listen closely, remember and combine the facts in the right way. After 2 cases (approximately 20 min.) the game ends and the points are summed up.

––––––––––––––––

In Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files, dem neuen, ungewöhnlichen Kriminal-Spiel für bis zu sechs Spieler muss man genau zuhören können, messerscharf kombinieren und braucht ein erstklassiges Gedächtnis, um an Hand der Indizien und Hinweise den oder die tatsächlichen Täter zu überführen.

Die Spieler übernehmen die Rollen von Detektiven, die eng mit Scotland Yard, der englischen Kriminalpolizei, zusammenarbeiten. Am Anfang des Spieles wird einer von vier Fällen herausgesucht. Die Spieler entscheiden sich im Anschluss daran, welchen der acht Verdächtigen sie observieren wollen, so dass sie einen präzisen Bericht über ihren Verdächtigen vortragen können. Dieser Bericht beruht auf den gezogenen Indizienkarten, die vor dem Beginn der Observation gezogen werden. Die Indizienkarten sind jeweils auf die verschiedenen Fälle zugeschnitten.

Nachdem alle Ermittler ihren Bericht innerhalb einer definierten Zeitspanne vorgetragen haben, müssen die Spieler verschiedene Fragen und Aussagen bezüglich der vorgetragenen Indizien mit den Verdächtigen in Einklang bringen.

Der Spieler, dem dies gelingt und einen Verdächtigen erfolgreich als Täter überführt, gewinnt die Partie. Ein Spiel besteht dabei aus zwei Partien, sprich zwei Fällen.
86889.name: Crime & Mystery: Bakerstreet Files

86891.name: NiGHTS:  Journey of Dreams
86891.description:
From the back of the case:

Navigate the magical world of dreams as you send NiGHTS gliding, weaving, diving, looping, spiraling, and blasting through incredible adventures both in Nightopia and the dark world of the Nightmare. With many extraordinary worlds to explore, NiGHTS: Journey of Dreams will take you on a voyage filled with courage, hope and inspiration.

86892.name: DK Bongos
86892.description:
DK Bongos are bongo-like controllers for the Nintendo GameCube video game series Donkey Konga, Donkey Konga 2, Donkey Konga 3, and Donkey Kong: Jungle Beat. There are two bongos, each shaped like a classic Donkey Kong barrel with a rubber drumskin fastened on top. It also has a built-in microphone to detect clapping. In Japan the controller is called the "TaruKonga" (or "TaruConga") controller. The name is a multilayered pun, combining "Taru" (the Japanese word for "barrel"), "Kon", or "Con" (a suffix used by Namco when naming their original peripherals, such as the "GunCon", or the "TaTaCon"), and Konga (or Conga).

The DK Bongos are featured in Super Smash Bros. Brawl as Donkey Kong's Final Smash attack, the "Konga Beat".

The game Donkey Kong Barrel Blast was originally designed as a GameCube title to be used with the DK Bongos. Eventually the game was moved to Wii, and bongo support was scrapped in favor of the Wii's built-in motion controls. The WiiWare title Plättchen Twist 'n' Paint was also going to support the peripheral. However, N-Europe revealed Nintendo wanted DK Bongo functionality removed to avoid alienating users who do not have them.

Source: Wikipedia, "DK Bongos," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86893.name: Brewtown Brou-ha ha
86893.description:
A bi-collaborative game where two teams of gamers group together to try to accomplish game objectives and stay alive for the duration of this game set in downtown Milwaukee, WI USA. The game will involve dice-based combat, but will have multiple paths to victory for both the monsters and the humans, both fighting for different things.

One group will consist of six monsters: a cow; a crayfish; an asian carp; a gorilla; a bluegill; and two deep-tunnel sewer rats. The other group will consist of humans, plus humans with functions like workmen, fire fighters, police, nat'l guard, and some super-humans like Lara Croft and ninjas might appear during gameplay.

The game is driven foremost by the HO scale minis used in the game, and the plastic monsters. The toy value is what this Über-Ameritrash game is about.There will be multiple rule sets developed. Really, this game started with the toys, and a desire to improve an old game or two, while thematically morphing it into a game which featured downtown Milwaukee, WI USA.

At this point it's a prototype. The game is a homage to The Creature That Ate Sheboygan, borrows from Heorscape and Monsters Menace America, requires some D&D features like THACO, and has lots of other options for tweaks and alt games.

The "ha ha" is deliberate in the name because of the twisted humor woven into the fabric of the game. The "bronze fonz" is on the map, and either side will get a bonus for either destroying it or simply rubbing it for good luck. Names for the creatures also have built-in humor:

Vince Gill: the bluegill who is also a Packer fan, but hates Milwaukeeans because of their fascination with the Friday Fish Fry. His desire is to crush restaurants which serve fish.

Son of Samson: the undead giant son of the most famous ex-resident of the Milwaukee Zoo, whose goal is to get to the top of the Firstar/U.S. Bank tower and fling poo.

Carpie Diem: an asian carp, who seized headlines recently as the no.1 environmental enemy to Lake Michigan. He can jump across city blocks and smash things under his weight. Very easily distracted by the Ladybug Club, thinking they are asian lady beetles.

Holey Cow: a sympathizer with O'Leary's Chicago firestarter, this copycow is a Cubs fan and happens to breathe methane gas fires from her four stomachs, and out her nostrils. She's also capable of making massive cowpies which block city streets.

'Hood Ratz: a pair of residents from our failed Deep Tunnel system, these rodents are skaven mad *wink* and capable of chewing through even the five foot thick walls of the Fed Bldg. They're also attracted to hip-hop music.

Rebecca the Boiling Crayfish: (no relation to our new Lt. Governor of WI) she's looking for her crawdaddy in one of the restaurants that serve her brethren. The humans are in hot water this time.

The game narrative is such that an event has taken place that, combined with the deep tunnel sewer failure, has caused six local creatures to grow in size and terrorize Brewtown.

The Federal Bldg. is within the now quarantined section of Brewtown, and the goals of the monsters are many, but they have to achieve them before they are killed or the feds are able to call in the antidote. Meanwhile, the humans are to stay alive and kill monsters,while protecting buildings from fires, repairing blocked roads, and achieving other goals along the way.

There are several groups of humans:

Firefighters: complete with a new ladder truck, these six individuals have axes and hoses in hand *wink* to face any challenge.

Police: one car (Milwaukee police are grossly underfunded) and a handful of officers help with attacks, rescue civilians, and keep the peace among the surviving humans.

National Guard: these weekend warriors with five tanks were setting up for maneuvers downtown, ending in at the Veterans Memorial nearby when this hit. They've not got much live ammo with them for this reason, but they have plenty of rubber bullets of all sizes-and they look scary as hell. The can fly in one helicopter from General Mitchell Airport in a couple of rounds, and it will have the firepower they need, but the rest of the military is on furlough.

Municipal Construction: several men on a job site with a huge dump truck, a CAT backhoe, and two CAT scoopshovels. They're tough enough to fight the monsters on their own with their equipment and they're experts at "catcalls".

Waste Management: one unmanned truck full of Milwaukee's finest refuse, abandoned.

Superhumans: activated at different times in the game when humans accomplish certain goals: a Lara Croft lookalike, with the guns to prove it; a ninja; two advanced swordplay students from the T'ai Chi Ch'uan center of Milwakee, and their leader Mike. Mike's wearing a Yoda costume he found at the Milwaukee Film office, and his mastery of push hands gives him the equivalent of the "force push". He hopes the creatures watched the trilogy, and fear him...

The two collaborative groups struggle until the game ends for a variety of reasons. There are several paths of victory for either team.

86894.name: Superbike GP
86894.description:
From the back of the game:

Feel the thrill and speed of a superbike competition.
You must spped up, be cheeky and look around.
You will race for many miles before you are crowned champion.
Race through corners and down the straight on your way to the finish line.

6 bikes to choose from
10 different circuits
2 play modes, Arcade & Championship.

86895.name: Komputer
86895.description:
A 2 player board game.

The purpose of the game is to find as many combinations as it’s possible which sum is exactly 10. Every combination has to consist of exactly three digits situated on three neighbouring areas connected with edges or with corners. Each area can only be used once in a combination.

Players take turns finding such combinations. Upon finding one the active player may place his pawn on the board on the first or the third digit of the desired combination (never second). On any one area can only be placed one pawn. Therefore such area can be part of combination, but cannot be chosen to place a pawn on it.

The winner is the player who has found more combinations (indicated by the number of pawns on the board). If both players used the same number of pawns the winner is the player who has situated his pawns on areas which digits sum up to a higher number.

86896.name: Ben 10: Alien Attack
86896.description:
From the box:
It has been 5 years since Ben used Omnitrix. He once again uses the all powerful Omnitrix when he finds out that his grandfather Max is missing. New alien army does not make his life any easier.
Help Ben in his new adventure.

Content:
-game board
-4 pawns
-rules
-12 tiles

Game Play

Place each of the 12 tiles next to the game board. Each player then chooses one of the colors and places their pawn on the to the corresponding space on the board.
Youngest player begins.
When ever you stop on Ben 10 symbol, you gain one tile.

In game:
with 2 players each can get up to 6
with 3 players up to 4
with 4 players up to 3

When ever someone have the necessary amount of tiles, then all tile spaces are deactivated. Pawns cannot fight each other, but when they are on the same space, then the one who was there earlier give one tile to the player that just got there. If he has no tiles to give, he misses his turn

Special spaces

Alien X - Ben 10 can move faster by 3
Ben, Kevin and Gwen - miss 1 turn
Green circle - Ben has a date with Julia. Miss 2 turns.
Max - miss 3 turns.
Jetray - Ben can move faster by 4

Winning

First player to get needed amount of tiles and reaches finish is the winner.

86897.name: Tic Tic Boom
86897.description:
You and your rivals are locked in a struggle of heroic proportions. Only assembling “KABOOM”, the ultimate weapon, can end the mayhem and crown you the top-dog of Superhero Land. Use your wits to activate special powers to defuse opponents and defend yourself from the onslaught of incoming attacks.

Tic Tic Boom is the explosive new family card game chock-full of strategy and sabotage. Set to a retro comic book motif, and manufactured on durable transparent plastic; the cards are as fun to pick up as they are to play.

Included are two entirely different games. Tic Tic Boom “Classic” offers something for all ages and skill levels. Players race to spell “KABOOM” on a communal board, while activating special powers along the way. It’s quick to learn and full of surprises. Tic Tic Boom “Advanced” is for gamers who thirst for a little more strategy, cunning, and sabotage. This game introduces Power Attacks, which are made by combining your cards to spell words such as BAM, BOOM, or K.O. These score points and provide even higher levels of high-jinx.

With more strategy than Uno and more excitement than Rummy, Tic Tic Boom is something the whole family will enjoy!

86898.name: Panzer Strike
videogamehonor: 1987 Charles S. Roberts Best Twentieth Century Computer Wargame Nominee
1987 Charles S. Roberts Best Twentieth Century Computer Wargame Winner
86898.description:
User Summary:

Panzer Strike is a tactical level wargame of WW2 combat between Germany, Britain and the USSR. The game does not model American forces.
Single scenarios may be fought between two players or against the computer, while campaigns may be fought only against the computer.
Essentially a construction set, Panzer Strike allows plays to easily create custom maps, units and scenarios.

By Gary Grigsby

86900.name: Le Maître des Âmes
86900.description:
User Summary

Le Maître des Âmes ("the Master of Souls") is a French computer RPG. The royal magician Kharram Akkad vanished from his tower just after announcing he was on the verge of a great discovery. Shortly after his disappearance, a great storm rose around the tower and drove the surrounding population away. Now, a team of adventurers prepares to enter the tower, solve the mystery of the wizard disappearance and find a way to stop the storm.

The game is an icon-driven, first-person view dungeon crawl. Players have the option of creating a team of adventurers or use the pregenerated one. The rules are heavily inspired by Dungeons & Dragons, using the same set of character stats and classes. One noticeable feature of the game is the ability to split the party in several groups (or even single characters) and switch control from one group to the other.

86901.name: Lords of the Peaks: The Essential Guide to Giants
86901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Titans of the Battlefield!

Lords of the Peaks is the first of Paradigm Concepts' Races of Legend sourcebooks. Designed as a Game Master's toolkit, Lords of the Peaks delves deeply into the culture and myth of severn distinct Giant types. Challenge your players with new twists to old opponents or pit them against new and terrible foes. Go far beyond the basic details of existing monster entries with: Lords of the Peaks!

So many feats and skills that it would take a Giant to shake a stick at them!

New prestige classes including the Terramancer, the Reaver of Wyrms, and the Giant-Slayer
New Spells and Clerical domains
New magical items to augment your Giant NPCs
Rules for creating your own new and unique Giants
New NPCs of each of the Giant subtypes
And a new "Epic" opponent for your very high level campaign, the Celestial Giants!

86902.description:
First title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go Down to the Sea".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained within the book in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find: the book, a set of playing cards consisting of a rucksack; codebook; torch; measure card; map — and to refresh you on your journey, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.
86902.name: The Wreckers' Tower Game

86903.name: The Book of Broken Dreams
86903.description:
From Introduction:

This book introduces several new options for the d20 system.
Chapter 1 covers various stress related disorders that might affect a character, including post traumatic stress disorder and multiple personality disorder.
Chapter 2 discusses personality in terms of modern psychology and provides a realistic, highly versatile, system for developing personalities of NPCs and PCs alike. A group dynamics matrix for developing realistic role-playing situations is also presented here.
Chapter 3 covers various types of insanity, including psychosis and dementia, which are much more realistic than the d20 core rules.
Chapter 4 introduces several new psychologically related spells.
Finally, Chapter 5 contains three new prestige classes, the mentalist, the dream weaver and the lunatic.

86904.description:
Fifth title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go to Demon's Rocks".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a codebook, measure card, torch, map, and rucksack — and to refresh you in your adventure, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.
86904.name: The Wailing Lighthouse Game

86905.description:
From the designer:
"Storm The Castle - Print, make and play this adventure game. You are a knight and you have to storm through the castle and overthrow the King! Along the adventure you run into guards, wandering beasts and more. Totally free game that you can print up, assemble and play. Including a paper dice if you don't have one."

From the Rules:
"You progress through the castle by rolling six sided dice. Whatever number shows on the dice is the number of squares forward you can move. If you land on a square with a red number in it you must refer to that number in this [the] rule book and follow the instructions."
86905.name: Storm the Castle

86906.name: Ball Breaker
86906.description:
User Summary

Ball Breaker is a breakout clone: the player must destroy a wall of bricks with the help of a bat and a bouncing ball.

This game features an isometric 3D display, a ball varying in speed, moving bricks and destroyable creatures.

86907.description:
From back of book:

TechCommander is a fast paced sci-fi action tactical game that puts you in the command chair of a hi tech operations center leading an elite squad on dangerous missions! TechCommander combines miniature gaming with the sci-fi action seen in first person shooters and sci-fi real time strategy video games. The game has powerful Mechanized Strike Vehicle units (called MSV’s for short) that can destroy targets in seconds, but also has the ultimate in elite power armor infantry units. These units are based on a possible progression of future soldier programs in development in the modern day, and are equipped with technology to keep them agile, powerful and somewhat safe from the monster MSV’s roaming the landscape. The infantry are jump jet equipped, and in many cases, running a visibility and sensor masking stealth suit. Many also have capacitance based shield meaning if you do not fully eliminate them, they will recharge! The MSV may be powerful, but left unguarded, it is no match for a crack squad of USSC Force Recon Marines! TechCommander MSVs are fairly large miniatures, standing anywhere from four inches to a foot high. They use a peg-together system so that swapping out weapons and gear for a battle that requires a custom load out is easy!
86907.name: TechCommander

86908.name: Phoenix Miners Rescue
86908.description:
User Summary (from the developer)

Rescue the 33 missing miners!

-Scan for the miners localization
-Drill solid rocks
-Send the capsule to the deep
-Do it Faster

features:
-on screen how to play instructions
-stars ranking
-save ranking
-rescue team art
-RETINA DISPLAY!

86909.name: Marvel Super Hero Squad: The Infinity Gauntlet
86909.description:
User Summary

Marvel Super Hero Squad: The Infinity Gauntlet is the second game based around the Marvel Super Hero Squad television series. The game is an action-adventure title that places the player in control of a team of Marvel heroes as they attempt to stop the Lethal Legion from collecting all the Infinity Gems.

Infinity Gauntlet features three game modes: Story, Challenge, and Freeplay. In Story mode the player chooses a squad member to control and then battles through a number of Marvel locations as they search for the Infinity Gems. It is possible for the player to switch between squad members in order to use hero-specific abilities and powers to solve puzzles. Challenge mode allows up to four players to work together to complete challenges. There are over 30 characters available for use in Challenge mode, including several main supervillains. Finally, Freeplay mode permits the player to return to any level and complete it with any unlocked character.

There is a range of unlockable content in Infinity Gauntlet. The items include bonus costumes and can be uncovered by completing mission objectives. Captain America, Bucky, and Red Skull are only playable on the Xbox 360 and PS3. The DS releases do not include cooperative mode and has a reduced hero roster.

86911.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme Vs.
86911.description:
User Summary

Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme Vs. is an arcade game and the sequel to Mobile Suit Gundam: Gundam vs. Gundam NEXT. The game is a fighting title that places players in control of a Gundam which they use to fight other Gundams.

Extreme Vs. brings a number of changes to the series, but the base game mechanics remain the same. Each Gundam has a cost gauge of 6000, and parts have unit costs of 1000, 2000, 2500, or 3000. The player can customize their mech by choosing which parts to install. Extreme Burst is the newly revised form of Awakening – filling the EX gauge allows the player to activate a special ability for a limited period. Projectile speeds have been increased and boost duration has been decreased.

86912.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 11 - Nov 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: The Psiren – An New Psionic Talent
Doing It My Way: Traveller for the 21st Century
Fifth Imperium #13: Genre-ic Plot Seeds, Part Four: The Action Ones
In A Store Near You: Early (TL8-10) Gauss Rifles
In A Store Near You: Missing Miscellany
Up Close and Personal: Gwen 'Aunt Molly' Polaneczky
86912.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #011: November 2010

Cover: Travis Leichssenring

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

86913.name: MotoGP 09/10
86913.description:
User Summary

MotoGP 09/10 is a motorcycle racing game for the PS3 and Xbox 360. It is a title in the MotoGP series, and the second to be released by Capcom as the sole publisher. Players can choose from a number of motorcycles that were present in the 2009 GP season and race on a range of tracks from the Grand Prix circuit.

MotoGP features four game modes: Career, Championship, Arcade, and Online. Career mode is a comprehensive Grand Prix experience, and has the player compete in races and manage a circuit team off the racetrack. Engineers, team managers, and press officers can all be brought on board to further the player’s career, and performing high difficulty maneuvers can improve a player’s reputation. The player starts with a 125 cc bike, but as their career advances they progress to larger engines.

Championship mode emulates the 2009 and 2010 MotoGP seasons. Players choose a motocycle and race on actual tracks from the circuit. As the 2010 season progresses downloadable content will be made available to expand the 2010 Championship race repertoire. Arcade mode is a callback to old arcade racing titles – players must perform well in each race to complete the track before time expires. A number of well-performed actions will extend the timer, but crashes and other errors will result in time penalties.

The Online mode allows players to race against other to MotoGP players across the globe. Up to 20 bikes can be in a single race. MotoGP features split-screen capabilities to allow local competition between two racers.

86914.name: Slap Fight
videogameversion: European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
86914.description:
Slap Fight (スラップファイト), also known as Alcon, is a 1986 vertically scrolling shooter arcade game developed by Toaplan and published by Taito. It takes its inspiration from Xevious (being a vertical scroller) and Gradius (from which it borrows its power-up system). The game takes place in an Earth-type environment with metallic, land-based enemies; some are mobile armor and others are fortifications embedded in natural terrain.

Enemies always appear in the same location, at every new game or wrap of the map. Certain enemies leave power-up stars upon destruction. Collecting these stars "turns on" an upgrade menu at the bottom of the screen and moves a lit cursor through the list of power-ups described below. If any power-up is lit, but a ship is lost before a power-up could be selected, the star is "carried over" and the Speed block is lit on the next life.

Single hits to the unshielded main ship destroy it, and the player loses any accumulated upgrades including Speed. This can make successive lives difficult to keep in the heat of battle.

This game does not support continues with extra credits, and is believed to be endless; that is, after the final boss, gameplay resumes at the beginning of the play map but at successively higher difficulty due to enemies shooting faster and more frequently. This has been tested to at least three "wraps."

Source: Wikipedia, "Slap Fight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86915.name: The Jetsons: The Computer Game
86915.description:
User summary:

You start out as George Jetson, and you also get to play as all four members of the Jetson family in the game's 8 levels. The game includes exploring, driving and manipulating or dodging objects in an effort to finish each level within the strict time limit.

86916.name: Return to the Temple of Elemental Evil:  Living Greyhawk scenario
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
86916.description:
Adventure description from Home Play Edition front page:

Evil Never Dies. The folk of the village of Hommlet fear that a new evil might be rising in the nearby temple, once a bastion of a cult dedicated to wicked elementalism.

86917.description:
German Expansion card to Friesematenten from Amigo, available at Essen 2010.

German Text:
"Spiel die Karte gegen einen Mitspieler deiner Wahl. Du erhälst von ihm €40. Hat er keine €40, bekommst Du all sein Geld. Er erhält dafür die Karte und kann sie ab der nächsten Runde einsetzen."

"Play the card against a player of your choice. You get €40 from him. If he has less than €40, you get all of his money. He gets this card and can sit out of the next round"

The illustration shows the designer, Friedemann Friese.
86917.name: Friesematenten: Volle Vierzig

86918.description:
From Flying Frog's Website:

Once again it is All Hallows Eve and the dead are rising from their slumber. Father Joseph has devised a plan to send the angry dead back to their graves, once and for all, but it won’t be easy. He has prepared a holy ritual at the center of town; marking ritual circles on the ground, reciting incantations, and assembling all manner of powerful artifacts to aid him. But the ritual is not yet complete, and the hour grows late!

This scenario requires the Growing Hunger Expansion set to play (you must have 8 L-Shaped boards). This Scenario can also support up to 9 players (up to 6 Hero Players and 3 Zombie Players).
86918.name: Last Night on Earth 'All Hallows Eve II – The Ritual' Scenario
boardgameexpansion: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

boardgamehonor: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine Game Nominee
86919.description:
Simulation of the Seven Days' Battles which started Robert E. Lee on the road to glory.

The setting is the Union’s Peninsula Campaign in the spring of 1862. McClellan has formed and trained a large army, transported it by sea in an outflanking maneuver, marched it to the gates of the Confederate capital, and is poised to capture the city and probably bring an end to the rebellion. On the Confederate side Lee has taken over the Army after Johnston was wounded. Unlike Johnston, who was content to fight a largely defensive campaign, Lee gathered every unit he could get his hands on and launched his own offensive. The Union had placed its army in an awkward position, with one corps north of Chickahominy River and the rest south of it. Lee’s plan, and the position of the units when the game starts, was to crush the Union Corps and then drive the rest of McClellan’s army from the capital, destroying as much of it as he possible could. With that accomplished he would have a free hand to turn north.

The system is a simplified version of two games, the last area-impulse Avalon Hill published, Breakout: Normandy, and MMP's Monty's Gamble: Market Garden.

The game features leaders who are rated for initiative and combat effectiveness. Another mechanism in the game is the “advantage” marker which can be traded to the opponent to do things like rally, conduct a combined assault, declare a heroic defense that turns a success into a stalemate, or receive additional replacements.

The victory conditions are based on territorial control. For the Union that was Richmond. For the Confederacy that was the Union supply heads – White House Landing and Harrison’s Landing – and Malvern Hill. A key decision for the Union player is when to shift his supply train from White House Landing to the more secure location at Harrison’s Landing.

The unit scale is divisional including artillery and cavalry.

There is the campaign game, and a few optional rules. Playing time should be under three hours between experienced players.
86919.name: Birth of a Legend

86920.name: Enquêtes criminelles spéciales
86920.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Les personnages sont les héros d'une série télévisée, membres d'une équipe de spécialistes scientifiques et policiers, utilisant la haute technologie et leur intuition quasi-infaillible pour résoudre les crimes les plus improbables.


User Translation from French:

The characters are the heroes of a television series, members of a team of scientific specialists and policemen, using high-tech equipment and their almost infallible intuition to solve the most unlikely crimes.

86921.name: Somnambules
86921.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Les personnages de ce jeu souffrent d'une affection particulière qui les empêche de dormir...

Ils se sont physiquement habitués à cette constante fatigue.

Un effet secondaire de leur affection est leur capacité à percevoir les phénomènes surnaturels : fantômes, usage de magie, êtres féeriques, vampires...

Les plus doués peuvent modifier la réalité selon leurs rêves les plus fous.


User Translation from French:

The characters in this game suffer from a particular condition that prevents them from sleeping...

They are physically accustomed to this constant fatigue.

A secondary effect of their condition is their ability to perceive supernatural phenomena: ghosts, use of magic, fey beings, vampires...

The most gifted can alter reality in accordance with their wildest dreams.

86922.name: The Colony
86922.description:
From the Author:

This scenario originally appeared in the Cthulhu Conglomerate Publication, 'The Exquisite Cadaver', and was presented at Arcanacon IX, 1991 in Melbourne, Australia. It has been revised and updated here to incorporate later developments in the lore of the Cthulhu Mythos, particularly in reference to the Karatechia from Pagan Publishing's Delta Green supplements.

86923.name: The Bog
86923.description:
From the author:

A dead man walks back into a Scottish village after vanishing in a nearby bog. It is up to the investigators to find out just what lurks beneath the bog.

86924.name: The Black Stone
86924.description:
From the author:

A group of graduate students has vanished in the Maine woods. What ancient horror plagues the woods? Will the investigators defeat it or will they become its next victims?

86925.name: Charlie Don't Surf
86925.description:
website blurb:
1969 Cthulhu scenario, 4-6 Investigators required: characters supplied.

May 10th 1969, the A Shau Valley near Hue, it's been quiet... too quiet... the air is thick with the expectation of an attack from Charlie in response to operation Apache Snow. You and the remains of your squad from the 101st Airborne are out on deep recon, trying to get back to your base at Hill 937: 'Hamburger Hill'. You come across two abandoned vills. Scouting the area you find something that changes your world. Makes you think that Charlie may be the least of your worries...

86926.name: The Brunholt Head
86926.description:
From the PDF:

The investigators are sent into the Maine woods in search of a mysterious (and perhaps familiar?) metal head.

86927.name: The Bone Dealers
86927.description:
From the PDF:
