The terrible incidents involving the vrykolokas served to reinforce Reginald Preston’s belief that a clear and dire danger to humanity exists. This belief has led Preston to increase his efforts in learning more about the nature of the danger. Unfortunately, his studies of the tome (the Notes
on Magic) located by his ill-fated friend Don Wedenberg have lead him on a dangerous path.

After mastering the ritual to Call Up Dwellers of the Charnel Yard (Contact Ghoul), Preston elected to attempt to contact these dwellers and learn from them as much as he could.

86928.name: Artificial Intelligence
86928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Offworld Endeavors has produced for you a playable race known as the Artificial Intelligence. Artificial Intelligence that is trapped within a computer can be interesting. An AI that is able to interface with the outside world by taking control of machines is much better. An AI that can do both is just plain Awesome!

No futuristic science fiction setting would be complete without it.

Many of the very best science fiction movies portrayed Artificially Intelligent computers. Until now, the game master had to wing it. There were no rules for playing an AI. Now there are! All equipment items listed in this supplement have both a Purchase DC and a real value in Credits.

Inside you will find:

Playable Race: Artificial Intelligence
Rules for taking remote control of vehicles, mecha, and starships.
Manipulator Gloves
Brain Cube
Neural Interface Helmet
Mecha Remote Pilot System
Hawking Cube
New uses for other equipment

86929.name: The Books of Uncle Silas
86929.description:
From the PDF:

For almost 600 years four books of such terrible arcane knowledge and sorcery have been in the possession of one family. Passed down, these books have been kept hidden from the world, for if used they could spell doom for mankind. Can the investigators stop them falling into the wrong hands?

86930.name: Future Armor
86930.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking into the future is an art, but we did our best to make sure that the armor systems that are present in this book represent conceivable possibilities although this sort of breaks down somewhere near the end of progress level 8 and the beginning of 9. This product was designed in response to the unbalancing nature of powerful weapons that we all love to use. Not that those weapons are bad, but if you have ever been a game master you know how much they can unbalance a game all by themselves.

Future Armor was designed with play balance in mind. The available armor types escalate by slight variations in many cases so that armors of past and future progress levels match up appropriately. This is not a book full of "no one else dared make them this good" suits of armor, but some of them are really quite good, and appropriately expensive.

As with all products from Offworld Endeavors, every item has a purchase DC as well as a real price tag. See our other products for details.

Inside you will find:

Over 30 Types of Armor from Progress Level 5 through 9.
10 Types of Powered Armor.
15 Armor Gadgets
Other defense related gear that wasn't really armor or a gadget.

86931.name: Future Price Guide
86931.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within these pages, every item in the the Future portion of the SRD has had its value translated into credits just like the [Modern Price Guide] did for the Modern SRD. You don't realize just how much equipment is in The Future until you see it all listed together like it is here in the Future Price Guide.
Buying new complex equipment and selling used equipment is abstract and clumsy with the Purchase DC system. It's easy to see what you are buying and selling using Credits! If you have embraced roleplaying in the future, but you miss the excitement of purchasing your own equipment, now you can!

86932.name: Modern Price Guide
86932.description:
From publisher blurb:

Purchase DC = $$$

Within these pages, every item in the Modern SRD has had its value translated into real dollars. Every Firearm and Vehicle has an actual list price. Want to craft an item using your own skill? The average cost for components based on the difficulty of crafting the item are listed.
All services and lifestyle items have been given real prices as well. Furthermore, a method for determining starting wealth for characters of 1st through 20th level has been included. You've wished for it! Now it is here for the downloading!

If you have embraced the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game, but you miss the excitement of purchasing your own equipment with money you can count, now you can!

86933.name: The Dark Island
86933.description:
From the PDF:

An abandoned government site in Maine. A pacific island that no one visits. A member of congress is looking for the truth and brings in the investigators to help her.

86934.name: The Demon of Catheway
86934.description:
From the PDF:

Corpses without hearts. A missing University of Maine student. Egyptian treasure. What's the connection?

86935.name: The Drooler in the Dark: The Dog That Should Not Be
86935.description:
From the PDF:

This adventure is intended as a bit of comic relief to break up the usual tedious monotony of death and insanity that the intrepid investigators have grown so accustomed to.

86936.name: The Nightmare War
86936.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nightmare War explores the desperate battle for survival in a near future earth. Possessing the form and memories of a human life and the elusive nightmares of a truly alien past, you must contend with a new life as something more than human.

A 'stand-alone' campaign sourcebook for players and games masters - pit your characters, cursed with a terrifying alien legacy, against malevolent forces intent on their utter destruction. In the world of 2035, the Nightwalkers struggle to survive and to understand what they have become; and just what it is that hunts them.

The Nightmare War illustrates a conflict fought in the shadows including in-game world information, five new character classes, dozens of feats & skills, new technology, antagonists & allies, over a dozen NPC classes, 6 new character sheet, and tools for running a single story or entire campaigns.

86937.name: Bronze Gods
86937.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is vibrant, the world is alive... You can taste salt on the wind, smell the black damp of the earth beneath your feet. The drums of the ancestors call out to the clans, their song carried to all the chiefdoms across the sea. These are the ancient islands of the Brothers, the islands of the Bronze Gods, and they are your home.

Find the pathways of the elders, winding into crumbling temples deep within the mountains. Sail across the glimmering water, to return with valuable goods and stories of strange places. Wage an endless battle against the merciless oceans, against the noble warriors of your sworn blood foes or against the terrors that lay in wait in the ruins of ages past. And above all, pay your respects to the spirits and the Gods, for it is theirs to decide the fate of all the tribes.

Taste the wine and sing the story in your spirit, for at this hearth we are all kin.

Bronze Gods is a 145 page self-contained campaign setting detailing the Island of the Four Brothers - home to the Bronze Gods. Contained within are rich background and cultural information, several new races and several complete character classes, settings specific equipment and magic types, new terrain and hazard rules, antagonists, allies and a series of adventure seeds. Bronze Gods is ideal for games masters looking for an alternative fantasy setting with a twist without needing to commit to multiple books to get started.

86938.name: Top 40 Nederlandse Editie
86938.description:
Trivia game about Dutch Artists in the Dutch top 40. It's a music trivia game. The player that answers the most questions correctly wins the game. The players have to sing a song, listen to music and guess the artist or songtitle.

The person that collects 6 chips first, wins the game.

Contents
1 rulebook
110 cards with 660 questions in 6 different categories
1 CD with 99 musicfragments
36 chips
1 dice

86939.name: Dinner With Susan
86939.description:
From the PDF:

An introductory or one-shot Call of Cthulhu scenario loosely inspired by Clive Barker's short story The Madonna. Designed to be printed on a couple of sheets of A4 paper, hence light on detail. All the information a Keeper needs to run the scenario is included.

86940.name: Age of the Dead
86940.description:
From the introduction:
Age of the Dead is a small supplement for Savage Worlds role-playing game. The central mood of this supplement is a survival of a group of persons as the dead started to rise as zombies. But it's not a survival horror genre. AotD is more about people who will finally survive during the apocalypse. Yes, zombies are still lethal, but the characters are also has some skills to survive.

86941.name: D20 Firearms
86941.description:
From publisher blurb:

Firearms play an integral part in any modern setting. Although not as deadly as in real life (modern heroes routinely run through a hail of bullets, either not getting hit or not being seriously injured), the rules in this book are a simple and effective way of introducing firearms into any setting.

86942.name: Savage Suns
86942.description:
From the introduction:
An adaptation of the Fading Suns setting for the Savage Worlds system.

For more than two years I spent making this adaptation of the "best sci-fi setting ever". Relax - it's a joke (may be). Fading Suns is really one of my favored settings, at the same shelf with 7th Sea and Deadlands. But, for my sorrow, the original VPS system- oh, I don’t want to talk about one of the worst role playing engine I’ve ever met.

So, for more than two years I was making this adaptation. Right now it’s already the third edition of the rules, and it’s not a conversion- some setting elements were changed to be more in line with "FFF" concept. The two previous "editions" were partially in Russian language; this one goes totally in English.

The work is still not finished, as I hope the history of this great setting is not yet ended. With time I’ll put some new content in this adaptation.

86943.name: An Eldritch Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
86943.description:
From the PDF:

The Mi-Go have secretly been dwelling on Earth for many years. Over time, their attempts to disguise themselves in the human world have brought them closer and closer to our culture. In the past several decades, some of their attempts to blend in have been a little too successful. Now, a small band of Mi-Go has become addicted to Yog Radio and Yog- Sothoth.com. They’ve been following the cephalopodcast and its website almost religiously since it began in the mid 1990’s.

86944.name: Blasphemous Secrets and Forbidden Lore
86944.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step right up folks, we have weird enchantments, arcane formulae, sinister incantations and loathsome secret rituals galore! Whether the lost rites of nameless cults, the twisted fruits of misguided scholarship or even the direct agency of Lucifer himself, we've got 'em all! It's hours of twisted occult fun the whole family can enjoy! And at low-low prices that can't possibly last!

So help yourself to a big steaming pile of Blasphemous Secrets and Forbidden Lore. Get 'em while they're hot!

86945.name: More Blasphemous Secrets and More Forbidden Lore
86945.description:
From publisher blurb:

99 new OGL spells, for all your fiendish occult needs! We have strange enchantments, unsavory mystic formulae and more sinister rites than you'll know what do with! Call strange forces down on lonely hilltops at midnight, intone lost incantations the world is glad to have forgotten, stun, amaze and horrify your friends!

Not just another collection of combat spells, this book broadens and enriches the techniques available to spellcasting characters, increasing the DM's options without unbalancing the game. Or so the author assures us. He also told us that he needed to take our favorite sock puppet up to the top of Goat-Foot Hill on the equinox, and we haven't seen it since.

While this is the second book in the series, you won't need any of the others to make use of this book's contents. All the nasty secret rituals and arcane strangeness in here stand on their own (although, come to think of it, you should run out and buy all the others right now, anyway).

So step right up and cut yourself a big steaming slice of Blasphemous Secrets and Forbidden Lore. What have you got to lose but your soul?

86946.name: A Handful of Dust
86946.description:
From the PDF:

Deserts preserve secrets, and the dusty wastelands of New Mexico have buried many. Nearby the test site of the world's first atomic bomb, a centuries-old coven of witches has been resurrected, and Delta Green has been alerted to the emerging threat. Dispatched to the scene, the investigating agents are yet to learn that a far older radioactive horror may overshadow all their expectations.

86947.name: Night Gunner
videogameversion: European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
86947.description:
User Summary

The game publisher Digital integration specialised in more realistic style arcade games. Not sims, but more serious than conversions of real arcade games, they still remained very entertaining and appealed to older players.

Night Gunner puts you in the position of both pilot and bombardier on a mission over Europe. You must defend your bomber from attacks by fighter planes, and then accurately bomb your target. The game takes you through various missions.

The game was written by R J Swift, who is given a credit on the front cover.

The card insert includes Softlock, one of the early attempts at what is now called DRM. After loading the game, the player must enter a code number printed in 10 columns on the insert. Since Spectrum players could buy plug-in boxes which saved games in mid-play, this Softlock was easily avoided.

86948.name: 3-D Tank Duel
86948.description:
User Summary

Initially just called RealTime Software, this new publisher entered the Spectrum market with an instant hit, a wire-frame tank battle. Using simple wire-frame graphics helped get around the Spectrum's simple colour schematics, but also made the game very fast. This release was seen as cutting edge at the time, and encouraged more publishers to adopt simple colour techniques.

In the game, you drive a futuristic tank around a random landscape, shooting enemy tanks and UFOs.

86949.name: Codename MAT
86949.description:
User Summary

With the success of the massive space/trading game Elite on other platforms, Codename MAT was a response to bring a more sophisticated space adventure to the spectrum market.

You play the role of a teenager, given an experimental spaceship, sent out to defend earth from a final assault by the Myons. Written by Derek Brewster, the game moves between tricky arcade style space battles in 3D, and complex navigation tasks to get from one planet to another.

With a mass of keys to remember, and fairly tricky game-play mixed in with dramatic shooting matches, Codename MAT showed that the Spectrum could overcome its limits and present the player with a detailed experience. But this was at the cost of basic graphics and long instructions, and whilst the game got good reviews, younger players found it too hard to handle.

86950.name: Amalgam Animal Assistants
86950.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amalgam Animal Assistants is a short PDF focusing on alternate rules for multiclass characters who want to have their Special Mount or Animal Companion also be their familiar. The rules information is mostly extracted from Colours of Magic: Green Magic.

86951.name: Radical Re-Alignment
86951.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever thought that the two dimentional Good vs Evil and Law vs Chaos alignment system was a little bland? Have you ever wanted to come up with your own alignment scheme, but didn't want to invalidate all the normal creatures and planes of existance that are standard to d20 and based on the normal alignment system?

Take a look at Radical Re-Alignment! Included:

Six alignment dualities, including an adjustment of the base two and four new philosophical and psychological constructs to define conflict and character traits arround
A deconstruction of the standard alignment magic and a reconstruction again allowing quick and easy addition of your own alignment structures with the same base spell concepts, including a 6 page .rtf template file for alignment spells with instructions on find and replace for your own alignment systems.
Examples of character archetypes and their alignment matrix as a demonstration of how the system works.

86952.name: Cyber Zone
86952.description:
User Summary

Loading extremely quickly, Cyber Zone is a very simple arcade game. A large space ship hovers above you, as you slide back and forth along the bottom of the screen, shooting away at its defence screen, scoring lots of points. Once you have removed enough of this, you need a direct hit up the centre of the craft, and the green alien's head explodes, before the whole thing resets.

But the alien ship has its own defences. Lasers zap down at you if you stay still for a moment. An energy beam blasts vertically down from the centre if you pass underneath the ship. But best of all, tiny bomber planes whizz back and forth, climb, turn and then dive bomb you, all with amazing sound effects. ZAPZAPWHEEEEEBOOMBLAMBLAMZAPZAPBOOOOM!!

The game is mental! It's a mad frantic scramble to keep hitting the bombers, chip away at the defence screen, avoid the lasers and beam, and finally pop a shot in accurately to kill the alien. Then the next screen has more bombers, faster lasers, quicker beams, and it just goes on getting harder and harder.

Cyber Zone is a blast to play. Very simple, but with a rhythm and pace not seen elsewhere. The early screens are easy if you're not too stupid, but as the game progresses, it gets harder and harder to attack the centre of the ship, without which you cannot get to the alien.

Sadly, nobody ever heard of the game and Spectrum fans missed out on a riot.

The game also included a voice-activated feature. By connecting up your cassette player, and using a blank cassette to let you switch to record, you could supposedly use the cassette player's inbuilt mic to trigger your lasers. It didn't work.

86953.name: Unlikely Heroes
86953.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy literature abounds with tales of ordinary folk, lifted to the status of Hero by extraordinary events. The Unlikely Heroes are seven character classes with concepts drawn from the standard NPC classes in the d20 DMG. They are for those exceptional people who choose not to adventure, but should fate intervene, their quality shines through.

86954.name: Frank N. Stein
86954.description:
User Summary

A brilliant little platform game which suited the Spectrum's graphics superbly. It had a humorous horror theme as you, Frank N. Stein, run around collecting the bones of the monster, avoiding the usual enemies running left and right. One amusing novelty was the light bulbs inset to the platforms - walk on these and you get an electric shock which briefly paralyses you. As you fry, your shocked body shows an X-ray of your skeleton! You also slip on ice, slide down poles and bounce up on springs. After collecting all the parts, you nip back to the top and trigger the creation of your monster.

Then there's an intermediate screen where you simple get to the top and hit a trigger and on to the next game screen.

Using all the Spectrum's tricks to its advantage, Frank N. Stein uses all the familiar elements in a very amusing and challenging game. There's nothing new, but the game does everything very well, with very tight timing and moves and you're never left in an impossible position if you can handle the keys well.

86955.description:
In a reversal of roles, all players in Munchkin Zombies start out as zombies, and the "monsters" are the normal people trying to stop the zombie invasion (such as the Action Hero, Soccer Mom, Fireman, etc.). Unlike most Munchkin games, there are no classes or races; instead, you can have a mojo: Atomic Zombie, Plague Zombie, and Voodoo Zombie. As with Munchkin Bites! and Super Munchkin, Munchkin Zombies includes powers – special abilities that you can play as you gain levels.

Guest artist is Alex Fernandez, who drew the Meals on Wheels card.

Part of the Munchkin series.

Munchkin is a satirical card game based on the clichés and oddities of Dungeons and Dragons and other role-playing games. Each player starts at level 1 and the winner is the first player to reach level 10. Players can acquire familiar D&D style character classes during the game which determine to some extent the cards they can play.

There are two types of cards - treasure and encounters. Each turn the current players 'kicks down the door' - drawing an encounter card from the deck. Usually this will involve battling a monster. Monsters have their own levels and players must try and overcome it using the levels, weapons and powers they have acquired during the game or run away. Other players can chose to help the player or hinder by adding extra monsters to the encounter. Defeating a monster will usually result in drawing treasure cards and acquiring levels. Being defeated by a monster results in "bad stuff" which usually involves losing levels and treasure.

Note: The 2012 edition of Munchkin Zombies from Pegasus Spiele includes the first expansion, Munchkin Zombies 2: Armed and Dangerous.
86955.name: Munchkin Zombies
boardgameexpansion: Munchkin Get More Loot! Promotional Postcard
Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass

86956.name: Technician Ted
86956.description:
User Summary

Technician Ted combined a platform game with a genre new to Spectrum players, the adventure game. Ted's adventure is simply to complete a variety of unknown tasks around the computer chip factory where he worked. Ted's actions in one room affected events in another room, so players had to go through the game several times to get the proper result. It was a precursor to the more complex adventure games that became popular later, such as Everyone's A Wally.

Technician Ted featured two novelties, a loading screen with sprites (previously, Spectrum load screens were static), and a highly accurate collision detection system. This let players enjoy greater accuracy in their play and set a high standard later publishers couldn't follow.

The game was written by S Marsden and D Cooke in 1984.

86957.description:
Combat Commander: Resistance! (or CC:R) expands upon Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean by adding partisans and their war behind the front lines. This fourth volume of the Combat Commander wargame series features special rules and components for fighting with Partisan forces against the Axis nations of Europe.

The new CC:R playbook covers the following:

Random Scenario Generator Update, including the Partisan Leader Table and Fortification OB
Definition of the Partisan Faction, its Unit Structure, Stats and Weapons
Rules for Irregular Melee, Sewers and Sighting Markers
New Orders: Infiltrate and Muster
New Actions: Knife, No Quarter and Trap
New Events: Inexperience, Patriotism and Stealth




In addition to the new playbook, the game includes 3 back-printed game maps (6 maps total), 6 double-sided scenario sheets (12 scenarios total), one counter sheet (units and markers), a 36-card Partisan Fate Deck and a 19-card Partisan Force Deck. The new maps depict specific historical locations in Greece, Hercegovina, Eastern Bosnia, Byelorussia, Croatia and Western Bosnia.

The scenarios included in CC:R are:

62 Bessarabian Nights II is a new version of Scenario 7 originally published in Combat Commander: Europe, set in a German rear area as Soviet forces press German forces back into the Carpathian Mountains, April 1944;
63 Praise the Lord and Pass the Ammunition set in Rouen France with FFI partisans moving quickly and elusively to attack elements of the German 2nd SS Panzer Division looking for a place to rest, 30 August 1944;
64 Predator Becomes Prey, set outside Leskovic, Albania, with ELAS partisans in a prepared ambush against elements of the German 1st Gebirgsjäger Division, whose commander suspecting a ruse changed his attack plans, 27 June 1943;
65 Road Trip set at Cressensac, southern France, with FFI partisan forces ambushing the German 4th SS Panzergrenadier Regimental HQ, 8 June 1944;
66 Those are not Birds set in the Bryansk Forest in Byelorussia, with Soviet partisans of the Orlov Regiment preparing a trap for elements of the German 707th Security Division during Operation Vogelsang, 8 June 1942;
67 The Orient Express set at the south end of the Gorgopotamos Bridge near Lamia, Greece, with ELAS partisans seeking to suppress the Italian Garrison while British Demolition commandos prepare to blow the bridge during Operation Harling, 25 November 1942;
68 Tito’s Trick set at Jablanica, Hercegovina, at the railroad bridge crossing of the Neretva River, with Partisans attempting to seize the bridgehead and destroy the Chetnik forces blocking the Partisan escape from German forces (during the 4th Enemy Offensive), 28 February 1943;
69 Compagnie Scamaroni II is a new version of Scenario 58 originally published in Combat Commander: Normandy, set at night in the Vaucelles neighborhood of Caen just before the Orne River,18 July 1944;
70 Appointment at Daliki set in a remote village south of Lepel, Byelorussia, with Soviet partisans of an important Operative Center suddenly trapped by a well-executed German rear-area clearing operation, 26 June 1943;
71 Valley of the Heroes set outside the village of Tjentište, Eastern Bosnia, at the Sutjeska River, where trapped Partisan units fought their way through a weak point in the German-Croatian lines, escaping once again although at great cost (during the 5th Enemy Offensive), 14 May 1943;
72 Thunderstorm set on the island of Korčula on the Croatian Adriatic coast, with Partisans of the Dalmatian Brigade attempting to buy enough time for their comrades to evacuate from surrounding German units of the 118th Jäger Division (during the 6th Enemy Offensive), 23 December 1943; and
73 No Quarter set at the town cemetery outside Drvar, Western Bosnia, with Partisans of the Lika Division in a ferocious showdown with elements of the 500th SS Fallschirmjäger Battalion after a spectacular but failed attempt to seize Tito in his country HQ (during the 7th Enemy Offensive), 25 May 1944.



NOTE: Combat Commander: Resistance! is not a complete game. It requires ownership of both Combat Commander: Europe and Combat Commander: Mediterranean to play.
Developer -- Kai Jensen
86957.name: Combat Commander: Resistance!
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 27: An expanding universe of expansions

86958.name: Glug Glug
86958.description:
User Summary

Very basic game with basic graphics and sound. Your deep sea diver is tethered to a little boat on the surface. You go up and down on your rope, left and right with the boat, avoiding fish, jellyfish and squid. You can shoot them with your gun, but the main task is to pick up the treasure from the ocean floor and bring it back to the boat. Further screens just add more creatures, floating around more randomly.

Art by Phil Gascoine.

86959.name: Blade Alley
86959.description:
User Summary

Crude graphics and basic game-play create a vague 3D impression as various space ships race towards your craft. You move around and try to get in line with them to shoot them down, but judging height is difficult, the only indicator being black shadows on the ground.

86960.name: Arcane Conduit
86960.description:
From Introduction:

Arcane conduits are unique among arcane spellcasters. Arcane casters generally spend most of their lives gathering arcane might. Even those who employ their skills in the service of good demonstrate some degree of selfishness when it comes to arcane rewards. Arcane conduits are an exception to this rule. Their role is as a vessel for channeling the power of other mages. They are in constant search of ways to aid their fellow spellcasters. Their potential is only fully realized when in the service of other mages.

86961.name: Bactron
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
86961.description:
User Summary

Bactron is a French arcade-adventure game. Bactrons are living blobs of antibiotics who are injected into patients to cure infections and diseases. The goal of the player is to guide a bactron inside the body of a terminally ill patient, undo the damage done by multiplying viruses and destroy them by releasing the enzymes found in the game.

The game uses an isometric 3D display engine. Each room is a different puzzle to solve as each different virus has its own behavior, and enzymes are often found in hard to reach places. There is a time limit, as viruses keep multiplying as long as they're not neutralized and the patient's temperature rises. Once it reaches 42°C, the game is over.

The game received a lot of praises at the time of its release for its animation and graphics (by Bruno Masson) and its musical score by Michel Winogradoff. The first edition of the game was sold with a metal badge inside, so Bactron players could recognize each other.

86962.name: Lethean
86962.description:
From Introduction:

Letheans wrap themselves in cloaks of memory, excising themselves from the minds of those they encounter. Some follow this path for personal gain. Others follow it in service to higher powers or ideals. And some are forced onto the path, their very survival dependent on being forgettable. Skilled letheans are able to act without regard to the consequences that bind others, shielded from retribution or accountability. Though the benefits within reach of letheans are great, the price is higher than most can bear.

86963.name: Aegire
86963.description:
From Overview:

Given the dangers present in swampy regions, many sages have questioned how anyone is able to safely emerge from the swamps. Whether a lone merchant, or a group of highly trained adventurers, the sheer number of perils points to a minimal chance of survival. Yet, the actual numbers are far higher than statistically probable. These higher numbers are in part due to the existence of the aegire.

Aegire are seldom seen by travelers, but their watchful presence is often felt. Aegire aid travelers when they can. Those who benefit from their aid are usually not even aware that it was rendered. Those who are aware of the aid seldom know the actual source, leading to legends of beneficial swamp spirits. In particularly dangerous swamps, travelers go so far as to create travelers shrines to the aegire, though the aegire have no interest in such recognition.

The select few druids, rangers and sages who know the truth about the aegire are silent when queried. Even they do not know the reason why this shortlived race provides aid, though a few legends exist. The most common tells of druids from an extinct race that protected the swamp. According to the legend, the druids gave up the last vestiges of their racial heritage to defend the swamp. Whether this story is true or not may never be known. However, any druid or ranger who respects life can be comfortable knowing they have allies in the shadows of the swamp.

86964.name: Alratheen
86964.description:
From Overview:

They are errant thoughts of Terminus. Idle curiosity and intense desire made flesh. Awakened dreams forced into painful consciousness. The mind of the wanderer freed from the body. They are the alratheen.

Alratheen are literally the mind of Terminus. Their bodies are the neural structures of the sentient, slumbering plane. Birthed deep within the bowels of Terminus, the alratheen are the network that houses the consciousness of the plane.

Not all alratheen remain at the core of the plane. Some alratheen are created to perform specific tasks, such as the policing of other creatures found on Terminus or exploration of other planes. The purpose of other alratheen is less specific. These alratheen are physical manifestations of stray thoughts of Terminus.

86965.name: Cyndarim
86965.description:
From Overview:

Universally viewed as creatures of exceptional beauty, cyndarims are a striking aquatic race. As with most things of beauty, some feel they must be possessed. Woe to those foolish enough to try.

The fragile appearance of cyndarims belies their predatory nature. Few creatures, either below or above the waves, can match their appetites and ruthlessness. Their all-consuming hunger is not limited to the physical, for cyndarims are constantly in search of greater power.

Unwitting creatures often treat cyndarims as unique curiosities. Those familiar with the race respect and fear their power. Their mercenary skill and arcane might have been found useful by many other races, especially when discretion and amorality are required. However, one must be careful when dealing with cyndarims, for they deem none allies in their quest for power.

86966.name: The War Of The Worlds
86966.description:
User Summary

The insert cover says Jeff Wayne's Video Game Version Of The War Of The Worlds. It's a simple adventure derived from the popular 70s musical version of the HG Wells story. Musical cues in the game are intended to help you as you progress around for 6 days, trying to get to the right locations in the right order. The game was too frustrating for most players and the game got a bad reputation as being too slow and boring. Dull graphics didn't help either.

Programming was by Nigel Taylor.

86967.name: D'Ah Rien
86967.description:
From Overview:

As races become more advanced, some choose to use their growing power for conquest. Others view their role as guardians and teachers. Fortunately, the latter is true of the d’ah rien.

Long ago, the d’ah rien were a tribal race of efficient swampland hunters. As their bodies developed, so too did their minds. In time, the race developed powerful psionic might. D’Ah Rien civilizations spread throughout the swamps, gems of learning amid the mire. The d’ah rien continued to advance while other emergent races rose and fell. The d’ah rien had lesser allies during this time, but no equals. The race observed an interesting effect of this lack of peers: their own advancement had begun to slow. After much contemplation, the d’ah rien realized their advancement could only continue if others were brought up to their levels.

Today, the d’ah rien actively spread knowledge through any cultures they encounter. D’Ah Rien learning missions can be found in most metropolises and many smaller communities. The race is particularly interested in cultures relying on arcane might. The d’ah rien feel that these cultures understand self-improvement, and are ready to begin developing their minds in place of their arcane crutches.

86968.name: Daxa
86968.description:
From Overview:

At midday, a brutal sandstorm washes in, scouring the dunes. Yet the following morning, the tents of a roving city have risen. It streets bustle with craftsmen and merchants, the nomadic daxa.

Daxas are consummate desert survivors. These tribal nomads are able to find sustenance amid unforgiving wind-torn dunes. Here they flourish, acting as guides and traders in desolate lands. Their solemn visages mask hearts of a kind and gentle people with a love for each breath they take.

86970.name: Euqsam
86970.description:
From Overview:

Fleshrider. Bonedriver. Blightbinder. Whatever names they are known by, rumors of euqsamis instill fear in the most stalwart of hearts. Yet these emotions are nothing beside the terror in those unfortunate enough to behold the carrion orchards.

Euqsams are a floral race using the corpses of faunal creatures for mobility. The race possesses an advanced organic technology, farming organic materials from faunal creatures modified through necromancy and transmutation.

Euqsams firmly believe that floral life is superior to faunal life. In the view of this expansionist race, the dominance of faunal life is aberrant. It is the place of euqsams to restore the proper natural order.

86971.name: Bob Winner
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
86971.description:
User Summary

Bob Winner is an android sent in search for a lost civilization. He must travel across the world in search of the 3 keys that will grant him access to his goal. Each key is guarded by a different character, and Bob must find special items in order to defeat each guardian.

Bob Winner is a side-scrolling game. Each screen represents a country (the background graphics use digitized photos of well-known monuments like the Eiffel Tower or Big Ben) and has different hazards that must be overcome in order to proceed to the next screen.

The game package included a short comic book describing the back story.

86972.name: Field Guide, Volume I
86972.description:
From Introduction:

The Field Guide is a brief synopsis of the races found in the Emerging Forms line of products from Primal Urge Games. It provides a brief snapshot of each race, including artwork, alignment, preferred class, and supplementary material for the races in the series. The Field Guide serves as a preview for those interested in different volumes in the series, as well as a reference for those already using races from the series. This volume highlights the first thirteen races from the series.

All the volumes in Emerging Forms are designed to work atomically, with no dependency between the races. The series takes a modular approach to races. The races are intended to be used freely with other races in the series, as well as races found in a host of other products, including the standard fantasy races. Enough material on the behaviors and motivations of each race is presented to weave the race into an existing campaign world, or create a new campaign world. Purchasing a single race will not take away from your enjoyment of the product. Of course if you enjoy one of the races, we would encourage you to pick up other races.

From user summary:

Collects basic stat info from Aegire, Alratheen, Cyndarim, D'Ah Rien, Grizimilak, Jhardwyn, Lidaem, Pergothi, Rin, Ryonth, Thozeran, Xeshaal and Zure.

86973.name: The RiddleMaster
86973.description:
From the Back Cover

They scour the remote ruins seeking to unravel the deepest mysteries of the world. They mingle with most power heroes and rulers to shape the unfolding of history. They commune with mighty sphinxes to achieve enigmatic ends. They ruthlessly compete with each other in bloodless battles of wits, trying to be the first to solve the most challenging ridlles. They are the RiddleMasters, until now shrouded in secrecy.

This book introduces the RiddleMaster as a character class and contains all the information need to play a RiddleMaster including:

5 New Prestige Classes
New Skills, Feats, and Spells
Rules for Riddle Contests
13 New Riddles and Riddles Rooms

86975.name: New World Colony
86975.description:
User Summary (from the developer)

New World Colony is an addictive strategy board game for 1 to 4 players. Starting from a single plot of land, you must settle new territories, gather resources, trade, and build structures in order to grow your colony. In order to secure victory, you must find a way to control and defend large regions.

- Explore forests, fields, water, and mountains and keep an eye out for special territories
- Build mines, sawmills, towns, forts, and granaries to increase your resource gathering rate
- Build trading posts to gain trade bonuses
- Four game modes to suit your style: Normal, Defensive, Pacifist, and Warlord
- Invade opponents' territories and construct walls to defend your own.
- Trade to earn gold and more useful resources.
- Touch controls allow you to scroll and zoom the game map to get a close up or high-level view of the action.
- Play solo against the computer, locally with friends, online with friends or auto-match against other players
- Earn achievements for your hard-fought victories
- 'Free-for-all' mode for real-time, simultaneous play.

EASY FOR BEGINNERS: Contains a step-by-step tutorial to quickly bring new players up to speed. Also contains a quick reference rule sheet if you need information during a game. And a message bar gives helpful instructions as the game goes on so you'll never feel lost.

FUN FOR EXPERTS: The gameplay is well balanced and requires meaningful decisions at every turn. No dice rolling means that you are always in control of your own destiny - you will win or lose based on how well you execute your strategy. Four gameplay modes, multiple map sizes, and completely random maps mean that every game requires a different strategy.

86976.name: AHHH!!!
86976.description:
User Summary

Very basic graphics and game-play in this Space Invaders variant (with no block houses). Various alien types bounce around above you very erratically, dropping laser bombs, while you sweep left and right, shooting up at them to try and hit them. Try being the operative word, since they move around so rapidly and randomly, it's pot luck if you hit them. Incredibly long on screen instructions for a very low grade game.

Programming by ADAM. Cover painting by Phil Gascoine.

86977.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2
videogamecompilation: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Generations
86977.description:
User Summary

Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2 is a fighting game for the Xbox 360 and PS3. The game has its roots in the Naruto franchise, and allows players to take control of one of 44 characters from the Shippuden universe and fight their way through an engrossing story.

The game is a standard fighting game, with the player taking control of a fighter and engaging in combat 1-on-1 with an opponent. Defeating the opponent advances the player to the next stage. There are a number of features that set Ninja Storm 2 apart, however, including the following:

Engaging Story Mode – Adventure mode places the players in the world of Shippuden, where they can explore the region and re-enact fights from the show, as well as complete sub quests for different characters.

Special Battles – On top of the standard combats that drive Ninja Storm 2, there are a number of specialized battles that add elements to the match, such as fight-exclusive powers, additional stages, quicktime events, and cinematic touches.

Deeper Narratives – There are three main plot threads in the game, each of which is centered around a different character. The different stories each offer a unique perspective on the game and the characters.

Ninja Storm 2 contains 23 interactive stages for players to compete on, and also includes local and online multiplayer capabilities.

86978.name: New Carnival Games
86978.description:
User Summary

New Carnival Games is a family party game for the Wii and DS. Part of the Carnival Games series, this game adds 30 new mini-games, including Fish Bowl Bounce, Gold Rush Alley Ball, and Haunted House. New Carnival Games makes use of the Wii Motion Plus, which allows for a more accurate control in the mini-games. Other elements included in the game are non mini-game attractions such as a fortune teller and claw machine.

86979.name: Bumpy
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
86979.description:
User Summary

Bumpy is a French action puzzle game. The player controls the movements of a bumping head and how high it jumps. The goal is to collect every item on the level to make the passage to the next level appear. Some items are worth bonus points, others are used to deal with obstacles, like water droplets for extinguishing burning platforms, keys to unlock doors (some require more than one key), or hammers to destroy walls. The game has 100 levels and they can be played either sequentially or in random order.

The game includes a two-player mode (hotseat) and a level editor (not on the Amstrad CPC cassette edition though).

86980.name: Midway Campaign
videogameversion: North American Apple II 5-1/4" Floppy Disk edition
North American Apple II/TRS-80/Commodore PET edition
videogamehonor: 1980 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Game Nominee
86980.description:
User Summary:

Midway Campaign simulates the famous mid-1942 air/naval battle of WW2.
Utilizing textual graphics to portray a map of the Midway Island area of the Central Pacific, players control the US forces against computer controlled Japanese forces.

The focus is upon searching for the enemy, readying and launching air strikes and subsequently recovering them.
The goal for the Japanese forces is to reach Midway Island and remain there for a number of turns, thereby signifying a successful invasion and winning the game thusly.

The goal for the US player is to prevent the Japanese side from achieving their objective by sinking enough Japanese aircraft carriers to make them abort their attack.

86981.name: Black Gold
86981.description:
User Summary:

In Black Gold, one to four human or computer players compete to develop oil fields around the world.
Action sequences include drilling, extinguishing fires and building pipelines.
Long-term strategic planning is key to winning, as players seek to control the most lucrative oil fields.

86983.name: Bumpy's Arcade Fantasy
86983.description:
User Summary

Second installment of the Bumpy series by French game editor Loriciels. This time Bumpy goes on vacation to an amusement park. The gameplay has changed a bit: the player still has to bounce Bumpy around platforms to collect all items on the level, but this time there are no special items, but there are many different types of platforms, each with their own effect, moving monsters whose touch is deadly, several types of gates...

The game is split in nine worlds, each split into several levels. Upon completion of a world, a password to the next world is given to the player.

86984.name: Flight Simulator II
86984.description:
User Summary:

A detailed flight simulator, geared toward pilots-in-training, it also includes an easy mode for casual flyers. Several sets of separately sold aeronautical charts cover the entire United States.

86985.name: Caer Darkstone
86985.description:
From the introduction:
The dwarves of Darkstone have had a long, if somewhat checkered history. The halls of Darkstone are ancient and one of the oldest dwarven caers in the world. They have since the beginning mined the dark marbles of the mountain, and unearth the silver mithreal of its deep mines. The riches of the mines has played a strong role in the hall’s history, but even more is the pride and honor of these brown dwarves which has governed their actions and affairs with the rest of the northlands.

86986.name: Ithengar
86986.description:
From the introduction:
The lands of Ithengar have had a hard time, the valley is very fertile and holds access to many mine barring hills and close quarters with the dwarves of the mountain peaks. It is also close to the goblin and monster infested Yarbon hills and the wilds of the west. Thus over the many years it has seen more battles and wars then its share in the north.

86987.name: Glasborg
86987.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The southernmost of the northern realms, it sits along the Dragon's Maul and the High Road out of the eastern realms. The Duchy of Glasborg is a rough place of hard men and bandits.

Everything you need to know about this small realm can be found in this source book: new maps of the realm, noble families, history and politics. If you want a great place for adventure, there is no better choice than Arcana.

Step into adventure and fall in love with Arcana.

86988.name: Borden
86988.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A northern frontier realm, its king is old and the young prince next in line holds a strong reputation as a warrior and adventurer. It is a realm that has over the last few years become more and more dominant in the region.

Everything you need to know about this small realm can be found in this source book. New maps of the realm, noble families, history and politics. If you want a great place for adventure, there is no better choice the Arcana.

Step into adventure and fall in love with Arcana.

86989.name: Slumbering Tsar: The Temple-City of Orcus, Part III: The Harrow Lanes
86989.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Stretching across the center of the city like a jagged scar, The Harrow Lanes block all access to the ways above. To plumb the secrets of the city, the lanes must be surmounted. But this is no easy feat when wheels within wheels set powerful pawns into motion at the hands of chess masters filled with ancient wisdom. What lurks in The Harrow Lanes is something few will live to tell of. This adventure includes the exploration of the many sites within the Harrow Lanes including Mordecai’s Stair, the Cursed Smithy of Larach-Umbriol, the Encampment of the Beast-Fiends, The Khanjar’s Gauntlet, the Cathedral of Pain, and many more.

86990.name: Slumbering Tsar: The Temple-City of Orcus, Part II: The Lower City
86990.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Battered and crushed after a year of war and centuries of abandonment, intrepid explorers find that now all is not restful in the slumbering city. Dark forces gather to man battlements and perhaps even march forth to war once more. The dangers of The Lower City are very much alive and awake as this adventure explores the lowest tenements of the city known as the Grunge and the flooded Dread Marsh.

86991.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 21 - February 1998)
rpg: Men in Black: The Roleplaying Game
rpgpublisher: Sleipner - Landsforeningen af rolle- og konfliktspillere i Danmark

65 Gamle numre (Old issues)
66 Abonnement (Subscription)

86992.description:
Expansion for the base game 'The Aztec Market'.

In November 2010, NESTORGAMES ran a contest on boardgamegeek.com, where the participants had to create new tiles for the original game "The Aztec Market". All of the profits derived from the sales of this expansion will be donated to www.ayudarjugando.org. Ten tiles where selected by Néstor Romeral Andrés (producer) and Victor Melo Barbero (base game designer) to conform this expansion.

NESTORGAMES wants to thank all the participants of this contest. A wonderful group of altruist designers.

The Aztec Market: "Ayudarjugando" expansion includes 10 tiles of the same size as the ones in the original game, and an orange counter.

The tiles:


The Hairdresser, by Joan Ribera.
The Astronomer, by Mark Gerrits.
The Black Market, by Diego Ibañez.
The Pyramids (4 tiles), by Lee Valentine.
The thief, by Lee Valentine.
El trocador, by Sergio Camina.
The Gambler, by Mark Gerrits.
86992.name: The Aztec Market: 'Ayudarjugando' expansion

86993.description:
From the publisher:

Incredible Adventures in Energy Land is a board game created for the employees of Eesti Energia (Estonian Energy) to gain a better insight into the values of the company. It’s a family adventure game combining strategic elements with the luck factor inherent to board games.

The game route has to be created at the beginning of every new game. Thus, the game is always fresh, surprising and visually exciting. With the help from six characters - creatures connected to a certain form of energy - the player has to complete different assignments and answer questions related to different forms of energy by getting reacquainted with the basic knowledge or by learning something new.

The visual language is bright, colorful and playfully modified from different Nordic mythologies. The characters and the Energy Land itself are inspired by all the different energy forms known to man.
86993.name: Uskumatud Seiklused Energiamaal

86994.name: Anima Prime
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Best Free Game - Winner
86994.description:
From the Official Website:

Anima Prime is a fast-paced, spontaneous roleplaying game inspired by the Final Fantasy series of video games as well as Avatar: The Last Airbender and other animated shows and movies.

The game combines narrative freedom in character scenes and combat maneuvers with elemental powers, Soulbound Weapons, and the summoning of Eidolons to allow you to create your own stories and action scenes rivaling those usually seen in video game cut scenes and anime battles. A flexible goal system lets you infuse any fight with meaningful story decision points and unlimited tactical options.

86995.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 14 - December 1996)
rpgpublisher: Sleipner - Landsforeningen af rolle- og konfliktspillere i Danmark

86996.name: Kings Court
86996.description:
Kings Court is a Western Chess variant played on a large 8X12 board.

The game incorporates the standard array of King, Queen, 2 knights, 2 bishops and 2 rook.

Kings Court then adds two Chancellor and two jester pieces.

From the game company's website:

THE CHANCELLOR-Has two possible moves (1) it can move one or two square in any direction. (2) it can move one square on the rank or file and then while still moving away from the square from which it started, moves one square on the diagonals. This is not a line move but a move from point to point and can not be obstructed by any other piece. See figure 1.

THE JESTER- Moves one or two squares on the diagonals. Unlike the Bishop the Jester can change directions while in motion, if desired. It may not return to the square from which it stared in the same move. See figure 2. For the first move from its initial square the jester may jump two square diagonally. All pieces with the exception of the Pawn, capture in the way it can legally move.

The King is also afforded an additional special move;

KING'S FLIGHT- is a move made by the King when in check by the Chancellor. The move is executed by moving the King two squares in any direction instead of its usual one square.

86997.name: Spartan Chess
86997.description:
Spartan chess is a chess variant played on a standard 8x8 chess board. The two sides have pieces and pawns with different characteristics and capabilities. Such differences you would expect between opponents on an actual ancient battlefield.

The Black side represents the Spartans and the White the Persians. The Persians have pawns, pieces, an initial placement, and move in accord with the rules of orthodox chess.

The Spartans have two Kings and with the exception of their Kings, every Spartan playing piece moves differently from any piece found in orthodox chess.

Spartan Chess Features:
• A Persian army (white) identical to that of orthodox chess
• A Spartan army led by two Kings
• Spartan pawns (hoplites) that move differently than orthodox pawns
• Spartan pieces that move differently than any found in orthodox chess

86998.name: White Wolf Quarterly (Volume 2.3 - Summer 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Best of the Best: Inquest Gamer picks VTES as all-time best multiplayer CCG
Blood on the Streets: Laying the foundations for Vampire: The Requiem fiction
Fueling the Creative Spark: Players Lead the Way in the year of Fire
Howlings: News and Notes from White Wolf Game Studio
The new World of Darkness rulebook: Step into the Shadows
Savant and Sorcerer: Redefining Sorcery for Exalted
86998.description: Cover art is from the World of Darkness rulebook.

86999.description:
Hell's Corner is an ASL historical study released as an insert in Operations Special Magazine #3. It covers the battles that occured along the Matanikau River on Guadalcanal from August to October 1942.

There are five scenarios:


"First Matanikau" is the Marines attempt to secure Matanikau Village shortly after their landing on Guadalcanal.
"Bailey's Demise" recounts the failed attempt by the Marines to dislodge the Japanese from the west bank of the Matanikau.
"Samurai Sunset" features a trapped Japanese Company trying to break out of an encirclement to friendly lines on the west bank of the Matanikau.
"Whaling Good Time" has a group of marines attempting to expand the bridgehead on the Matanikau against a small Japanese rearguard.
"The Sand Spit" depicts a fresh group of Japanese reinforcements with armored support attempting to break the Marine defenses near Matanikau.
86999.name: Hell's Corner

87000.name: Wallace & Gromit's Grand Adventures - Episode 1: Fright of the Bumblebees
87000.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Wallace attempts to save his bumbling honey business, through the growth of extra large flowers. When these giant flowers lead to an unintended consequence - giant bees! Gromit steps in to save the town from the angry swarm.
